Then came my Penang Curry with Tofu which was very good. Unfortunately my wife had to wait for her Seared Scallops with cabbage for quite a while and consequently her rice was cold. She enjoyed the Scallops but........food good but not outstanding and the service was questionable.

Well, the "American Spicy" vs "Thai Spicy" convergence point has finally been met. Spiciest food (I had the pork larb @ 7) in years. Be careful here, the 1-10 scale is serious. Good traditional offerings at the back of the menu under Northern Thai. 

Service is a bit surly, they're really trying to turn tables over here quickly.

Mango sticky rice was the perfect end to a great meal.

Went back a second time the night before Thanksgiving.  Continues to provide a wonderful experience for your taste buds.  Order the northern cuisine people!  Every trip to Vegas will include a trip to LoS for us.

Went for first time tonight. We didn't make a reservations. Big mistake.  Waited 1 1/2 hours, but well worth the wait.  The best Thai restaurant I've ever eaten at. An incredible menu.  Much more than the standard Thai fare.  Service was typical for an Asian restaurant, but everyone was very friendly. When in Las Vegas, this is the place to go for Thai food.  It's in a dumpy strip mall, but you're going for the food.

What a phenomenal place! My cousin brought me here when I was visiting Vegas from the east coast.  It's located in a quiet shopping center, I couldn't believe how busy the restaurant was until I stepped inside.   
So we got their famous garlic prawns - definitely remarkable, so flavorful and perfectly cooked, you can't get this anywhere else!   The crispy duck with penang curry was so good - the duck meat was tender with crispy skin in the flavorful penang sauce.   Pad thai was the best pad thai I've ever had.  
This place gets really busy even on week nights, make sure to call for reservation.
I wish I could have stayed in Vegas for longer and come back a few more times to try other dishes on their menu.  I'll definitely return when I come to Vegas next time!

What's wrong with getting the flu in a James Beard rated restaurant? Ruining the meal for the table sitting next to you. Guys, I am so sorry. Let this be a lesson to ALWAYS GET YOUR FLU SHOT. I've been here many times and the food is awesome. Though nothing compares to the level of service of the nicest hostess tending to you when you suddenly develop symptoms in the middle of the dining room. I am so sorry. Lotus of Siam remains, in my opinion, the best Thai in the country.

When members of my family came to town, they solicited the help of me. My years with Yelp gave them full trust to come to me with recommendations around the valley. On one of those nights, everyone was in the mood for Asian food, so I decided to take them here. I've taken food out of this place before but never really sat in and ordered. What a great opportunity!

This place is located in a very weird shopping center. Lots of different shops and bars, to say the least. There are a couple of gay bars, a swingers club and a lot of Asian food joints. Also remember that if you don't make reservations days before, they will not take reservations that day and you will have to wait. A long time. For a party of 10, we were quoted up to 2 hours and ended up waiting an hour and 15 minutes. The waiting room is pretty tight but filled with awards, reassuring you that this place was going to be the bomb! The service was great. They were efficient, didn't say much, but got us what we needed in a quick timely manner. The place was a little drab. Dark carpets and wooden paneling made for an outdated look. The main focal point however, was a wall full of wine. An actual wine cabinet filled with hundreds of bottles. Super dramatic and awesome! There's also a bar down the ramp inside, so you can drink something while you wait for your table. 

For dinner, me and my party decided on the following:

Garlic Black Pepper Chicken Wings for $8.95: Wings seasoned with garlic, black pepper and other seasonings. The garlic was prominent in this dish and made the wings soo delicious. One of my favorite things that evening!

Moo Yang for $14.95. Marinated charbroiled pork served with spice sauce. This is always my go to dish. The pork chop was super tender, the sweet marinade and the sauce really seemed to enhance the dish. HIGHLY RECOMMEND this if you like pork.

Chicken Pad Se-ew for $9.95. Stir-fried wide rice noodles with eggs and Chinese broccoli with black soy sauce. This was the best Pad Se-ew I've ever had! The flat noodles were soft but not mushy, the sauce was mild and salty and really made that dish pop out!

Pork Drunken Noodles for $9.95. Pan fried flat rice noodle topped with, sautéed choice of meat with fresh & dry chili, Thai basil, served on beds of greens. I loved the basil in this dish. It brought a clean flavor to the overall taste. 

All dishes were served family style and was awesome! People always talk about this place as being great. You really need to try this out, for sure! I remember waiting in the front at the beginning of the night and everyone that kept coming in, made a comment like, "this place is in a sketchy neighborhood, but trust me the food is out of this world." It's not until you experience it yourself that you will truly believe that statement. If you're ever in the neighborhood, don't pass it. Stop, and give it a try. You will NOT be disappointed!

When we have visitors, they always want to go here because for them it is a real treat! I don't disagree. The food is great! We are always happy to make this the spot to meet and visit!

Do I think it is the best Thai in the city, I have to be honest. No, I don't.

But they have some great dishes! Crispy Duck! YES!
The scallops are amazing! Noodle dishes are pretty great as well.

I know everyone is crazy about the Garlic Prawns. Our order was 25% shrimp and 75% fried shrimp shells. Which our waiter assured us were edible and delicious. Not a fan of them. Sorry. 

The service has always been A+ since we have been going. 
Words of wisdom- MAKE A RESERVATION!! The wait can be a hour+

No matter how you look, always fun to bring people to a place that has been on so many TV Shows, and frequented by both local and world celebs!

Who knew I would have a compelling reason to go to Vegas just to get Thai food, something that I could literally find every few blocks where I live.

But before you get excited to visit this place, you'll have to find it. You really can't see the restaurant from the street, but once you turn into a plaza and notice a huge empty parking lot, you are definitely getting warmer. 

I went with a lot of choices as advised by yelpers- the prawns with drunken noodles, the crispy duck in panang curry (it's been weeks since I've been but the name has stuck with me) and the last was a beef dish that I don't quite remember the name. The prawns were gigantic and cooked with such a nice crunch to them. The noodles that comes with it is a perfect accompaniment, even with your white rice! I also loved loved loved the duck. Great crunch on the skin and the curry had a reasonable kick to it- loaded with flavor. Both of these dishes I would no doubt get again. The beef dish- while the beef was cooked nicely was not a favorite of mine. It was doused in something that resembled BBQ sauce that I wasn't a huge fan of (and notice how I said doused, they probably put too much on the meat).

All in all, it was a delicious meal. It is on the pricier side for lunch but, I personally think it is worth every penny. Don't be shy and ask for more rice if you need something to soak up all that curry. Truly a 5 star for me!

With so many reviews, I'm not sure I can add anything that hasn't already been said.  

It I could only eat at one Thai restaurant the rest of my life, this would be the place. The Pad Thai is perfect, not overly sweet like you find at too many places.  The curry dishes have are more complex than I've had at any other place.  The shrimp are always fresh, good size and perfectly cooked.  I can't believe I waited so long to try the crispy duck panang curry - will never get chicken @ LOS again!  

The service is not as good as the food - but if ever a restaurant deserves five star, this is it.

Worth the wait!
Came here because of my foodie friend's string recommendation on a  Friday night.  Arrived about 15 minutes before Lotus of Siam's 5:30 PM opening time.  Got our party of 4 seated right away.  So many delicious choices.  The waiter was helpful in making our selections.  The scallops, shrimp, and satay were absolutely delicious.  The Yelp reviews were also helpful.  Definitely coming back - this place is less than 5 miles off the strip.  Easy can ride.

Worthy of the hype! Here are my suggestions:

1. Make a reservation, or you're sure to wait about an hour (yes, even on a random Monday night).
2. Order the drunken shrimp! Huge, juicy, flavorful shrimp with flat noodles. 
3. Spice levels are normal/reasonable, go with your gut! 
4. Dress casually; hella people come from the strip in taxis dressed like they're going to a $$$$ restaurant, but that's not necessary! 

Service is really nice and of course, the pad thai is also great. It's famous, you might as well give it a shot!

Wow this place did not disappoint at all and was better than I expected.  Came with a decent sized group so we got to try a few dishes and almost all of them were really good.  The dishes came out faster than I expected which was great since we have impatient little kids.  Make reservations b/c this place is crazy busy on the weekends.

Recommended:
Seabass in drunken noodles
khao soi
Thai Beef Salad
Garlic Shrimp
Thum Ka Noon - jackfruit with pork

Decent:
Softshell crab with drunken noodles: too little crab
Crispy duck penang - Crispy duck is good but penang curry is like any other red curry at other places
Nua yum katiem - spicy and not as good as the other beef salad
Nam Kao tod - good flavors but not the best appetizer

Wow, how have I not written a review for this place yet?

You can't go wrong with any dish here, which is what makes this restaurant so great. I'll admit, not every dish is amazing, but at least you won't be stuck with something yucky. It all just comes down to how much you love Thai food.

The wait is typically fairly long (waited 1 hour last time for a table for 3 on a Sunday night), but this time we only waited 15 minutes for a table on a Friday night. Luckily, tables for 2 typically get seated much quicker.

We ordered:
- Panang Curry: The curry had really good flavor, but I thought it was kind of plain. They don't give you any additional vegetables.

- Pad Thai: The noodles are different from your norm (they're thinner), but the flavor is good. I got mine with fried tofu and the fried tofu is really yummy! I normally don't like meats with my pad thai because they are normally made dry, but next time, I'll definitely try it with chicken. I don't think Lotus of Siam will disappoint.

- Mango Sticky Rice: THE BEST PART OF THE MEAL.This is the best mango sticky rice I've had. The rice is not actually too sticky and is made perfectly! MUST TRY.

Wow, was Lotus of Siam excellent! Wonderful service, the most extensive list of German wines I've seen outside of Germany (and what could go better with Thai food than German wine?) and outstanding food, the best Thai I've ever had. The northern Thai sausage was my favorite item, followed closely by the eggplant and mushroom appetizer. Lots of complex flavors expertly developed. My thanks to Anthony Bourdain for the recommendation.

Yes indeed this is the best Thai restaurant in North America. Does it have some fame and press with all those famous chefs and celebrities that frequent this place, Yes, but it delivers in quality, creativeness and authenticity. Its not cheap since you are paying a little bit for its reputation and fame but the food is great. A must when you are in Vegas. Go before 6:30pm to avoid the long lines. If you are new to Thai food and are the adventurous type, just ask the waiters to order for you. Tell them your likes and dislikes and approximately how much you want to spend and let them take care of it. It is the most fun way to eat.

Yes, it is located in a shopping strip in an older part of town, but do not hesitate to go. The server was so kind and gracious, the curry was some of the best I have ever tasted, and the value was unbelievable.  Even if you think you don't like Thai, you're going to love this place.

Yes, the location is a bit sketchy, lock your doors or park near one of the Bentleys (really).

Yes, it's crowded and noisy, the line is usually long and they don't pick up the phone...

And yes, it is the best Thai food you will ever eat! The food here will replace your previous perceptions of what good Thai food is, to the point that the mediocrity everywhere else will become unacceptable.

Be careful of the 1-10 heat scale, it's real!

If you don't like flavor and texture, this is not the place for you. Bland is not on the menu (except for white rice).

You guys have heard all the hype. All the awards, national media attention, the famous chefs of the world saying how great this place it. Now after a couple of visits I can confirm with all of them, LoS was probably one of the best meals of my life!

I've read a lot of reviews about many of the other Thai places in town. And, a lot of people would rather chose those spots to eat at, rather than go to LoS which they feel is overhyped. I've been to a lot of those places as well.. So what's the conclusion? I don't think this place is overhyped at all. I believe that LoS deserves every single accolade it has received. It probably deserves more..

Places like Komol, Weera Thai, Pan Asian, Archi's etc. etc., they make really good, in fact, they make really great Thai food! LoS is completely on an entirely different level. For example, take the classic, drunken noodles. At all the great Thai restaurants, they all make excellent versions of this dish, and they each have a common trait that says "this is drunken noodles." At LoS, it still says  "this is drunken noodles", but it's totally different from every one I've ever had in my life. And, I mean different in a totally amazing, uniquely personal, life changing sort-of-way... That goes for EVERY dish on the menu. Also, if you haven't had the crispy prawns, do try them, quite possibly the best thing I've eaten this year (them prawn shells..)

Whenever I eat at a restaurant, I always come in with an open mind regardless of what others have experienced, positive or negative. This restaurant isn't just one of the best restaurants in Vegas or the entire country, this is a world class restaurant. This restaurant will continue to rack up the accolades, and deservedly so. Well done Lotus of Siam.. Well done!

everything was really good. the garlic prawns, 
duck, 
pad thai, 
and wonton soup are things i would recommend.

there was a long wait (about an hour), so i would suggest making a reservation.

food tasty
inside decor outdated and feels dirty
garlic prawns was the best
duck curry was good
pad thai noodle taste like sweet sour sauce/every dish was delicious,but only this dish was very dispointed,

went for dinner with 7 people tonight. the place was like a complete circus.
it was very noisy, the waitstaff were rude and unfriendly and it seemed as
Though Their own culture were getting service. our food was cold and had to
Be reheated and interestingly enough they threw the18  percent tip on at the 
End. there has to be better thai food in LV, and to be quite frank. This place
Needs an overhaul and clearly they have grandiose thinking that they are
So great because of prior ratings. I definitely would not waste my time and money.


Very disappointing........
yes, it's good. and yes, the prawns are good.
season1

,,]beccause other thai rest. in usa i taste,all lousy,only this one ok,all other food ok for me,but pad thai noodle was very lousy,taste like sweet sour noodle  and crab fryrice  only one  piece small tiny crab like quarter/do not go lunch ,they charge same price anyway,my  my commen  /dinner 4 star lunch sorry only 2 star/

1.5 hours of waiting if you don't RSVP. This was on a Monday night too. Luckily the fiance RSVP'd and we scurried past everyone.

The area its located in seems sketchy. It's like the scene of a drug deal in a movie outside a billiards bar. With everything looking closed, I wasn't even sure the restaurant was open if it wasn't for a few anonymous black jacketed patrons hanging outside of their door. As soon as I parked and got out of the car, I got hit up by a random stranger on a bicycle if he can clean my car for money. I said no thanks and rushed my family to the restaurant.

It gets better inside after seeing warmth and kind faces. At first glance the restaurant looks rather confined, like a San Francisco or New York restaurant that struggles with optimizing its square footage. Little did I know, there's a backroom and getting there felt like the infamous Goodfellas scene, walking through corridors and into a whole other adventure.

Food wise I ordered the house special fried rice, the tom kha gai, chop suey, and the garlic prawns based on other yelpers' thoughts.

All money. For sure the Garlic Prawns is a must. For me I loved the house special friend rice a lot because they did tomato fried rice with justice. It's surprisingly on the oily side so not everyone in my family enjoyed it like I did. Chop suey was also done right and if it wasn't for the price, I would order it over any other restaurant's. 

Other yelpers noted the dirty dishes. My experience was no exception as I had to ask for a new clean plate.

Damage was around $60. Good for a date and food for the family every now and then but too rich for my blood.

100% amazing in every way. The staff was a team and I have never EVER received such efficient service. The food was amazing, and very reasonably priced. No wonder there was a line at the door. Just make sure to order a little less spicy than you think. My girlfriend likes spicy and ordered a 7, I like a little and ordered a 3. Both were too much for us. But so soooo good.

1:40 waiting. No food at bar. Great wine selection. Great prices. Food ok. Not worth the wait though. You can find tastier thai food without all the fuzz. I could return anyway. All the waiters seems to be from Thailand. Food arrived cold at the table. Only the soup was hot.

1st time there.  It is a little challenging to find, but turn into the plaza and keep turning to your right.

I was there with a large group, so I did not get to choose what I had.  The Garlic fried shrimp were incredible as were the beef and chicken potstickers.  The pad thai was very good as well.

Will have to go back with to see how it is for just a few people

5 stars for food, 2 stars for the incredibly long painful wait for a table.

This is one of the best Thai restaurants in the USA. Authentic and delicious. The place was buzzing and overly busy during Project trade show. 

Started with Sigha beer then Chang beer waiting for 1.5 hours for a table. Worth the wait yes.

The Northern Thai dishes are incredible. (This is their speciality).

Started with Tod Mun Plar - fried fish cakes and they are yummy. Also spicy chicken wings which are some of the spiciest I have had in a while and delicious too!

Then comes the Tom Yum Koong soup - hot and sour shrimp soup with lime and lemongrass also amazing.

For entree I had issan style grilled pork sausage with chili and peanuts, one of my go to dishes when it's on the menu in any Thai place. Nua yum Katiem was outstanding, this dish is sliced beef served with cabbage tangy sauce and smothered with fresh garlic, drool worthy!

This place is off the beaten path, not on the strip but 100% worth a cab ride to eat in this hidden gem.

A group of us shared some dishes and we all enjoyed everything.  The crispy duck dish seemed to be favored.  The short ribs were great.   The yellow and red curries were delicious.  Except I got a very spicy pepper when eating the red.  So be careful.   It was packed on Friday night, so try to call for a reservation.
Absolutely the best meal ive ever had. The garlic shrimp is to die for. Weird location. But food is delicious. Cant wait to go back to Vegas!!!!

Actually, service is a 3.5  but food is a 2. Took 3 friends to dinner on 1/14/15. The restaurant was busy from the get go. Being a Thai who is also proficient with Chinese, Japanese, French, and Italian cuisine, I fail to see why this restaurant receives such rave reviews. We order 3 starters and 6 main dishes. Only the following met my expections: Isaan sausage, roast duck curry, and the starter Crispy noodle. The taste was authentic. Everything else was for people who do not know real Thai food. for example, you cannot cook a catfish with Thai holly basil without the holly basil. It is truly a shame. The Pork sate has no resemblance to what the real pork sate is in all over Thailand.
The Isaan soup without any of the Isaan herbs can never be accepted. The Northen pork curry did not taste like anything I had in Northen Thailand. Very unfortunate. On the plus side, the service from the wine stewardess and the food servers were very efficient. We bought a good bottle of red, ordered a bottle of German white and they waived the $25 corkage fee, which is very nice. Not sure what to recommend on Thai restaurants in Vegas. Based on my personal experience, there are extremely few Real Thai restaurants in the country. Look for a place with the majority of clientele being Asians/Thai. Although, most Thais don't eat out in Thai restaurants simply because of the reason I mention mention above.
Good eating.

After extensive research, I retained Zach Parry to resolve a securities fraud case filed with the largest securities dispute resolution forum in the United States.  The case was first initiated on my own and I took it as far as I could go without legal help given that the opposing party had at attorney who was an expert in securities arbitration. 
 
Zach came to the rescue; he had a terrific educational background with a BS from Brigham Young University and a law degree from the University of Illinois.  He also had broad legal skills including handling cases in fraud litigation and arbitration.  I was very pleased how quickly he got up to speed on my case.  His case filings were excellent in representing my case and the respondents realized the best strategy was to settle the case.  Through direct negotiations he again legally supported my side on many issues and through his strong negotiating, Mr. Parry received the highest settlement I could have expected to receive.  During the process he was easy to work with always seeking my input and educating me on my options.  I highly recommend Zach Parry; he is a multi-skilled attorney as he so well demonstrated on my case.

After hearing about Lotus of Siam from Anthony Bourdain and seeing the glowing reviews here on Yelp, I knew that a meal here must be a part of my visit to Las Vegas. 

Located in a nondescript lot that would make one easily forget the glitz and glamor that are synonymous with Las Vegas. It was rather sketchy, not just by its looks but in actuality, if one were to go with Lotus of Siam and the Las Vegas police's notice to their patrons that asks them not to leave valuables in cars. We came twenty minutes after they opened for Saturday lunch, and there was already a fifteen-minute wait. The waiting area is rather intimate and I was truly thankful that we were able to sit in there instead of having to wait outside and experience the dry desert heat (already in the mid-80's at around 11 AM). However, we took advantage of this little wait to look up their menu and see what looks particularly appetizing.

The staff was incredibly friendly and were evidently used to handling their many visitors. We hardly had to wait for anything during our visit: the water glasses were refilled promptly, the food arrived in about ten minutes, and the check was given to us within five minutes of finishing our meal. Really, if I was a little nervous about grumpy service due to their popularity, my nervousness was misplaced.

Now to the food. For our appetizer, we tried the tod mun plar, which is a popular Thai street food. It was delicious. We were able to taste the fish without getting that unpleasant fishy flavor lingering in our palate after consumption. Even the daughter, who is not a fan of fish that does not come in fish and chips form, enjoyed the tod mun plar. It was a great omen for the rest of our meal.

For entrée, we had the northern larb, kang care, and crispy duck with panang sauce to eat with their combination fried rice. Everything was perfectly spiced and absolutely delicious. The northern larb is on the spicy side, so if you are not into spicy, maybe skip it. But if you like spicy food that offer complexity of flavors that go beyond the piquant, the northern larb will not disappoint. The kang care also delivered  and may be one of the best curries I have ever had.

The crispy duck with panang sauce from the chef's selection was undeniably the star of our meal. It was pricey, but it worked hard for every single cent of our hard-earned money. The duck was seasoned well and cooked perfectly that it did not get soggy even if it sat in the sauce it came with. But that sauce was unforgettable. It was very flavorful and just fantastic. My cousin and I had a "friendly" argument, which I lost, as to who can take the sauce home to eat with just plain steamed rice. Seriously, it was so delicious, I would be happy to eat that with nothing else but steamed rice for days on end and call myself a lucky girl. That good.

The fried rice was good, but I would suggest settling for steamed rice instead because it is rather heavy. I would prefer eating more of their delicious entrée rather than fried rice. While it did not disappoint, I was rather resentful of our choice to order it because I should have known better, what with my limited stomach space and all.

The food is on the pricey side and the servings are on the small side, but if you are in Las Vegas and want to go beyond the buffets they are justifiably famous for and want to go where locals go, do go to Lotus of Siam.

After watching the episode of Anthony Bourdain's visit to Lotus of Siam, I was completely psyched about finally experiencing the restaurant for myself first hand. We were lucky enough to walk into the restaurant at 6:00pm on a Friday night as a group of three with no reservations and get seated immediately.

After perusing through over a 150 choices, I ultimately decided to start off with the Bangkok style tom kha kai and a Thai iced tea. I typically order this soup at every Thai restaurant that I attend, not only because it is a guilty pleasure of mine, but also because it serves as an excellent baseline comparison. With that being said, I was certainly disappointed with this dish. Obviously lime is a crucial element of tom kha kai, but this level of lime was excruciatingly overpowering, so much so that the lime was entirely the focus of the dish. The decision to use button mushrooms in the soup, instead of straw mushrooms also bothered me since button mushrooms are almost as substandard as shiitakes. 

Anyways, after finishing the tom kha kai I ignored the formation of any previous negative judgements, and ordered the chef's choice: the crispy duck with panang. The duck was placed atop the curry in a strategic effort to maintain the crispness of the skin, and it did just that. The duck was decadent, however, the panang was actually the highlight of the dish: spicy, creamy, well-balanced and delicious with both the rice and duck.

Ultimately, I highly recommend skipping the tom kha kai as I am sure that there are much better starters on the menu. As others have stated, please don't even bother to order the pad thai, there is seriously no excuse. Although I've notice some complaints from other Yelpers, the crispy duck with panang was worth the high price point. The dish fortunately provided a much needed redemption from the letdown of the tom kha kai. I'll certainly visit again to order more Northern dishes.

All other thai food is inferior to this restaurant. 

Sizzling Duck Panang Curry. Just order it!

It's in the most unimpressive location. Small doors open to a palace of Thai deliciousness. 

Well worth the wait. I just need to bribe the hostess to always leave me a reserved table.

Service A
Food     A

All that I can say is wow the reviews are spot on can't tell from the outside that this is one of the best restaurants in the city every thing was prepared to perfection and the service was perfect will be back.

Amazing amazing amazing, its the best Thai I've ever had. The crispy duck is a must have. So sad I'm leaving Vegas tmrw.


Strongly recommend to come early (like before 6 pm)
The waiting time can be as long as 2 hours!

Amazing food and period. Not heavy seasoning yet flavor really comes out all the way(not salty, not sweet). One of the wonders of this place is vegi. I dont know how they make Vegi taste so freshly even if they are cooked! I know for sure this place is one of the best Thai restaurant in the state and there is no doubt about it. Yet service wansnt 5 stars that is why I am leaving 4 stars here. Waiting water for 5 minutes and ask some sauce at the beginning  yet didn't get served until the last bite. Even if restaurant wasn't too busy because  it was lunch time. One more thing, since Thai is known as country of beautiful smile, I wish I could get food with service of little bit of smile seasoned with.
Amazing thai food. The location is a little suspect but once inside the restaurant is nice. I recommend the prawns and crispy rice. I can't wait to go back to try more dishes.

Amazing. You have no clue from the outside. Blacked out windows and a little "open" sign. You walk into a restaurant that is spacious and pumps out amazing food in copious quantities to maybe a hundred diners. Food is as good as it gets from a 12 page menu cooked by a Thai master. If you are in Vegas you have to try. Not inexpensive but worth every penny.

An overdue review to add to the thousands of reviews.

They give you a 1-10 spice ratio. 7 is very very spicy. Get a 5 if you like spice but still want flavor.

We got the Tom Yum Soup, Glass Noodles, Khao Soi, and Red Curry. Everything was excellent except the Glass Noodles were only average. The Khao Soi is soooo good though.

Portions are small, so yes we had to order 4 dishes for 2 people.

Anthony Bourdain recently featured Lotus of Siam on his TV show: thank you Mr. Bourdain! This place is great. Stellar food. Best pad thai I ever had. I had the pork khao soi, and adored it. It had very delicate egg noodles that I have to assume were created that same day, in a savory curry-ish broth. Our kids, usually picky eaters, loved the fried rice and satay. The location is a nightmare: this restaurant is found in a super sketchy strip mall off the Strip. I was really glad we went for an early meal and were able to leave before the sun set. The service was pleasant and efficient: they keep things moving. It was quite busy. We showed up without a reservation on a Tuesday night around 6 p.m. and were told it would be a 30 minute wait: instead, I opted to make a reservation for the next day, and there were very few open time slots. Great price tag at the end. I have spent way, way more in Vegas for way, way less. Do not pass up on this gem.

As far as Thai fair goes, this place definitely does the job. The food was in no way exceptional, but it was very satisfying in a way that one would expect from any decent Thai joint.
The Panang Curry was very tasty and cleared my sinuses nicely.
What stood out to me most was the setting; situated in a derelict strip mall near DTLV, it seems like everyone who is occupying the very crowded dining room is in on a little local secret. 
Oh yeah, and the price is right. $50 for an appetizer, two entrees and two beers.

As good as advertised. Started with the egg rolls, and they were on point. Next we had the spicy vegetable soup. Got 6/10 spicy, but tasted 9/10 due to the amount of chili oil. Still, good flavor with lots of fresh veggies. For entrees, had both the fried tofu and crispy duck panang curries. The duck was exceptionally tasty. A must have. We also had the Thai tea (coconut milk based) and was also exceptional. Not too sweet and it balanced the spice in the curries. Atmosphere was comfortable, good prices, very hospitable service, and quick and efficient service. Highly recommended.
As someone who lived in Thailand for a year this place taste like my second home it's amazing and the best thai food I have had in the USA!  :)

Attended this restaurant following a work conference. It was highly recommend and for good reason. We shared multiple dished between five of us. Every bite was delicious. Along with everyone else I highly recommend the Garlic Prawns. Spicy sea bass was also fantastic. Large wine selection. Bar was very knowledgeable and assisted with a good recommendation. This will become a favorite spot while I am in town for future visits.

Awful service... They did not seat us at the terrace, although we arrived earlier. Instead sat some "important guests" that arrived after us. My kids did not enjoy the show. The wait was absurd... They don't care about the clients. We felt TERRIBLE!!!! not recommended at all!!!

BEST THAI FOOD IN LAS VEGAS, hands down!

I first heard about this place on yelp, because I was curious on what Thai restaurant in Vegas had the highest reviews, and it was this one!

Location: hidden in an unpopular plaza, and the sign saying "lotus of Siam" is quite outdated. From the outside it looks very small, but don't be fool, the restaurant is way bigger than it looks!

Interior: signs and many awards of the glorious food. And many celebrity photos hung around the walls. Also, they have carpet that is kept super clean! I didn't see one big stain at all! Once you enter you'll see a huge glass window, which they store their wines. Pretty cool I might say. 

Food: For the entrees, I got the chicken pad Thai ($10.95) and chicken panang ($12.95) which comes with one bowl of rice. 

Chicken Pad Thai ($10.95): seriously the best I've ever ate! They don't disappoint. Everything tasted so fresh and they had a good ratio between the noodles, meat, and veggies. Other Thai restaurants they put too much green sprouts in the noodle and/or they put too much eggs or cook the egg weird. They made sure everything tasted perfectly. 

Chicken panang ($12.95): I was super excited to try this. I got a 3/10 for spice level since I don't like too spicy. I tasted this curry, and it's by far the best curry I ever had. The curry wasn't too thick and it was at an accurate, mild spice. I definitely would get this every time I go there! It's a must have!

Fried bananas ($8.50): i was nervous that the fried part of the banana would be overbearing and make me sick but it totally didn't. The fried bananas aren't oily at all. It came out crispy and they added shredded coconut in the fried bananas also. They lightly put powdered sugar and caramel sauce on it. Definitely a great way to end my meal! 

Thai tea ($2.50): Thai tea at other places are way too sweet but this place didn't make me feel like I was gonna have diabetes. The Thai tea tasted heavenly. The creamer that they put in their Thai tea definitely makes their drink stand out from other restaurants. 

Service: I made reservations at 7:30pm on a Monday night. We got sat down right when we came inside and once we ordered our food, we received it within 10-15mins! Not a long wait at all! I like how they were smiling and always refilling our waters without us asking them. This restaurant was busy, but they were running things very smoothly. I ended up giving a few more dollars in tips because of their service :]

Cons: Entrees are pretty pricey for small portions and I didn't like how they gave us the check right when we got our desserts. I felt very rushed and agitated since there were several people waiting for a table. 

Overall, GREAT FOOD AND SERVICE! I love lotus of Siam!

Fried bananas ($8.50): i was nervous that the fried part of the banana would be overbearing and make me sick but it totally didn't. The fried bananas aren't oily at all. It came out crispy and they added shredded coconut in the fried bananas also. They lightly put powdered sugar and caramel sauce on it. Definitely a great way to end my meal! 

Thai tea ($2.50): Thai tea at other places are way too sweet but this place didn't make me feel like I was gonna have diabetes. The Thai tea tasted heavenly. The creamer that they put in their Thai tea definitely makes their drink stand out from other restaurants. 

Service: I made reservations at 7:30pm on a Monday night. We got sat down right when we came inside and once we ordered our food, we received it within 10-15mins! Not a long wait at all! I like how they were smiling and always refilling our waters without us asking them. This restaurant was busy, but they were running things very smoothly. I ended up giving a few more dollars in tips because of their service :]

Cons: Entrees are pretty pricey for small portions and I didn't like how they gave us the check right when we got our desserts. I felt very rushed and agitated since there were several people waiting for a table. 

Overall, GREAT FOOD AND SERVICE! I love lotus of Siam!!

Been trying to go here for years. If I don't have a reservation on the weekend the wait is at least an hour. 

Went the take out route. Food is really good. It's in a seedy part of Vegas but is world renowned. When u walk in there are celebs and food critics pics all over the walls. Glad I was able to experience it.

Best Northern Thai cuisine I've ever had. With a wine list that reads more like a laundry list of must-haves rather a simple selection of accompanying beverages and a menu that could be a manuscript of all things delicious; Lotus is a must-have both the local resident and the discerning out-of-towner.
Best Thai West of the Rockies!
Best Thai food I ever had. Will go back again for sure. I read some reviews that people wait for 4 hour for a table, so we went to around 9pm last night, it only took 15 min-20min waiting time
Best Thai food I have ever had. Be sure to make reservations other wise you will be waiting for hours. Can't go wrong with any dish, the popular choice is garlic prawns.

Best Thai food I've ever had in my life! Really lives up to the hype. It's also one of the only Thai restaurants I've been to that offers Northern Thai dishes. Garlic prawns are a must. 

Arrive early or be prepared to wait for a longgg time!
Best Thai food I've ever had in my life. I would drive to Vegas from San Diego just to eat here.

Best Thai food i have ever had. If you are craving Thai food you really need not go any place else in Vegas. I sampled their pad Thai and what I had was properly treated ingredients with a flawless execution. Minus half one star for the ambiance. Looks a bit dated.
Best Thai food in Las Vegas Hands down. May be a wait but there is a reason why and its worth it everytime.

Best Thai food in Las Vegas......everything is delicious, my only BUTS are service and location.....restaurant is not very cozy or nice, and parking lot is very ghetto but I do really love the food......the dishes that have charbroiled steak are outstanding!
Best Thai food in Vegas. Best pad thai I have ever had in my life. Flawless. Love this place!!!!!
Best Thai place in the country no question! Some must try dishes are the beef tendon soup, crispy garlic prawn, and crispy duck over drunken noodles

Best Thai restaurant I've ever been to. Might be the only one I've ever given a 5 star review to. The fact that it was a full house on a Tuesday ought to give you an idea of how good the food is. Yelpers didn't let me down with the Garlic Prawn and Crispy Duck Panang recommendations. Will definitely return next time I visit Vegas.

Best Thai restaurant hands down. Where do I even begin!? We arrived during dinner rush, but honestly they're probably busy at any hour since it's been featured on Food Network, among other places. It is handy that they had iPads set up to where they can text you when they're ready to seat your party. There is also a bar area and a waiting room so you don't have to wait outside. Before dinner, we grabbed beers and Thai tea to drink in the waiting room while being able to sit and relax inside. They have photos of celebrities from movie stars to Food Network shows all over their walls, and the owner of the restaurant which was also the chef, popularly walked around to tables with which seemed to be many regulars praising him and greeting him. Our table was ready and we ordered the prawns which seemed to be most popular on all of the tables, and a duck noodle. Mind you, I'm not a fan of duck but it was crisp and fried to perfection in the most perfect sauce. The prawns were huge and flavorful. We also had a steak dish that came with a small sauce that is to die for. What had me was that they offer the Laos papaya salad that not many other places do. We ordered a spice level of 10 and we were dying but it was literally perfection. Everything was extremely good. I was disappointed to find out that they were out of mango sticky rice, so we settled for a fried banana and ice cream, which tasted similar to Filipino banana lumpia, but they were cut up into small pieces for an easier family style and small portioning. Guaranteed I will visit this place every time I go to Vegas. You won't be let down!

Best Thai restaurant in the U.S. Come early because the longer you wait, the longer the line is. Please only order the northern thia dishes, they are located in the back of the menu. Northern Thai food is what there known for.
Best Thai restaurant iv ate in my life ....

Brought a visiting friend here for a relaxed dinner before putting her on the RedEye.  Place was packed early on a Monday, and for good reason.  Absolutely divine.  As other reviewers have mentioned the Crispy Duck Panang is perfection, though, I ordered a level "6" spice and I could have gone up a couple of notches.  Prices are totally reasonable- 2 soup, 2 entree, 4 beers came out to under $70 including tip (and we had leftovers).  Service was prompt but not rushed and very friendly.  Ambiance is somewhat lacking, but food, service and value totally make up the difference.

Burp!  Great food!  We were supposed to be there only for dessert but after seeing the menu, decided to try some dishes.  We were not disappointed.  Fave was the soft shell crab drunken noodle.  Service was fast.  Only complain is the tables are so near each other so it's a bit tight.

By far my favorite restaurant ever!!! It's authentic, fresh, and of superb quality. It's a hole in the wall, but remarkable food! Staff is attending and very friendly and knowledgable of the menu. Only complain is the long wait times....but it's worth the wait. The long wait times says a lot, think about it ;)
By far the best Thai food I've ever had, but it is really pricey. I had the delicious crispy duck panang and garlic prawns, which were finger-licking good!

Came here at 530, right when they open and there wasn't a wait. The restaurant is pretty large inside, with lots of seating. I came with 4 other people, so we did family style. 

We ordered the pad thai, pork stew curry, khao soi, crispy rice, and crispy duck with drunken noodles. My favorite dish was the crispy duck with drunken noodles. Extra crispy and the drunken noodles were delicious!! I've had khao soi before and its one of my favorite dishes. What's not to like about noodles in a curry soup? The pork stew was very tender, but the dish was tiny. It came in a little soup bowl or sauce bowl. The pad thai was a little different, the noodles were thinner than what I'm used to and not as sweet. The crispy rice was a good appetizer, but nothing too special. 

I was kind of disappointed in this place. After reading all the rave reviews, I was expecting the best thai food, but it was just okay.

Deeply satisfying, rich, bright flavors, contrasted by that unforgettable, pallet-stimulating, fermented tinge of northern style chili dips... should you wish to indulge that is...

If you're in the mood for flavors not typical of a normal Thai restaurant experience I recommend one of the chili dips with a side of sticky rice to order alongside your typical Thai curry fare ; pungent, deep flavors reminiscent of korean pork marinated with fermented chili paste mix.

...very interesting that it's served with a side of sticky rice, somewhat less consumed in Southeast Asia but coincidently, a staple in east Asia: almost as if the pallet demands it to accompany it's instinctive, fermented counterpart...

To explore these things of course skip right to the back of the menu to the highly touted "northern" segment, or the chef's recommendations on the following page.  I personally recommend the crispy duck served with curry on atop a bed of noodles - heaven on a plate my friends.

This place is all substance, some hype yes.  But that actually make it even more impressive...a place living up to it's expectation, now that's a rarety. 

5 bright stars.

Delicious and amazing. Tourists and locals should plan to eat here at least one time. The food is authentic and the atmosphere is appropriate for any occasion. You will not be disappointed.

I would highly recommend the Khoa Soi.

Delicious food and great service! This is another of our "must eats" when in Vegas. The Crispy Duck on Drunken Noodles is the best I've ever tasted! Make reservations early for this place. It fills up fast especially on the weekends.

Delicious food and worth the wait. They open at 5:30pm Sundays - we walked in at 6:00pm and it was a 35 minute wait. But it was delicious and totall worth it! THE standout dish, however, was a cp of the En Tuan Soup (#22) on the menu: "Spicy and sour soup with beef tendon, bean sprouts and beef slices." Don't let the word "tendon" scare you away. Eat around that part if you like and savor the wonderful broth. It's worth coming here just to have this!

Delicious, delicious Thai restaurant just off the Strip. Highly recommended by celebrity chefs. Came here hungry on a Friday night. We had no reservation. No problem. Seated immediately.

We ordered beef khao soi, seafood drunken noodles, moo yang, and tub wharn. Khao soi is one of my favorite dishes to eat and they do it great here. Nice and creamy coconut milk sauce with a little bit of heat. Not too thick. Not too runny. Plenty of crispy egg noodles that stayed crispy even when drenched in sauce. The tender beef and egg noodles soaked up all kinds of flavor. Perfect. Best khao soi.

The moo yang was very, very tender. Loved it. Our meal at Lotus of Siam was convenient, affordable, comfortable, and had bold flavors. Worthy of full marks.
Delish!  Everything we were expecting and more!  The food was out of this world!  Highly recommend!

Don't let the area/exterior fool you.

One of our relatives rant and raved about Lotus of Siam so we put it on our bucket list. It is hard to find because the restaurant is not facing the highway. During the day the shopping center almost looks deserted. There is a warning inside the restaurant about vehicle break-ins and not leaving luggage and valuables in plain sight. The first thing you notice when you enter the restaurant is all the articles about the Lotus of Siam. We were seated and waited on quickly. The wine list is amazing, they have one large glass enclosed area with racks of wine. There is another room that also is full of wine. Nine Wine Spectator awards are on the wall. 

My sister's Koong Teen, grilled shrimp with spicy sauce on top of sliced cabbage was tasty. The shrimp were tender and the sauce gave it a kick. I was leery of the raw cabbage but it had sort of a fish sauce that actually turned out to be like an Asian coleslaw. I ordered the Pad Thai and was asked if I wanted it spicy and I said yes. It turned out just right, it made you sweat a little. The garlic prawn and the crispy rice was very flavorful (according to my sister's boyfriend) and had been accompanied .by a very tasty Cucumber Salad. The Panang did have some thing I never had in a curry, grape tomatoes and red grapes. This restaurant is worth a visit if you like Thai food.

Prices are extremely reasonable, a great bargain and a great find in a town with no shortage of over-priced, over-hyped food and drink. When you consider all of the overpriced and overhyped restaurants in the casinos on the strip, this was one experience that we were glad we did not miss. I can't recommend it highly enough.

Don't let the outside of the building or the surrounding ghost town of a strip mall fool you...go through the door and find possibly the best Thai in Vegas. 

Ok so I generally keep things very simple when trying new Thai places and these guys blew away my expectations. A buddy told me about this place a year ago and unfortunately we didn't get a chance to try it so last week I made it a point to stop in, and so glad I did. 

In keeping it simple I went for spicy vegetable soup and Pad Thai. Both of these dishes were fantastic, with a big peppery bite in the Thai hot Spicy Vegetable Soup, and the Pad Thai was so flavorful, best I've had in Vegas hands down. 

The place looks like a dive but swing in it's well worth it, lunch on weekdays things were quite so that might be your chance to beat the dinner rush that others have mentioned...worked out perfect for me.

Driving up to this place was interesting.  It really is a divey type place.  Cabs everywhere, and all different nationalities were coming into this place, i'm assuming because it is sought out with its reviews.

The Pad Thai was pretty good.  They have a huge extensive menu, it may take you a while to figure out what you want.  

The Won Ton and Vegetable soup (Hot n sour it claimed) were nothing to write about, very bland, and they pretty much tasted the same, only difference was the won tons, but if you look at the menu they look like two different things.

No kids menus of any sort.

This is just your basic thai place, not really sure what all the hype was about.

I would give it 3 1/2 stars, I almost would bump it to four because I love there check-in technology, you can take a ride around the strip mall or walk around if you so please and get notified via text message.  You can also see where you are on there list from your phone.

The Thai Iced Tea isn't that great, it is definitely different then most, my hubby didn't drink all his, and he normally does.

I wouldn't come out of my way to come here again, it definitely didn't wow me.
Every plate eaten here was delish! Braised rib anything, the duck, the panang curry anything and match it with one of their amazing wines. Holy smokes. The service was superb as well!

Every time I come to Vegas I have to come here now. We came at 9pm on a Saturday and we waited about 10-15 minutes for a party of 2. It's a little off the strip, but well worth it! The service was great, our server helped us a lot in judging how much food we should order. We ended up ordering 4 dishes to share: spicy chicken wings, tom yum koong (shrimp), thai basil beef, and beef pad see ew. The chicken wings were amazing!! They weren't too spicy, more like a sweet chili, and they were served hot and crispy! The tom yum was by far the best tom yum I've ever had. It was spicy and tangy - perfection! The thai basil beef was very light and a solid dish as well. It went well with steamed white rice. The beef pad see ew was also great, just wish there were more greens added in! 

This place operates very efficiently, our food came out no more than 10 minutes after we ordered it and every dish was hot and fresh! The spicy chicken wings are something you HAVE to order!

Every time I'm in Vegas I come here at least once or twice. Let's just say this is the best thai place I ever ate at! The service was great and the food was so good you don't want to stop eating! Gotta try everything on the menu because I can't tell you what dish is better! Everything was good! One thing you need to know is that you need to make reservation ahead of time because there is always a long wait!
Excellent Thai food. We had the drunken noodles with shrimp, green curry with tofu, and the crispy rice appetizer. The service was excellent and very friendly.
Excellent food!! Great atmosphere!! Loved it all!! Would definitely come back and eat here again.

Fabulous service and food!

The garlic prawns alone deserve a five star rating! Absolutely the best I've ever had. Crispy with the perfect balance of flavors and spices. I also loved the pad see ewe and papaya salad. So good!

Their service is awesome. We ordered a spice level of 4 for all the dishes. I could not handle it after the first dish. We talked to the waiter and he was able to tone it down for our last few dishes. In the mean time, he gave me a free thai ice tea to help relieve all the spice. How nice was that. 

We went on a Wednesday night and it was crowded. We had to wait 30+ minutes. When we talked to the waiter that night, he told us that it was one of the slowest nights they had ever had. Go figure. He said that some of the workers didn't know what to do with themselves. haha 

The food is authentic and amazing. Plus the prices are good. I can see why this restaurant is so famous. I dream about returning again one day to order another plate of prawns.

Finally tried this place where limos and many more Caucasian people mingle with eastern Asian cuisine. The truth is there are many authentic and good restaurants out there for much cheaper, but this one speaks English well to cater to the masses and is just crazy popular because of it. I'm sure their business and price tag keeps everything fresh and good too. 

I would love to return and eat there often, but the high prices make that a less reasonable endeavor than other alternatives.

First Thai place I've ever seen with a line out the door!

This place is a well oiled machine, first of all. We were in at 530, out at 620pm for our party of 6.

Service was good and friendly.

Now the food.
Drunken noodle with soft she'll crab - decent, but not mind blowing
Garlic shrimp - ditto, and in fact, a bit overdone
Crispy duck with red panang curry - very tasty, but could have used a little more curry
Pad sew - pretty standard 
Spicy beef salad - dressing was thicker than I've seen in Thai town (LA) and was heavy on tamarind.  It was tasty but, again, didn't wow me.

All in all, food was tasty and authentic, service was fast and friendly, but the portions were small for what you pay (compared to standard size thai servings ).

A good experience but still more hype than anything else.  I'll stick to what I know in LA's Thai food scene.  

Solid 3.5 at best!

First and foremost, I had very high expectations going into this restaurant. Apparently it's one of the highest ranked restaurants in Las Vegas and it definitely exceeded my expectations!

The restaurant itself is a complete dive. It's one of the only thriving businesses in the strip mall where it's located and everything else is pretty deserted. There is a constant stream of cabs and line of people going in and out of the restaurant. I would definitely recommend making a reservation! Otherwise the wait can be over an hour!

The food was amazing. I love Thai food and definitely have my favorites that I typically ordered. On this occasion however, we chose to order outside of our normal dishes. Our server recommended the garlic prawns, duck panang, short ribs and sea bass with drunken noodles. It was all fabulous! I'm not usually a fan of the drunken noodles but these were delicious. Warning - if you do not like garlic do not get the prawns. I love garlic so these were perfect for me. They were so yummy!

Service was great. We had two guys helping us out and they were awesome. One guy consistently kept our water glasses full and the other guy was great with food recommendations. 

I will definitely be back but only if we have reservations. The wait would be miserable!

First off, this place can be easily missed if you've never been in the area. You can not see it from the street front. 

I've heard lots of good things about this place & the restaurant quickly filled up after we got there. We ordered way too much food as always LOL. But I must say this isn't the best Thai food I've had. It was decent.. I thought I was gonna be in shock from how good it was gonna be.

Food and service was just outstanding. Thank you fellow yelpers for recommending this place. The Garlic Prawns and Crispy duck was amazing. I found the food and service to be well worth the price. I also found it kind of strange that such a high end restaurant would be located in such a seedy place. I saw broken glass in the parking lot and a sign on the restaurant door warning patrons about break ins. I found myself trying to hurry up to get out before it got dark. I really hope the owners consider relocating to a new location or hire someone for $10 an hour to look out for the safety of their patrons.
Food was excellent here - and attentive personal service! Garlic prawns, crispy duck - and must have the coconut ice cream with sticky rice. Super wine list.

Food was quite good here but not exceltional.  Rated as the top place in Las Vegas for Thai food.  Definitely make a reservation.  Place gets filled up pretty fast.  The menu is huge and the food came super fast. Customer Service lacks a bit

Food was very good but service was just as awesome... Thank you Tony for recommending the sea bass drunken noodles.  Your subtle approach was appreciated and you always kept our glasses full,  allowing us to really enjoy our meal. (2 thumbs up)

For a place that is a tourist destination I was skeptical but the execution and service is very high.  All the usual Thai fodder is on the menu but with many notable additions,  too many to go into, just head along and try it.  The wine list is mega extensive but at the end of the day you just need a simple cheap glass of reisling to pair this delicious food. Four for dinner with a glass of vino each $150.

Fresh from Bangkok where street food is King (Soi n. 38 & Yaowarat Road/ Thanon Charoen Krung were my haunts), i was starving for Thai intricately layered flavors.
Lotus of Siam has been on my to go list for ions : lunchtime it is : no wait, not loud, easy parking in this aging shopping center.
Lotus of Siam is a Pearl.
Chose the gloriously celebrated Garlic Shrimps : huge size, each tail holding the crisp shell and the tender meat separately : exquisitely flavored, fantastic combination of textures.
Steak tartare issan style: being of french origin, steak tartare holds a strong attraction when listed in a reputable table menu.
Small super lean  prime beef(no fat whatsoever) chopped delicately in amazingly equal 1/4 inch dice with red onion, green onion, cilantro, mint, and lime thai dressing with heat to your taste... Scrumptiously refreshing heat! Not a morsel left.

Photos of famous intlly known chefs chefs adorn the walls, a rather impressive cellar is glassed in for all diners of all ethnicities to see. Bonus: they have 3 types of Nigori Sake ;)

Sticky Rice and Mango yo close my culinary flash back

Food arrived hot and very timely.
Efficient friendly wait staff

It's all good, and now i can share my taste and invite friends and family  not to miss out once back in Las Vegas.

Funny story, Lotus of Siam when you drive by from Sahara looks like a hole in the wall broken down place that you would never want to eat at. On 2 different occassions I planned on going there and both times when I drove by we decided to go somewhere else. About a year ago we bit the bullet and decided to try it. Surprisingly enough the front of the restaraunt is in the back and we were basically looking at the back of the place when driving by. It can be deceiving. I've been there 1/2 dozen times since. Last night we went and there was a 1 hour - 1.5 hour wait to get seated. The foods so good we waited over an hour.

I've read reviews from more than one food critic calling is the best Thai Food in all of North America. I've been to Thailand for a month to train and the food is actually better at Lotus of Siam! The owner apparently started cooking in Thailand at age 5 with her mother/grandmother and brough that experience to Vegas. Just yesterday I saw on Yahoo that Lotus of Siam was #89 on the list of the best 101 restaraunts in the USA.

As for the food, some things I recommened for an appetizer are the Prawns in a blanket, spicy chilli chicken wings and also the Tom Kah Kai Soup. For dessert the Mango Sticky Rice is the bomb. 

I went with 3 people total and for our main courses to split we got Crispy garlic prawns, Panang Curry and Sea bass over drunken noodles. I've had numerous dishes here and they are all good. All the curries are great, the pad thai, the crispy duck. Great flavors and taste you wont find many other places. I see myself going back very soon!

GET THE SHRIMP!!!

Second time here. Just as fantastic as the first time. 

Soft shell crab drunken noodle is bombbb too

Just come and eat here already!!
GREAT FOOD, very attentive and accommodating waiters service. the location is questionable but who care, as long as the food and customer service is great, i'll go into the hood!

Get the crispy duck with panang sauce or ask them to do it with prawns. Sea bass drunken noodles was good and the pork stew was also amazing.  So good we went for dinner and went back for lunch 2 days later.

Get there early, and enjoy! There was a line at 5:30 pm. but worth the wait! We all had seafood meals and appetizers full of flavor! We all were super satisfied and  the service was awesome! We were just visiting Las Vegas and had remembered the restaurant from an Anthony Bourdain show ! Really glad we checked it out! We ended our dessert with the fried wonton bananas and coconut ice cream a wonderful companion pair!

Getting a reservation here for dinner on a Saturday night is like pulling teeth!  I ended up getting a reservation on Sunday evening.  The restaurant is a decent size but it was pretty busy even for a Sunday.  Restaurant is in a sketchy area! 

Garlic Prawns- large and tasty succulent prawns.  It was good but I feel like you can get this dish somewhere else and probably for half the price.  It's really just deep fried prawns with a lot of garlic and black pepper.

Crispy Duck in Panang Curry- my favorite dish of the two.  The curry is creamy, spicy, and was delicious with rice.  The crispy duck is good but only comes with about five pieces.  If they had just the panang curry without the ridiculous priced duck, I would get that instead.

Tasty food but I've had just as good thai food in LA for less hassle and better prices.

Getting a reservation was hard...for some reason always got a busy signal or continued ringtone....when they finally answered it was like hitting the jackpot.
Once we got there we ordered the garlic prawns, crispy rice, braised shortribs in panang, and crispy duck with drunken noodles.....it was fantastic overall.
The crispy rice is more of a acquired taste...I like it but not for everyone as it is sour and salty but a good starter to encourage the appetite. The crispy prawns were amazing...my favorite part of this dish were the shells that had so much flavor. The crispy duck was the perfect level of spicy for me (I ordered 7 out of 10 and like things spicy) and the crispy part was super crispy and the moist parts were succulent all coated with a basil sauce that was to die for. Finally the short ribs in panang sauce was delicious. The sauce was flavorful and the meat tender.
Definitely worth the trip even out to the complex in the middle of nowhere.

Great NORTHERN Thai food.

If you go there....I recommend only ordereing from the NORTHERN THAI section as that is their specialty.

Order your pad thai at Panda Express and come to this place for HIGH QUALITY Northern Thai cuisine!
Great food and great service.  Make sure to arrive on time and make reservations days in advance.

Great food but a little on the crowded side for me. Ambiance 2 stars becuase of the lack of personal space and small seating. Although the food is great it is hard to enjoy when stuffed in a room. So food 4 or 5 stars.

Great food but small portion and charged 18% tip if your group over  5 and more including all ages babies. My 2 years and 5weeks babies were charged for 18% tip. This restaurant is the best Thai restaurant in Vegas but their service is not the best for customers. Enjoy their great small portion foods but do not expect any service.
Great food.  hard to get someone to answer the phone to make a reservation

Great food... I had the pleasure of having the seafood fried rice... the entree had just enough seafood and flavor...  I recommended everyone in Vegas hit this joint up if you want authentic Thai food!!! The best ever!!
Great variety, huge menu, very authentic. Cheap prices for great quality food. And the service was wonderful!

Great, great and more great. Started with green papaya salad. I asked for medium heat and it was plenty spicy. Tom yum shrimp soup was the best. Then I had pad Thai. Again ask for little spicy. It was perfect. I will go back every time I'm in Vegas.

HAD to try this place after Anthony Bourdain's recommendation on Parts Unknown, and I FELL IN LOVE!!! if you watched that episode of Parts Unknown, the guy that Anthony Bourdain eats with at this restaurant says to try something from the "northern" part of the menu, and he's right!! DON'T try anything typical - pad thai, pad see ew, etc. BRANCH OUT!!

Under the "northern" section, we chose the Khoa Soi with beef, which is a noodle dish with a sauce that is similar to panang, but lighter. Under the "chef's special", we ordered the Crispy Duck Panang because it was so popular on Yelp. OH. MY. GOSH. Both of those dishes were delicious. But the Crispy Duck Panang was on another level. The duck was so well prepared. You can taste the crispiness of the skin. I expected the duck to be soggy because it's in the panang sauce, but no. It was fresh, it was crispy, it was delicious. There is definitely a lot of spice in the dish, but it was still amazing.

Portions wise, each dish was on the small side. I typically only finish half of my entree from most restaurants, but I was able to finish my crispy duck panang and my boyfriend was able to finish his dish as well. The price point is also pretty high - over $20 for each of the dishes, but they were definitely worth it. I've never tried thai food like this before.

Wait time: we came on a monday night, about 20 minutes after they open and it was already pretty packed in the restaurant. One hour after it opened, there was a huge gathering of people waiting for tables. If you can, get a reservation or come when it opens because you definitely need to try it.

HI folks, Its Richard Emanuele , I cant tell you enough, if your looking for some incredible Thai food . Lotus of Siam is the best in town. If your a local or visiting Vegas and craving some excellent Thai food its a must!!!! Please don't judge the restaurant by its decor, the food speaks for itself. I recommend you make reservations or there can be a long wait.

Had dinner here with a large group and service was excellent!  I would highly recommend this restaurant for the food alone.  Our orders were taken in a sequential fashion and we were able to split the checks by table.  We had a birthday celebrant and they even served the cake after the meal which was nice. Drinks were kept filled.   Some of the items that I sampled were the larb, garlic shrimp, crispy duck panang, fried rice, and pad see ew.  Everything tasted perfectly prepared with just the right spice and flavor.   Loved the food so much will definitely be back to try other dishes!
Hands down the best Thai food in all of Las Vegas.

Have been here multiple times in the past years. I guess when the restaurant has already built their reputation they don't watch the quality of their food. 

Ordered for two: Garlic Prawns and Braised Short Ribs in Padang curry. 

Garlic Prawns excellent as always! 

Braised Short Ribs in Padang curry such a disappointment. Yes beef is tender but for sure it wasn't short ribs. I am a great home cook and I know my ingredients. I also had order this dish many times before, but this time really disappointed with the quality of the beef.

Have eaten here around 6 times so far.  Seen good reviews and noticed it was ranked #2 in Thai food restaurants in the country on one of the food sites, so I had to try it.  Simply put this place has the best Thai food I have ever had.  It is worth a try.  You will not be disappointed.  This is a hidden gem!

Every time I am in Vegas, I will make time to eat here.  You should make a reservation several days in advance, or you might be out of luck.  Not just a walk in place.  It is somewhat hard to find if you don't know where it is.  Some shopping strip center off of Sahara.

Their Pad Thai and Drunken Noodles is a great selection.  Try the crispy duck, this is to die for.  They will spice on a scale of 1-10.  If you like it real spicy, go to around an 8, if you still want to taste your food.  If you want all heat kick it up to a 10.  Medium is around 5-6. 

Prices are very much in line for the quality of food you get here.  Most dishes start out around $10, so come with several people and order a few dishes to share to get the best overview of their great food here.  

Service is real good.  Suggest to get an appetizer to hold you over, since you may wait for you food sometimes depending on how full they are.  Their soups are good to go with for an appetizer.
  
If you enjoy wine, they have quite the selection.  You can see a big wine closet when you come into this place.

Heard about this place from the Food Channel and finally tried the place.  This restaurant is located in a poverished neighborhood with high crime rate based upon the sign on the door warning guests not to leave anything inside their vehicles. I was expecting food portions to be larger. Instead they were smalled to control portion size. 

The catfish was in portions cut up on the plate.  We ordered the drunken noodle not impressed with the lack of seafood i.e 2 mussels, no shimp and inexpesive frozen calamari. I have high expectations as eating at many Thai restaurants this would not be a place I would recommend to anyone unless you are not familiar with Thai food and don't have anything to compare to.

Hidden gem of Vegas- probably the best food there minus the wicked spoon buffet. Super authentic thai food- hole in the wall place. It's in this ghetto looking parking lot which made me think I was going to some take out chinese restaurant but once you walk in- it's pretty nice!

We got the garlic prawn, roasted duck curry, and chicken pad thai. I have eaten alot of thai food in my life but the flavor here- my god- just so GOOD. I LOVE the chicken pad thai- super flavorful and I just enjoyed every single bite. The roasted duck curry was on point as well. I don't think you can go wrong ordering here- tbh. The garlic prawn was pretty good- fried crispy!

It's about 10 min driving off the strip but WORTH IT!!!!!!!! MUST COME HERE EVERY VEGAS TRIP!

Highly overrated and overpriced. Not a bad place, but I honestly think people say it's good just because other people say it's good. The prices were a dollar more expensive than people claim in Yelp, so they appear to keep hiking up the prices. People continue to line up and pay it, so I don't blame the restaurant for meeting market demand - I just don't understand it.

1) Garlic prawns.
Everyone says to get it, and the pictures look great. I ordered this, and the wrong thing came out. Turns out, there are two kinds and you need to clearly specify which one. The one in all the Yelp photos is the deep-fried version. Otherwise they give you the BBQ/grilled version. The grilled version is not bad, but wish I knew. $26 is a lot for the wrong dish.

2) Khao Soi.
It's okay. I like how the noodles are fairly soft, but nothing special. 

3) Drunken seafood noodles.
This one was terrible. Normally I love wide, pan-fried rice noodle dishes, but this one came as a giant messy wet mush of dough as the noodles got soggy and fused together. I picked at the seafood and veggies and left all the noodles, which should've been slightly crispy on the pan-fried side and normally the best part of the dish.

I want to note that the staff seemed friendly. I just don't get the customer ratings; the same food or better is readily available at every other Thai restaurant for about $6.95 a dish.

Highly recommend getting there before they open at 5:30pm. We got there at 5:15pm and sat in the car, then slowly a line of people started to form. We literally got a table when they open at 5:30pm. Service was amazingly quick and attentive. The food arrived within 5 to 10minutes. The price is on the higher end for Thai food- average about $15 to $30 for entree, but it's well worth it. The menu is very extensive and it's sorted by the region of Thailand.  

The garlic prawn comes with 8 generous pieces and flash fried with garlic seasoning. It was delicious and the shrimp was crispy. The prawn was deshelled therefore consumption is very convenient. 

The crispy duck with the noodle was one of my favorite. The duck was tasty with a crispy skin. The flat rice noodle was slightly pan fried and complimented the duck really well. Pretty much, it's  similar to the Chinese chow fun (pan fried rice noodle) atop with crispy duck. 

The Thum ka noon was minced pork with jackfruit. We randomly ordered this and it was interesting. It would be really good if it's eaten with rice. Overall, the food was very well seasoned and I cant stop burping after the dinner. I will definitely come back and try different entree. I'm curious how good a simple pad thai or pad see ew would taste in here?

Hmmm... 
I had a lot of high expectations for this place. It's so well-known and was voted one of the best Thai Restaurants in America. Yes, in America! Now, I do not know if it is because I live near Thai Town near Hollywood and have tried some bomb Thai food in the past, or even because west LA itself has good Thai food, but this place didn't blow my mind. It didn't necessarily disappoint either, as the food was all really good. I just think that I expected something different? 

We tried all the standard thai dishes here but I think my favorite was the garlic shrimp dish.  Dinner reservations are highly recommended. My friends and I made reservations here weeks in advance before our usual Vegas trip :) 
The place is popping and it is located in a random strip mall. The restaurant itself is actually very big.  Staff is friendly and the menu is very extensive. You also have the ability to customize when you order, the level of spicy for most if not all dishes they serve.

Hole in the wall, but SUPER WELL KNOWN! I have lived in Vegas for over a year, and a friend from home told me about it. It is off Sahara hidden in a shopping center. It looks tiny, but once you get inside - it's huge!

Food - You can't go wrong with anything you order. The best things that I have tried are the Garlic Prawn, the Pad Thai, and the Short Rib Panang. The prawns are deep fried, but they are delicious! You will see the person at the table to next you have them and NEED them! I always order Pad Thai, and I found my new go-to place to get it from. The short rib Panang is sweet, and the short rib is juicy. It absorbs the flavor and melts in your mouth. 

Ambiance - Always busy, but definitely worth the wait. You may want to call in at least a few days in advance to make a reservation to ensure you get a table, and don't have to wait.

Huge huge huge wine list. Something for every taste. Its the best Thai food I have ever had. Excellent Curry and the Pad Thai was perfect. First strip mall Thai place I have ever eaten at that had James Beard Awards on the wall. Its a short cab ride from the Las Vegas strip, they don't take reservations and the line was out the door. We only waited 30 miutes on a Tuesday night for a table. You should try this place if your a Thai foody

Hypebeast. L.O.S. was ok, but its not head and shoulders above other Thai I've had. We had the pad thai, stuffed chicken wings, drunken noodles, and garlic prawns. The garlic prawns were good and perfectly cooked, but the flavor was a bit lacking, I thought. The stuffed chicken wings were good, and the drunken noodles were actually amazing. Everything else was not really note worthy. Not worth the hype.

I FINALLY got to try the famous Lotus of Siam. Overall, it was pretty awesome.

Location/venue: It's located in a seriouly shady part of town in a mall I would never go to alone. The venue like...an old tired Chinese restaurant. 

Food: I was actually slightly disappointed that not everything was out of this world delicous...here's the breakdown
-Crispy duck with panang curry: This was hands down the star of our meal. It's one of their signature dishes and expectations were high...and they totally delivered. Duck was perfectly crispy and juicy and the curry! OH EM GEE SOOOOOO DELICIOUS. Perfectly balanced, creamy without being heavy. Good to the very last drop. We might as well have just licked the plate.
-Garlic prawns: Another signature dish that was very good, though not as amazing as the duck with panang curry. the shrimp meat and shell are fried separately, which surprisingly makes everything yummy crunchy and edible. The shells were possibly even better than the meat of the prawns. 
-Soft shell crab with drunken noodle: this was disapointing, especially after the first two dishes. The soft shell crab was a bit soggy and the noodles were super soggy. In fact the noodles were all stuck together in sticky soggy bricks. I feel like I must have gotten an anomaly.
-Sai Oua (norther style sausage): don't get this. it's just...a sausage. It wasn't special. I mean, if you know what it is and you like it, sure. But otherwise, it was super disappointing and just not very good.
-Fried banana with coconut ice cream: So crispy, so yummy, the banana and the coconut ice cream were perfect complements!
-Mango with sticky rice: Mango was beautifully deliciously silky ripe. sticky rice was  perfectly chewy and yummy. Both of the desserts were delicious. I was way beyond capacity full by dessert and I still finished every last bite of dessert!

If you come for the duck/curry, prawns, and dessert, it's PERFECT. 5 starts. However, I am disappointed that aside from the two signature dishes the rest of the entrees were any good. Their menu is actually quite extensive...wonder if how much of the menu is actually at the level of their 2 signature dishes?

I agree with the fact that the portions don't justify the prices, but the food is also REALLY really tasty.

FOOD
  Garlic Prawns - THE BEST!! Sooo glad we ordered this dish based on the reviews. I would've ordered another one if we weren't already so full! The prawns are huge and fried to PERFECTION. Super crispy and seasoned just right. I will definitely come back and order this every time. GO GET YOU SOME!!
