I don't know if the U.S. is lacking in good Thai restaurants but this place for me was just 'good' despite previously being told by my American friends that this place is amazing/delicious/fantastic...

Half of us ordered chicken pad thai and the other half of us ordered green or yellow chicken thai curry. We had soup and spring rolls for starters. The food in my opinion was tasty, but nothing that excited my taste buds. The sauce for the curry was a little watery in my opinion and the spring rolls lacked in flavour. If I could give this restaurant 3.5 out of 5 I would as i'm teetering between giving 3 or 4 stars. The service was just ok, not as attentive as they could have been but not impossibly slow. I had a lovely evening but that was mainly more due to the company than the food. I do have to say though that the portions are very generously sized and the prices are reasonable. 

I wouldn't go out of my way to come back here next time i'm in Vegas as cab fare is about $25 each way, not too bad if there's a group of you but if there's only you and one other then maybe not. I would only return IF I or someone I was travelling with had a strong craving for Thai food when in Vegas but other than that, I live in the North of England and there are tonnes of Thai restaurants in our city centres of Leeds & Manchester of which i've ate at many of them and have had much better Thai food back home in the U.K. This isn't the worst Thai restaurant i've been to, it's just okay/nice/pleasant.. nothing outstanding.

Ate there twice this week. Food is great!! What was disappointing was that the hostesses are not welcoming or friendly at all. Servers are ok. Great food, mediocre service. Staff seems burnt out. Kudos to the kitchen.
Awesome food but pretty pricey.

Awesome thai food at a reasonable price. This restaurant is always packed, thus making the (already bleak) atmosphere a little less than desirable. Be sure to call a day or two ahead of time to secure a reservation! 

Minutes from the Strip but in a shady area, so be sure to not leave anything in your vehicle.

Awesome!
The location is shady. However, once you walk in, you are transformed into a new world.
Def worth trying.

Be sure to bring your high limit credit card to this tourist trap.. leave your appetite at home if you're hungry for a asian dinner, The food was tasty, but so little of it. We ordered several dishes and just enough food was served to barely cover the bottom of the serving dishes.. The service 
was scanty at best, as I was being taken to our table after 45 min. wait outside the waiter/busman stopped in front of me and pulled a chair out in front of me in the narrow walk area. then looked up and grinned. The beverage boy failed to bring our beverages; that he requested we ask him for. After a very long wait from order placement with the "waiter" another person brought the tiny food to the table it was cold. He ran off very quickly.The "waiter" was busy bussing the empty table next to us. I am sure that he was anxious to seat another group of victims. The wine by the glass is very expensive. 8.50 for a four ounce serving. We ordered two glasses of syrah from the "waiter" after some effort flagging him down. He brought one glass, The amount in the glass was so small, I thought that I was to taste first....He did not understand that the order was for me and my date( two glasses, please ). The food is tasty, but very ordinary few vegetables and meats This is a 4 $$$$ expensive dining experience. dinner is served on shiny tables with paper place mats and a single paper napkin, no spoons, knives, or second fork. Everything must be ordered with the dinner, or you won't get seen again by the staff, before the tab presentation. Glad to get out unhurt, but still hungry. Never Again..

Been here many times, it is an absolute mist every time I go to vegas, the food is always delicious but i felt that this time the portions were smaller, my drunken noodle soft shell crab was great but little  amount of noodles compared to other times, had the prawns , papaya salad and also felt less were served. Anyway it was still all very good, will come back of course. Ordered some sake and beers to accompany the meal

Been here so many times. I can never get enough. You can't get in without a reservation. The mango and sticky rice is THE BEST. Omgosh even thinking about it makes my mouth water lol. I haven't had one thing here that wasn't yummy. Highly recommend to anyone!

Been here twice and it is what they all say it is.  I'm drooling already without even getting into the dishes!  It's a pretty busy and popular place despite the location.  A little iffy and sketchy.  Just make sure you don't leave anything valuable anywhere!  Take it with you.  There is a line before it opens, so be sure to get there early.  We got there just in time when they open and we got a seat.  We knew what to ordered immediately.  Service is great as usual.  Placed our orders and waiting oh-so patiently.  The crispy duck panang...mm mmm MMMMM!!!  we had to order two of those.  Pad See Eww with beef was delicious, the fish larb was my first and it was actually really tasty.  I usually get the norm - chicken.  We also ordered the crispy rice salad dish.  That was a good combo, love the crunchiness.  Spicy fried rice was perfect, I don't think you can really go wrong with what you order.  Unless you have food restrictions. And for the finale, you cannot go to a thai place and not order mango with sticky rice!!!  My absolute favorite dessert.
Best Thai Food Ever! Best Seafood Soup! Must try Pad Se Ew with beef it's the best. Fried Prawns are delicious! I love this place it's definitely one of my favorite restaurants for lunch and dinner.

Best Thai Food I have EVER had. No place like this. The DUCK is awesome. If you go there, you will not regret it. The wall made of the wine rack is my favourite . Try the khao soi ( phonetically that how its spelled actual i don't know), duck in Panang curry, Nam Kao and to finish it off, have the mango sticky rice !! Loooooove it. I would suggest making a reservation before hand, because they are always full for dinner and lunch on weekends too.

Best Thai food I've EVER had. Get everything. 'Nough said. 
Come when it opens and maybe you'll be seated fairly quickly.

Best Thai food I've ever had. The absolutely best thing was the duck Penang. Never had crispy duck in a Thai restaurant before, and the meat wasn't too fatty/boney! Service was impeccable, they sure know how to handle the Vegas tourists. The crab fried rice and the papaya salad were also among my favorites. The only thing I wasn't a fan of was the sausage. Nam Kao was amazing as well!
Best Thai food I've ever had. The wait for a table is always worth it. This place is in a dump of a shopping center but don't let that scare you. Yum yum yum!!!

Best Thai food I've had in a long time. This place is off the strip in a shady looking strip mall, but well worth the trip. I hear it can go from "shady" to "seedy" at night. We went there on a Sunday afternoon for lunch and had no wait to get a table. We had the Tom Yum Kai (hot and sour soup with chicken and lemon grass) and it was one of the best I've ever had. They asked us how spicy on a 1-10 scale. We said 5, and I'm glad I didn't go over that, because it was definitely spicy - not unpleasantly so, but I would probably order a 3 or 4 next time.

For main courses we got the Garlic Prawns which are as good (if not better) than all the reviews say. The prawns are fried with the shells still on them, and they get crispy "like potato chips" according to the menu, and are super tasty. We also ordered the Crispy Duck on Drunken Noodles. There were only a couple pieces of duck that were actually "crispy," but wow was it tasty. 

The only problem with it being off the strip is that it took us ONE HOUR to get a cab to pick us up. Some of the cab companies said they wouldn't even pick us up. I would recommend driving yourself as there's plenty of parking. If you do take a cab or uber, I would recommend calling them before you even ask for your bill, because it might take a while. The food is so good, I'm still giving it 5 stars though. 

I will come back here each and every time I go to Vegas so I can try something else on the menu.
Best Thai food around!!!! Pork Larb and Garlic Prawns were outstanding.  There was a little wait, but it was worth it. Waiter was very good and took great care of us.
Best Thai food ever, even for vegetarians. Yum
Best Thai food we ever had. The Pad se ew, Seafood soup, Thai tea are great. My husband loves the Crispy Duck. Go to place for all Thai food. Nowhere else compares!
Best Thai in Vegas.  Hands down.  Crappy location, but great food and very reasonably priced.

Best Thai in the Las Vegas valley. Great service, great flavored, great menu selection. Started with hot and sour vegetable soup. Large chunks of veggies that were not too soggy and crisp not mushy. Great broth at a medium spicy/heat level. I had the squid garlic and hubby ordered the spicy seafood spaghetti. Both were delicious. Highly recommend. Prices were good value, not cheap, but well priced for the quality and quantity.
Best Thai in town.  A must for brining visitors.
Best dish ever, Drunken Noodles with Sea Bass.  Enough said.

Best place for Thai in the entire valley!  Be sure to make reservations... and lock your car doors when you go in- not the greatest area, but once you walk through their door you forget where you are.

Best restaurant in Las Vegas overall. Eaten here over 50 times over the last 4 years living in LV. Lotus has had a few slight ups and downs in that time, mostly in regards to speed of service. In spring of this year they apparently hired a ton of new wait/server staff, and they are a young professional crew who do a fantastic job. The half dozen or so times  I've been there this summer the service level has been exemplary. Their cuisine is the most consistently delicious of any restaurant I've ever dined in, including dozens of michelin starred and james beard nominated. The best kept secret of Lotus' menu is the deep fried Lobster. It's always at least 5 lbs and runs $145 per, must call ahead to order or inquire as to the availability of Lobster. It's deep fried in the shell, then cut in sections and pan fried with corn starch sauce and veggies. The result is moist, flavorful lobster meat that comes out of the shell in perfect huge chunks! It wan't until about a year ago that my wife and I first had the lobster, we asked on a flyer on a monday night and they sold us one that was leftover from a party they night before. I guess they pre-ordered 10 and only ate 9, so we ordered it for just the two of us. There was a big party of about 20 ppl in the adjacent room and they came over in shifts to take pictures of our lobster, it's really that much of a spectacle! Other must try dishes include but not limited to: Short Rib in Panang, Drunken Noodle Prawn, Roasted Duck Curry, Crispy Catfish Salad, and I enjoy the snapper with thai chili and basil preparation. If you are visiting alone or with a group of 30 this is the place to go! Local tip: If you show up when they open (5:30) for dinner without a reservation, expect a 5-15 minute wait. 6-8:30pm expect a wait of 1hr+, after 8:30 10-20 minutes depending on the day. Make a reservation ahead of time, and don't be more than 5 minutes late or they'll cancel it.

Best thai food! Penang curry is a must! Shady looking place from
Outside but pleasently surprized once inside. There will be a wait...worth the great food!

Big Fan of Mrs. Redd's pies!!! Every flavor, especially lemon.
But I am missing them terribly since the Food 4 Less closed in Vegas Valley.
It is most unfortunate the Kroger chain does not carry these in every store...ie Smith's. SO Delicious!!!

Came here and made the mistake of not making a reservation. Waited an hour in the stuffy waiting area.  When we got seated we ordered the pad Thai, the salt and pepper prawns and a beef dish. The pad Thai was really good. Loved the sweet noodles. 

The fried prawns were good but I don't think that's it's worth 27 bucks..... Definitely not worth it for me. The prawns were big and the flavor was good though. 

I also ordered a Thai ice tea and it was wayyyy too sweet. I think next time I will order better dishes that are not so pricey. But I definitely will come back and try again... with a reservation.
Came here during a business trip. Delicious food, great service, good environment
Came here off of a recommendation. Food was great. I will be back soon.
Can't disagree with the critics, it is the best Thai restaurant in the country. If you don't eat here you are missing out.

Chef Jet Tila and Anthony Bourdain: "Don't order Pad Thai. Go to the back of the menu and order Northern Thai specialties." 



 Thai food, more specifically, delicious, authentic Thai food is almost impossible to find. Being a traveler, I've been seeking something that would be comparable to what I've tasted when I was in Thailand. For me and my friends, we had to travel to Las Vegas, Nevada in order to experience what I believe is to be the best Thai food outside of Thailand...and it's only an hour flight away from LAX. 

 Saipin Chutima is a James Beard Award recipient offering traditional, authentic Northern Thai recipes that were passed down from generation to generation. It is a step away from the sweet and tangy flavors that so many of us have been exposed to and are familiar with. 

A line congregates outside of the restaurant before opening its doors for service. The menu sits like a book, with numerous dishes to choose from. The décor is simple, casual and a little outdated (but who honestly cares when you're here for the food). Photos of famous people who have visited the restaurant line the walls. And the food...well, it's simply superb. 
 
MY FAVORITE DISH. EN TUAN (HOT POT: $13.95): Spicy and sour soup with beef tendon, bean sprouts and beef slices. I seriously dream about this soup day in and day out after I had my first taste. The broth was full of flavor....bold, luxurious with a lot of depth. Hints of garlic can be tasted in the soup that was seasoned well. The tendon was perfectly cooked with the best texture that ever was put forth in soup. I could slurp this forever and never get sick of it! Thank goodness we got a bowl. It was more than enough for a group of four and the fire in the middle definitely kept the soup hot. We asked for a spice level of 5 and could not taste any spiciness unfortunately (maybe we just have a high tolerance).  

 
LARB WITH PORK ($10.95): Ground pork, chopped onion, green chili, and lime juice served with fresh cabbage. The salad was fresh, with a nice balance of acidity and refreshing. Slightly spicy and nicely seasoned. I enjoyed it but the next time I'm there, I wanna try the Northern larb salad.  

DRUNKEN NOODLE SOFT SHELL CRAB ($22.95): Deep fried soft shell crab with homemade fresh chilis and Thai basil served on top of pan fried flat rice noodle. I loved this dish. The crab was extremely crispy and retained its crispiness throughout the remainder of the meal (although it wasn't long since we scarfed everything down pretty quickly). The noodles were nicely cooked and was a bit spicy. They didn't ask our spice level and I assumed they kept it at a 5, which was the perfect spice for a good kick.  

 
CRISPY DUCK WITH PANANG ($24.95): Crispy duck topped with Thai style red cream curry sauce with cognag. This was absolutely delicious. The duck was extremely crispy. The panang curry was rich and spicy. It was slightly sweet, yet savory and full of flavor. This was definitely one of my favorite dishes and a must order.  

THUM KA NOON- POUNDED AND SHREDDED YOUNG JACK FRUIT ($10.95): This local dish from the north is unique to the northern part of North Thailand. Made of shredded young jack fruit, ground pork, tomatoes, northern Thai spices and seasoning. This was seriously my second favorite dish. I loved everything about it. It was sweet, a little tangy and a bit sour and spicy. The texture was similar to shredded meat. As full as I was, I couldn't stop eating this dish.  

 
MANGO WITH SWEET STICKY RICE- SEASONAL ($8.95): Sweet, delicious, good. The mangoes were ripe and the rice was perfect. Enough said.  

Overall, you can't go wrong when ordering at Lotus of Siam. Chutima managed to bring dishes that you normally wouldn't find at your local Thai restaurant. It's a special place when literally everything you order tasted phenomenal. I had a difficult time deciding my favorite dish amongst the amazing dishes. When you dream about the food and can't get it out of your head, then you know you've found a gem. The next time I visit Lotus of Siam, I need to try the Nam Prik Noom (just sayin'). Word of advice: Book a reservation because lines form before the place even opens.
Come here expecting to get an average Thai meal with above average service and atmosphere and you will not be disappointed

Could go on and on .... And on. Treat yourself and put yourself and in the trust hands of your service - follow their recommendations and get ready for a spectacular dining experience.  I can't even remember the names of our dishes but all were: wow!

Could go on and on .... And on. Treat yourself and put yourself and trust let your server pick your meal - follow their recommendations and get ready for a spectacular dining experience.  I can't even remember the names of our dishes but all were: wow!
Crispy Duck is really good! The service was fast. The place outside looks like an abandoned place but really cool inside with a big open wine cellar! Must try!

Crispy Garlic Shrimp - I almost cried it was sooooooooo good. 

Northern Red Curry - YUM! 

The wine list is AMAZING!

Crispy duck and classic northern Thai dishes really set this place apart. If you enjoy going authentic but are new and are not sure what to order, just ask. The staff are great for noobs. I was only able to do lunch here, however it brought me directly back to both my vacations to Thailand.

Date & Time:  Wednesday July 8, 2015 @ 6pm
Dining Companions:  Uncle, Auntie, Sister-in-Law, Brother-in-Law, Cousins, Nephews, Mommy & Husband
Scene:  Families & Groups in Tank, Tees, Shorts & Flip Flops
Devour: Shrimp in a Blanket, Panang Duck Curry, Fried Rice, Pad Thai, Pad Seew, Beef Dishes
Total:  $172.63

Definitely overhyped, but then again I fall for the trendy hyp-est things in the world. It's my own fault. I went with only 1 other person so I wasn't able to order many things, which made me sad, but what made me EVEN more sad was the $30 cab ride it took to get here. SIGHPIE. We ordered:

2 thai teas - average
1 pad thai - really good, I was pleasantly surprised and the portions are ok
1 green chicken curry - the sauce is really thin and milky, definitely not enough meat or veggies in this dish
1 famous fried shrimp - this is probably my FAVORITE thing so far. The shrimp was crunchy and flavorful. Definitely worth the $15 price tag
1 ground pork with spices appetizer - probably the most disappointing. This dish was unusually sour, like so sour it was hard to even swallow it without a huge gulp of water. When I gooogled this place, this was one of the most popular dishes. I say, if you're used to common simple thai dishes, this is not going to be to your liking

Delicious , high quality food and the restaurant got nice design . 

Food : 10/10 .

Will come back next time when back to Vegas. This restaurant will be on my list .
Delicious food and clean
Delicious, Get the beef kao soi #1 heat level with extra coconut cream! It is to die for!
Despite the price, the food is wonderful! I recommend the soft shell crab with cabbage under I believe. This place is to die for. I would go here every time I visit Vegas. Op.

Does Lotus of Siam need another five star review? Probably not. It speaks volumes that tourists seek out this restaurant located in a seedy, hole-in-the-wall commercial district in droves. It's that good.

Does this place really have over 2400 reviews?  If you can't tell, the word is out on this place.  And it won't disappoint.  So why would I need to add one more review to an overwhelming outpouring of opinion?  Just to add some cautions:

1) Make the chefs happy and go for the back of the menu where the specialties are.  Don't even think about ordering Pad Thai!

2)  If you like Riesling, they have an overwhelming list.  But we always seem to get a bottle that has gone into secondary fermentation.  If you consider a bit of gas to be a fault (as I do), you'll likely have to return it for something else.  Or just give up and enjoy the bubbly!

3)  Watch the temp on the spice, it gets hot FAST.  Bring facial tissues and enjoy the heat.

4)  MAKE RESERVATIONS, ASAP!  While they seem to make every effort to accommodate those without, this place is ridiculously popular and will always be booked up.

5)  Don't judge a book by its cover.  When you pull up, it will look like a dump.  The area is old, run down and looks a bit scary, though it's largely abandoned.  Go inside and you will find a nice restaurant.

But do go and try it.  It is really good if you order right!
Don't plan on staying and enjoying any conversation with friends. You order, eat and are rushed out so someone else can have your table. Food may be good but that made he whole experience unpleasant.

Don't see what's the big deal . Very simple place , super packed , 2 h waiting for just average quality food . Oh and you will be served so fast you lol be done in 10 min ... And you will be put under pressure to leave coz next person waiting .

Don't worry about curb appeal, just get inside this place.  It is fantastic  Some of the best Thai food I have ever had and I may go as far to say it was the BEST Thai food I have ever had...

We waited to get in but they have a great system that you can check from your phone to see how long you have waited and where you are in line!  Everything we ordered was delicious. Dumplings.  Delicious.  Panang.  Delicious.  

Don't get caught up with the strip.  Take a taxi, drive, walk, just get there.

Driving up to the place, I've already had my biases.. it's located in a run down strip mall. Homeless people hanging out in the parking lot. I've already made up my mind that this can't be any good... and then the 40 minute wait. It has too be good, right? Packed on a Friday night. It must be good. Still questioning our dinner choice, we decided to wait.

Looking at the menu, dishes were on the pricey side. Then I saw too many westerners to think this would be any good. While we waited, we watched dishes coming out and the portions looked tiny. The garlic prawns were $29! And the plate didn't even look that full. 

I would pass on the garlic prawns and the drunken noodles.
But the pad thai..... Possibly the best pad thai I've ever tasted!

Was it worth the wait? Between 3 dishes, only one was a hit.

Eating Thai food from Thailand in Las Vegas, NV... its really that simple.

Lets start with where its located... A ways off the north end of the strip in a shopping mall plaza that you wouldn't stumble across even after the most crazy night in Vegas if you weren't looking for it.  
Now that we have that over with, when you walk in you realize why this place has garnered its reputation.
The food is simply phenomenal. I mean, I've been to Thailand, gone to a Thai cooking class, and eaten every kind of street food there and Lotus of Siam was essentially the same thing minus the plane flight. The dishes were incredible, from the traditional Northern Thai (pork-based) dishes they are known for, to the duck, to the pineapple rice and stuffed chicken wings.

Without question order food family-style, don't eat the whole day before you go, and stuff your face when you are there.

We felt so amazed by the experience, that we demanded to personally thank the chef, which we were able to do (and of course snapped a photo of the occasion).

A must for anyone looking for some of the most authentic thai food in the US.
Every once in a while, we get the urge for salmon tartar....this is where we go! FANTASTIC!

Every since I saw this restaurant from the food channel, I wanted to come here to try the authentic Thai food. I've been to Thailand only once so it is difficult to me to determine if the dish is authentic or not. But I can tell whether the dish is tasty or not. Thai tea was great. The dishes were very tasty. Unfortunately I don't remember the name of the dishes that I got but I will attach the photos of the food that I had. When I came here which was around 1:45pm, there was an hour wait so be aware of the lines that you need to bear before getting the great meal.

Every time we've gone to Lotus of Siam we laugh at the surroundings because it's in a huge dead strip mall in Vegas. That being said it is one of the places to go in if you're in the city.

I've heard Lotus of Siam being dubbed the best Thai restaurant in the entire west coast. I wouldn't got that far but it is delicious. You have your usual dishes like Pad Thair or Pad Sew Ew but what you really want to check out is the northern dishes on the last couple pages. These are regional Thai plates that you don't usually see in the U.S. 

We tried the Yellow Curry with Chicken, Chicken Satay, Red Curry with Chicken, and Kha Nom Jean Nam Ngyow. Chicken Satay is pieces of chicken cooked on skewers with a yellow sauce, while the Kha Nom Jean Nam Kgyow is a noodle dish with ground pork in a red soupy sauce. We finished with the fried bananas and Coconut Ice Cream. Everything was great and we wold gladly go back again.
Everything here taste really good! Definitely will recommend to others and we surely will come back

Everything was very good to fantastic...we started with the fried wantans and Garlic Prawns, the prawns were very tasty...then we followed with the Pad Thai, which was very good.  The main course was where it was at...the Crispy Duck with Panang...it was amazing, and the green curry with chicken...wow.  We also had an order of the drunken noodles which were very good...overall probably the best Thai food I have ever had.  Service was fast and efficient.

Everything we ordered here was so full of favor. I recommend trying new dishes that you normally wouldn't at a typical Thai place.. You will be pleasantly pleased. I also recommend ordering family style so you can try as much variety as possible. Excellent service, excellent food, will come back for sure!
Excellent food  Superb & authentic choices. A bit pricey though, and location could be better.

Excellent food!
I visit this place every time that I am in Vegas, wonderful food, I never had a bad dish. The downside, the wait, this time we waited for a table almost two hours, they recommend you to make a reservation but, nobody ever answers the phones, so just be patience and have a drink at the bar while you wait. After you are seated the food comes very fast. Worth the wait.

Fabulous! 

 Crappy shopping center, but magnificent inside. Monster wine list, including Malbec served in proper long stem crystal.  

I had the short ribs in soup base w noodle.  The bones were all removed and the meat was lean and no fat.  Probably was one of the best short rib dinners I've ever experienced . Impressive flavor.

Service was rocket fast.  Fifty (50) people came in all at once at 5:30 opening time.  My waiter came over immediately, and began taking my order.  Glass of wine immediately , and less than 5 minutes for the entree' to appear. 

I will be going back!
Fairly good thai food but they don't really take reservations (they take phone reservations but its impossible to get through) and a lot of people came and left disappointed when we were waiting.

Famous Dave's has changed their dining menu.  Be careful when you order the brisket.  Instead of the nice lean slices of brisket that you use to get, now you get about three slices of brisket (no longer cooked with sauce on it) on top of shredded brisket full of fat which looks like it was long on the bottom of the pot.  Definitely not worth the money you pay for it.  I did confirm with the management that the menu has been changed to the unsavory item mentioned above.  What use to be a great dish and well worth the money, is now a glob of fatty shredded tiny pieces of brisket taken from the bottom of the pot with a few pieces of brisket on top, no longer cooked with the delicious sauce that use to give it such a good flavor, and no longer worth the money.

So disappointed.  However if you want good Bar B Que from a great place that isn't trying to pinch pennies go to John Mull's Road Kill Grill.  You will get your money's worth there.

Fantastic Thai restaurant if you are lucky enough to get a table. Get a reservation!  The service is prompt. The food quality is outstanding. The wine list is all encompassing. You will be amazed with the overall experience. A Vegas must do!!
Fantastic and authentic food. Loved the currys and soups. Friendly staff, moderate prices.
Fantastic, well priced, fast service and absolutely the best Thai food in Vegas.  Just get there early and never try to order take away!!!  This business is busy for a reason!
Finally got to experience the magic.  Great and can't wait to go back again.

Finally made it out to this foodie destination and I walked away a happy camper. It's so hard to choose just a few dishes because everything sounds great, so either come with a large group of people or get ready to come back. We had the crispy duck curry (the one with the alcohol, lol) and it was delicious. Super creamy but the crispiness is still there. We also tried the pad thai, which was good but I'd stick with a more unique dish next time. Will be back!

Finally visited this place and am glad I did !!! The expectations were not just met but exceeded. Husband and I went for lunch on a weekday so didn't to have to wait for a table. Our server was very happy to answer all our queries about their incredible wine list or the extensive menu to choose from. We ordered chicken dumplings and northern cousine entrees khao Sui and kang ka noon. Khao sui s a wonderful noodles in a curry dish with beautiful colors n texture. It's definitely going to be a staple for us on our future visits. Kang ka noon was a jackfruit n veggies curry, quite flavorful. We ordered a spice level of 9(indians can eat spicy food :P) which meant all our tastebuds went super active. We did enjoy it but might go for a 7 or a 8 in future. Look forward to explore more of their dishes soon.

First time and it will be my last !! We order the  fried fish cod, calamari, and okra. We pick up our order and when we got home my wife calamari ended up being onion rings and i paid for calamari not onions rings. I called them and they told me to bring everything back. they took the onions rings out and gave me the fried calamari . But the cod and okra instead of frying them , they just told me ok  so now i am eating cold cod and soggy okra. Not to mention they had no spices  on the okra and cod ,  THIS STORE IS NOT WORTH THE TIME OR PRICE !!!

First time here, wanted to see what was all the commotion about the restaurant. For sure, they didn't fail. The service was great, attentive, and on point with ordering. The food was delicious!!  Ordered the Pananng Curry, Sa-tay, and the finished off with the mango sticky rice  too good. Have to give to it to em.

First time we ordered, we got an assortment of little original Thai Dishes. Each was delicious, albeit small. 

Second time we went there we ordered from the Northern Thailand menu, and it was, well... OK. Not sure great, still small servings, but not great. 

So we're tentatively fans, but may need to downgrade later when we go again.

The wait here can be horrendously long. Come on weeknights right before the open to get seats quickly.

Five stars for food, no question. I've eaten here a bunch of times and have never been disappointed... I'm only knocking off a star because I've not always received great customer service. Before you go, you should know, this place gets BUSY... There's a good chance you'll wait an hour or more, even on a Tuesday.

Food Network said this place is some of the best Thai Food you can find anywhere in the country. I have to agree with them. We
came during lunch. The shopping center where the restaurant is located is suspect. However, once we went inside we were greeted by a nice staff and our food flew out of the kitchen. The highlight of our lunch was the deep fried pampano with sweet and sour sauce. The pad thai is fresh and tasty. The stuffed chicken wings were a pleasant surprise. Think a pork egg roll stuffed into
a chicken wing. If you are in Vegas, get off the strip and visit this place!!!
Food is fresh and hot even  on the buffet.  Go early on weekend as tend to get crowded
Food very good and inexpensive, large menu selection, only negative is location, not a safe neighborhood. Hard to get reservations, always busy

Food was 4 stars..
waiters were enthusiastic but poorly trained.
Area is scary at night. 
Restaurant was very tired.
Would probably not go back, there is such a big competition out there in Vegas.
Food was really good! Portion sizes are good, food is full of flavor. Took a party of 10 in for lunch. Service was on point. Will be going back again.

For Thai food in Las Vegas this is really the only place to go.  Allow plenty of time on weekend at dinner time because there is sometimes an hour wait just for a table.  And when you get the food you can tell why.  The menu is very extensive.  I've eaten a lot of Thai food and this is honestly the best.

For some reason everyone wants to go here.  Been there a number of times.  In my humble opinion.... It's average.  Very bad location especially at night.

La Thai is far better!

For the first time traveller to Vegas, it's a little out of the ways from the strip. But WOW!, so worth it. The service was friendly, the food was incredible right down to the last bite and the environment very clean and neat. Will do it again and again the next time I'm in Vegas!

Friday, October 30th, 2015 we popped in for a late lunch around 330pm.  We were seated on the outdoor patio as request and the waiter assistant poured water as soon as we were seated.  Mitch, our server finally came by 12 minutes later to take our drink order.  My partner ordered the Watermelon Fresca which was awful!  Next we placed our order for the Chicken & Waffles and ShortRib Bologne.  Nothing special here. Just so so!  The Chicken was over cooked dry and chewy.  The pickles severed on top of the chicken were excellent.  The ShortRib Bologne was fair, once again nothing special.  But the real issue here is the pour service or lack there of!  If you have a choose, go elsewhere.
From the outside a bit sketchy but once you walk in you can tell they take pride in their food and service. If you like Thai this is one of the places you need to visit in Vegas.

Garlic prawns were amazing, whole family loved - crunchy, tender, tasty, great portion. The crispy rice with sausage was a foodie experience, 5 stars - unique, ton of flavor, loved the mint and red onion. 

Hubby had crispy duck, high on the spice meter, tender and very hot - and he likes spicy. He described is as a different type of heat that he wasn't used too, great experience with Thai chillies. 

I wasn't impressed with the Khao Soi with beef - beef was hard and chewy, I had to politely spit it into my paper napkin, found two more hunks of that. Didn't want to fill up on the noodles, enjoyed the broth, and the crunchy noodles on top got soggy quick. 

Didn't have a reservation, but was seated in 30 min., reasonable for a Saturday night at 6:00, considering its popularity. A great experience for us, beginners at Thai cuisine.
Good food, but the line.... uhh... the line. Waited long to get seats :)
Good was not as great as I expected it to be.

Got here on a Tuesday and had a 20 minute wait. The service was quick and efficient. The food was very flavorful but a little on the salty side. I would give a higher rating if the prices were lower or the portions were bigger.

Great Thai . Had the signature jumbo garlic prawns which were absolutely BOMB! 
Also we had this sliced beef dish , tender and flavorful.
Good wine
Seafood soup was amazing !
Great tasting noodles with chicken & shrimp .
I only wish they didn't forget to put our rice and hard noodles in our to go bag. That was a major bummer .

Great customer service, clean place. ( a little out dated but that's okay) 
The Pad Thai was perfect, I was curious to try the Northern Thai menu since it seemed like their specialty dishes.
I ordered the Kang Hoh and Northern Larb for my BF and I to split. 
There was a spice in there that had a weird smell in the Larb and turned me off to the dish. 
It's not to say it wasn't cooked well, it was just not for me. So I can't give this place five stars until I come back and try their regular Thai items.
I recommend their Pad Thai it's wonderful.
Great example of Thai, especially its specialty dishes from the more Northern region of Thailand. Kind service, ridiculous wine selection that is to die for when paired with Thai. Five stars!

Great food ask for spicy. 
Strange location but worth the trip to find.  
This is a recommendation of penn Sunday school. Spot on
Great food in a surprisingly nice atmosphere. Overall, a nice menu with lots of choices. A great meal.

Great food! Love this place.
Have tried about 10 different things on the menu, everyone was a winner.
There are people that I do business with that are from Orlando, and they insist that we go every time they are here.
Great food, huge menu, parking's a bit far from the door.
Great food, service, and quality. You can not go wrong here!
Great food. Cool place to eat!
Great food. went there after drinking with friends and what they ordered for me was delicious
Great place, always busy because its one of the best in town.  We went with a group and they treated us great and the food was fantastic.

Hands down best Thai food in North America! The owner head chef lady is amazing and is on her staff! Been eating here for over eight years and have seen the restaurant evolve but food stay amazing. Skip the Buffett but order everything else! Wine is amazing also

Hands down the best Thai food I've ever had.  I had the drunken noodles with seafood from the front of the menu for $14.  It was delish.  However, husband had the crispy duck panang curry that is from the back of the menu and it was mind blowing.  Orgasmic.  No joke.  I have had Thai curry from many many places and this made the other places taste like sad watered down imitations.  Holy cow.  It was simple.  Just duck and curry.  No veggies in the curry.  However, that in itself was a flavor explosion.  It's not cheap.  It's $28 but it's worth it.  The portion is not big but it's worth it.  It's simply a symphony of flavors that dance on your palate. Rich and creamy.   Texture of the duck is amazing.  The duck skin is lightly battered and the fat is rendered beautifully. 

We had an appetizer which was the Larb.  I thought it was good but not worth the price at $12.  You had to buy the sticky rice as an extra side at $2.50. Very very small serving.  Maybe two small hands worth.  Again, why are Asian restaurants charging for rice in Vegas??? You need the rice though b/c otherwise you are eating minced meat with...um....nothing.  There's nothing to eat it with b/c it's just a little bowl of minced meat.  

Service was very nice and the server gave us very good recommendations.  There was no wait for lunch on a weekday.

Hannah, you are absolutely amazing!  You always pay such attention to detail.  I am ALWAYS getting compliments on my nails (which is why I always have your business cards with me).  Your place is inviting, exciting and classy, just as you are.

Kathy V

Having lived in Thailand for a couple years and eating Thai food all over the country, I came to this restaurant with high expectations due to the yelp reviews. Here is my opinion of this place. The food quality is pretty basic and authentic. Tastes like a home cook meal - dishes here are a bit more salty, like food made in Thailand. Regarding taste and authenticity I would rate this restaurant as a 2.5*. The prices is over priced. Price/value is 2*. 

Here is what we had.

Hoh Mok Sea Bass (Hor Mok) - $29 - tastes authentic but lacks flavor. Needs to add some finely julienned kafir leaves - which I could not find present in my dish. This dish is normally cooked and served using a small clay pot. This restaurant cooks this dish inside a foil pouch. The top of portion of our Hor Mok, including the fish was somewhat dried (should have been more moist), while there is excess juice accumulated at the bottom of the foil pouch. (If I had known this, I could have tried to fix this by flipping the pouch for a while before flipping it back upright.... lol)

Garlic Prawns. $22 - I feel our shrimp was a bit too salty and over cooked, causing the shrimp to be dried up. The shrimp should not be deep fried for too long like they did at this restaurant. Once done properly you should get a juicy shrimp with a crispy coating on the outside. This dish is basically prepared in the same way as the Chinese salt and pepper pork chop.

Mango with sticky rice. the sticky rice was on the firmer side and not as tender and smooth tasting. Mango was fresh mango.

Heard a couple in the hotel elevator talking about their plans to go here for dinner (5 years ago?) and since then, no trip to Vegas is complete without a meal at Lotus! 

Dinner starts at 5:30 so we always try to come here a little earlier to beat the crowd and even then there's a line. Tonight got here at 5:30 and the wait was an hour. 

TIPS:
- Come at 5 to get in line so when they open at 530 you're first
- Or call for a reservation but their phone is always busy so try calling 1-2 days in advance. Also if you're not here within 5 mins of your reservation, you lose your spot

WHAT WE ORDERED TONIGHT: 
1. Crispy duck panang - THIS IS A MUST TRY. Every time we're here. We usually get this spicy since I think it enhances the flavor. This time we got medium and while still good, spicy would've tasted better. The sauce is AMAZINGG I don't waste a drop of it so once the duck is all gone I put some rice in the dish and mix it with the sauce and yummmm *___*
2. Tom yum soup- was not so yum. Not sure why but the last two times I've been here (tonight included) I wasn't very impressed with the soup. It tasted pretty bland and lacking in flavor. I've had better. This is why 4 stars 
3. Sea bass with drunken noodles - first time trying this and will definitely order this again the next time! 
4. Lamb (the waiter suggested this as it was the special) I personally am not a big fan of lamb so can't really give my opinion on whether or not it was good
And then the defaults:
5. Pad Thai - 4/5 
6. Pad See Ew - my nephew hogged it all before I could get a taste but I didn't hear any complaints and he's very picky with his pad see ew!

The portions are not as big as other Thai restaurants I usually go to so if you're planning to share at the table, keep that in mind! We usually order as many dishes as there are people in our party and keep a menu on the side in case we're still hungry.

Service is great and the waiters are very nice!

Heard the rants about Lotus of Siam, and overall the food was good, service fair and atmosphere hectic. It was a solid A-ok. I would not make it a venture or go out of my way to return as I know there are better Thai places in town, maybe even in Commercial center. Lesson learned, just because a guy on TV rants a place does not mean it is worthy the praise especially when food and service returns to normal and you are not a mucky muck.
High Quality Thai Food in a little dirty part of town but once you are through the doors a great restaurant.
Highly recommend this place above all the Thai restaurants in Las Vegas. Amazing Service and great Duck Curry

I always go to at least one restaurant off the strip when I am in Vegas. Someone told me that Lotus of Siam was on a food show and the Yelp reviews were good, so we decided to give it a try. This is located in an obscure strip mall. We almost missed it, but we saw a lot of people waiting outside so we figured we were in the right place. We went inside and because there was only 2 of us, we got seated right away. The restaurant itself is very nice, clean and spacious.  The busser brought our drinks very quickly. 

We decided to try the Nua Nam Tok (BBQ beef dish) and the garlic pepper prawns (both under the BBQ in the menu). The food came out pretty quickly. The food was pretty amazing. The beef dish had tons of spices (cilantro, mint, green onion, red onion - just to name a few) that worked well together. It was so good! Be careful how spicy you get it. We got it medium and our mouth was on fire at the end of the meal. The BBQ prawns were my favorite. The shrimp, which came with an amazing garlic pepper sauce, was so good and tender. Its definitely a must try. It's a little on the pricey side at $25 for 8 prawns, but I would definitely get it again. 

Overall, I am so glad that I decided to give this place a try. One minor complaint that I have is that we only saw our waiter twice, once to take out order and once to take our check. We ended up flagging down another waiter when we wanted to order additional rice. But, it was not too big of a deal as the other waiters was willing to help us.  I will definitely be back to try other dishes here. (There menu is very expansive and I would like to try other items).

I am no expert in Thai cuisine. However, I believe that good food is universally good. I have travelled the world and eaten cuisine from many different countries, and It is hard for me to even fathom how this place can have an avg of 2 hours wait for dinner. 

I ordered the following:

1. Garlic prawns: 0/5. I ordered based on the rave reviews. At $28, I expected more than prawn shells that were fried to oblivion. Half the shells didn't even have any meat inside. It was severely lacking in garlic flavor.

2. Tom yum Kai: 3/5 tasty but lukewarm. I expected it to be steaming hot, but it felt like the bowl had been sitting out for a while before it was served.

3. Crispy pork belly (#87): 0/5 can be a true delicacy if done right. Lotus, however, did not get it right. It was cold and the portion was abysmal for the price. I could have taken a slab of bacon and fried it with better flavor

4. Drunken noodles with seafood: 0/5 again, portion was small for the price. To add insult to injury, they used fake imitation crab!!! That's disgusting. 

Overall, not worth the wait or the $80 bill. I have heard that the famous lady chef who made this restaurant into fame has retired, and I believe it because based on my experience, it is no better than the average Thai restaurant in middle of nowhere Wyoming. DO NOT EAT HERE!
I came Las Vegas for vacation. This is real thai food (you need to order 10 hot stars).

I came here again, because I know I can only have the best Thai food in Vegas outside of Thailand. It's a tourist trap, but it's 15 minutes from the strip & people still go here regardless of the difficulty to find the restaurant's awkward green light, shaded doors & dark plaza . 

We followed Anthony Bordain's footsteps & tried their Thai curry noodles, ground pork as well as their sticky rice & pad Thai. Curry noodles were to die for!

I came here in September, right before my flight back home. 

We ordered a ton of food, prawns, pad thai, fried rice...pretty much everything on the menu. My boyfriend's brother couldn't stop raving about this place, so I had pretty high expectations. I was expected to be blown away...but it's really just okay. Like I wouldn't go out of my way to come here, but if I was craving Thai in the Vegas area, and didn't want to eat on the strip I would eat here. 

Location is kind of strange. Next to a senior center. Once you go inside you can't tell though.

I came here with some friends while in Vegas. Chef Jet Tila made us a reservation, which he offered to do when I took his Thai town tour in LA, so I knew that it would be good! There were 5 of us and we ordered family style, starting with the summer spring roll special and papaya salad. I am a spicy girl, and those spring rolls were spicy! The papaya salad had perfect flavor, but it was a bit watery for my taste. For mains, we shared fried rice, panang curry with chicken, khao soi with shrimp (my favorite) and barbecued pork. I can't get enough noodles right now and the noodles in the khao soi were perfect! The flavors were perfect in everything and I absolutely loved it! Also, at $140 for the whole meal, what a slamming deal for Vegas!

I can forgive the too long of a wait for fried bananas and 1 scoop of coconut ice cream since the food was out of this world delicious. The khao soi with crispy duck, garlic prawns, northern larb and sai oua (grilled sausage) were insanely good. The papaya salad was just ok and I would probably skip it. 

The restaurant is in a strip mall and it's next to an adult day care center. But who cares?!! As soon as you start eating, you'll be transported to a very happy place.

Glad my parents hightailed it out of NY to retire in one of the suburbs of Las Vegas. I can't wait to visit again and eat here until my stomach explodes.

I don't understand why people love this place so much. Food was alright for the high price--nothing really special. Got the pork curry, garlic wings, and another dish with green beans and chicken. All were okay. Servers moved quickly, though food took about 15 min to reach the table. We were seated quickly as a party of 2 at 11:40am. Other than that, that's all I have.

I finally got the chance to try this place on a random night with my friend! Since I frequently deliver from this restaurant, I had high expectations from the start. The service is always quick and the turnaround is amazing especially since it is always packed.

Be weary of the incredibly long wait that you will most likely encounter when you arrive at the restaurant - I arrived an hour before they closed and I still had to wait 30-45 minutes before I could get a table! However, they send you a text to see a list of other people who are also waiting so that you can leave and come back once the table is ready. There's also a bar where those who are 21+ can wait -- with their wine cellar who can resist?! (I had to drive, so I had to.)

Here's what I had:

Beef pad thai (4/5) // I wasn't expecting the portion to be as small as it was since I'm so used to Thai restaurants giving a hefty load when it comes to pad thai; however, the quality of the food was top notch and the noodles were thinner than what I'm used to. Usually I can never finish portions of pad thai, but this was just enough to fill up my belly!

Mango sticky rice (4/5) // I felt like the mango sticky rice was a little overpriced for the portion they give, but nevertheless the mango was just as sweet as I expected it to be.

Although Lotus is so famous, it didn't really blow me away. Maybe it's because I had such high expectations or maybe it's because I've gone to numerous other Thai restaurants that delivered a better price to portion ratio... but nevertheless for my experience I can't say that it's the best, but the Pad Thai was pretty scrumptious.

I give this place 5 stars simply because I want to keep coming back for the food! The wait is long, the decor is forgettable, the portions are on the smaller side, but all is excused because the food is so good! Try the crispy duck!

I had eaten there four times previously (in 2005, 2006 and 2007) and enjoyed it as a free-flying single gal.  Then I got married and had a baby.  In our first date in a long while (2012), I booked a table for Lotus of Siam.  The food was okay, but not as good as I'd remembered, but the worst part of it was when I saw a large cockroach--yes, a COCKROACH!!--and I could only gape and point speechlessly.  My husband killed the cockroach and informed our waiter, who took it away but did not apologize or call the manager to apologize.  No recompense was offered at all.  I would have complained further, but my husband did not want to press the issue, so we left quietly.  Maybe bugs are par for the course in an old building downtown, but it was not pleasant to have one sharing our dining experience.

I have seen this restaurant featured on Anthony Bourdain's Parts Unknown and Andrew Zimmern's Bizarre Foods America. So, was it any good?

My wife and I came here for a early dinner. Needless to say, I was not so surprised to see the place packed full of customers at 6 pm on a Wednesday. They even have a celebrity wall of fame. We ordered the following:

Nam Prik Ong (red chili dip) $10.95

Isaan Sausage $9.95

Garlic prawns $21.95

Tom Yum Koong (Bowl) $10.95

Crab Fried Rice $13.95

The food was very good. I would say the best dish was the crab fried rice. It had a good balance with the egg, tomato, and onions. The dip was okay. It tasted like spicy bolognese (did i spell that right?) sauce thai style that you can dip fresh veges and chicharron pieces into. FYI, the spicy level was a 3 1/2 out of 5 for my taste and the menu stated it was the least spiciest of the dips! The Isaan sausage tasted good. Think sour longanisa but in a good way. I did though take out some of unrendered fat bits out. The Garlic prawns were pretty tasty. You could eat the shells which was plus. It was a little on the greasy side so the extra napkins surely helped. The soup was good but not something I would order again. Overall I would say that Lotus of Siam was a good experience. The staff are very attentive and friendly. They even pack your leftovers for you and answer any questions about the menu in a short yet concise way. I'll come again to try the crispy duck and the crab fried rice again...and a beer!

I have to give this place 4 stars instead of 5 because after having Arawan Thai, no place else deserves 5 stars. I think the dishes at Lotus of Siam are great, but sometimes can be tendon or Fatty like. The flavors are awesome though and we always receive our food quickly. A must try is the crispy rice on the appetizers!  The menu is so huge I don't know where to start, but I love a big selection,  so I'm not complaining!

I heard this place was the best Thai in Vegas. My friends brag how it's amazing. I've seen pictures of the lines but when I went I think I was expecting too much. I ordered the wontons and the edges were burnt and the meat inside was dry. My friend ordered the "best" pad Thai which was ok. I ordered the duck in curry and it too was ok. Service was well... We got in and there was no one at the front desk. We waited awhile before someone acknowledge us. Our waiter took forever to just get our drink order and an eternity to get our food ordered. Perhaps lunch is not a good time to go. I'll give them another try and go for dinner.
I just love it.  It is simply good.

I kept hearing from multiple sources how great Lotus of Siam was, so I immediately bookmarked it, but after many failed attempts while in Vegas I was beginning to feel that I would never get to check it out. As I was beginning to forget about LoS, I was reminded and managed to wake up in time to come an hour before closing. There was no wait that all my friends complained about. Sweet!

Lotus of Siam is located in a sketchy-looking strip mall off strip. Don't let the area scare you away, because you'll have a enjoyable meal. Nothing like a little bit of anxiety to stir up an appetite. Based on the looks of it, you wouldn't have guessed that it won a bunch of recognitions and popped up on shows and magazines.

Food:
1) Pad See Ew is always a safe and solid option. I always have to order it when I eat Thai.
2) Green Curry - I haven't had a bad experience with Thai curry, *Knock on wood* It was savory and creamy.
3) Crispy Rice - I didn't expect the crispy rice to be limy. I personally like the limy flavor, so I personally enjoyed it.
4) Tom Yum Soup was good. It didn't particularly stand out from all the other ones I've tried. Other than the price tag.

Service: Decent. Nothing special.

Overall: Good food. The taste was on the better side, but the portions were lower while the price was higher than all the Thai restaurants I've been to.

I live in Las Vegas and went with a visiting friend.  We waited for nearly 1 1/2 hours to be seated. The Restaurant itself is old and not pretty or pleasant to look at. I'm confused at all the fuss. It was just asian food and certainly not worth the lengthy wait or the price.  I would not go there again.  The one thing I did like was the very strong orange colored ice tea.

I lived and worked in Thailand for 16 years. Needless to say, I ate in many a Thai restaurant during my stay and I know what Thai food should taste like. When I arrived here in Vegas I heard about Lotus of Siam. Tried it for the first time today for lunch. My Thai wife and I ordered 3 dishes, glass noodle salad, fried fish cakes and beef noodle soup. Don't get me wrong now, I'm not saying the food was not edible. What I am saying is, they were not authentic. When you order a Thai dish in a restaurant that you have ordered many times before and get something that is not what you expect, it is disappointing.  Might go back for a second try. Maybe for dinner this time. Different chef may make a difference.

I love Lotus of Siam! 

I was not aware about it until my cousins not from town introduced me to this place. The wait time was worth it. We opted to order some drinks at the bar while waiting for our table. We had pad thai, crispy duck with panang curry, garlic prawns and nam prik. The pad thai had a njce combination of sweet, salty, sour and spicy. Noodles were cooked al dente. The crispy duck was really crispy, and I was impressed how the sauce was flavorful and well crafted. Their garlic prawns were indeed garlicky! They included the shells, which I doubted at first but ended up munching because it was crisp and delicious. I was not fond of the nam prik, although the sauce had good flavors and the vegetables were cooked perfectly. I will be back!

I love Thai food and the food here is simply amazing!!! I can't get enough of this place but it is always packed and I hate the wait but it's totally worth it.  They have a very nice bar so that's where I make my time go by...the longer the wait the more I drink...lol...I guess that's what they want since everyone spends more on drinks than on the meal itself.  Very authentic.  I like pad se ew and tom yum koong and my husband loves the coconut shrimp and curry.  Whatever we like they have....i'm in heaven every time I come here to eat.  Definitely the best thai place in Vegas!!!

I love red curry! My husband had pad sew with garlic chicken wings.  Mom was scared to try anything so she stuck to fried rice but end up eating hubbies food.  We came in for lunch a few minutes before kitchen closed.  But we will definitely be back.  Nice atmosphere, decor and a book as their wine list lol.

I loved this place. There was a 45 minute wait, but well worth it. I ate the pork stew off the northern menu. It was delicious. The place was busy, clean and the staff were very attentive. No surprise some of my favorite food network chefs had their pictures on the wall. I'll definitely be back next time I'm in Vegas

I only take people who are really special to the Lotus of Siam for lunch.  After all, if too many people hear about it, how am I going to get a table and get back to work on time?  Many court officials, including judges and bailiffs can be seen enjoying lunch at this hidden gem.

I ordered the initial En Tuon hot and sour soup with beefon tendon, sprouts, etc. The broth was nice and tastefully spicy. The beef slices, well, most of it was that fat trimmings. I think there might have been actually like two or three beef slices, and like six fat gristle.

I also ordered the pad thai extra spicy, and that's exactly what I received. However, for twelve bucks, the portions were smaller than I had wanted it to be.

The lack of a lunch special bogs down what would have been a four star restaurant. 

I probably would choose another Thai venue than this, and found this place to be incredibly overrated.

Daniel
I really like this restaurant.  My co-workers and I go here during lunch.  Each time, I am always satisfied.  Their chicken panang and chicken larb are very tasty.

I recommend the crispy duck with panang curry. The duck is cooked perfectly - the duck is crispy and dry on the outside and soft and juicy inside. It's one of the better duck dishes I've tried in Thai restaurants. Value wise, the restaurant is reasonably priced and even on the lower end, especially for beers. The food quality is high, although the interior of the restaurant could use some work.

I refused to go back to Los Angeles until I have Lotus of Siam. It is by far the BEST Thai food that I have ever had! My boyfriend has been asking to go here for the longest time... and in my head.. Im thinking... whats the big deal.. its just THAI food.... omg..  was I wrong!! The food is sooooo amazingly orgasmic! 

What to order:

Panang curry - chicken or duck... whatever protein.. still bomb.

Crispy Duck Drucken Noodles - the noodles are so good here.. you can tell it is the real deal.

GARLIC CRISPY SHRIMP - if you don't order this... I have no words for you. 

TIP: Go during their lunch hour.. its not as busy.... if you go for dinner... be there at 5pm before doors open at 530. My boyfriend and I got there at 545pm... and had to wait for 1 hour. 

Good luck!!

I remember when this place was smaller and less of a must-do for tourists. But thankfully, while the wait time for a table has gone up, the quality and service have remained the same. This is some seriously tasty Thai food! It is easily some of the best I've ever had. Ok, probably, THE best I've ever had. It's a lengthy menu with lots of options. And you can order everything to your personal spiciness level. I've never had anything other than great here. And it's fun to be adventurous and try new things here. If you have to wait for a table, there is a small bar where you can try to grab a seat (or stand around) and get a drink or too. The wait times have never been all that bad, and it's usually much quicker than the estimate they give you. The ambiance and decor are nice. It can feel a bit crowded, but it's not uncomfortable or bad. And it surprisingly not all that loud. All in all, an excellent place to eat.

I saw Lotus of Siam featured on the Travel Channel and it received rave reviews as the best Thai restaurant in Las Vegas.  I visited there for lunch and was not disappointed.  This is not only the best Thai I've had, but one of the best restaurants I've ever visited.  The prices are reasonable enough to ensure that I will be a repeat customer.  During my visit I ordered the fried wontons for the appetizer and the Thai spaghetti for the main course.  The spaghetti was delicious and perfectly prepared.  I visited on a Wednesday afternoon and the place was busy for lunch.  Nevertheless, I got a table right away and the service throughout the meal exceeded my expectations.  After the main course I ordered the coconut ice cream, which was the perfect way to end such a great meal.  The portions were all suitable for one diner, negating the need for takeout boxes.  The menu is large enough and features a varied assortment of Thai dishes that will make you want to come back and try something new.

I truly enjoyed our experience here.  The wait was about an hour but the food came out really quickly and the customer service was on point.  We got the most talked about Crispy Duck with Panang Curry and the Garlic Prawns, with some Pad See Ew with beef.  I cannot describe how amazing the flavors were and how crispy the duck and prawns were! Yummy!  5 star experience!

For the price of the Chef Choice dishes (Crispy Duck with Panang and Garlic Prawns), which was over $25 each, it seemed too pricey.  The Pad See Ew was more reasonable at $11.95 and includes a choice of meat.  It is also located in a pretty sketchy neighborhood.  I would probably come here once every few years haha.

I visited Harry and David at the Las Vegas Premium Outlets on 12/10/15 to purchase cookies to mail to my boyfriends grandmother and I just wanted to say that I had a very pleasant experience. The displays of the products are all over the store and there are so many items to choose from which are decorated beautifully for Christmas. I sampled tea, yogurt covered pretzels and the raspberry-filled tree-cutout shortbread cookies which were to die for.

I would also like to mention that I received wonderful service from Shanique. She was a great help in assisting me with picking out cookies for my boyfriends grandmother. She was extremely kind, patient and very informative about the products. She made the process very easy and enjoyable. She is a true asset to this company and I will always make sure she is working before I go to the store.

I was hoping to be blown away as LOS is touted as one the best Thai places in the US but walked away thinking yeah this is good but not 5 star good.  

We started off with a few apps and the stand out for me was the Nam Kao Tod.  The crispy rice along the spices and pork was a great combo.  Probably the best thing I had all night.

I also had the Sea Bass Drunken Noodles which was okay.  The sea bass itself was great but the Noodles were about average and didn't have a lot of spice going on despite ordering it at a 6.  Tangent ... the spice scale is never consistent so it's tough to gage if a 6 is going to burn your face off or not have any spice at all.  This time it was not spicy at all, lesson learned.

Next time I stop in I'll level set my expectations and order spicer than a 6.  

Another tangent ... the reservation process is kind of a hassle but I get why they do it.  There was a bar that served food so that might be a better option than trying to get in weeks in advance.

I was kinda disappointed with this joint after all the hype...

The service was awesome, the ambiance was fine. But the food? I wouldn't go out of my way to return. I ordered the chicken soup -Tom Kah Kai , the flavors were a delight. However I think it had been sitting on the warmer half the evening ergo the chicken was rubbery and over cooked. The garlic shrimps I had were far too greasy. It was completely unappetizing.
My other half had the nam prik ong. It was alright, but he was unsure as to why it was the best dish Ming Tsai ever had. Mr. Man was completely underwhelmed... We've had Pok Pok (in Portland, OR) sticky rice, sticky rice at home, and many other restaurants. But here? It wasn't very good. Just sticky and cold. Only good for a bonding agent. 
I would not recommend a return visit. It seems like they're just trading on their reputation.

I was really excited to try this restaurant I've heard a lot of good things about it! Supposedly the best Thai food in Las Vegas. I was quickly disappointed by lousy service and underwhelming food considering the price but what really ruined my night was finding a log hair embedded in my food. To my surprise I still had to pay in full my meal about $100 for 2 people and I got miss changed for the vine as well. They didn't try to keep me as a customer at all!!

I went in with really high expectations since they had so many reviews and it seemed like everyone was raving about it. To be honest, I've had better. The drunken noodles were a bit on the soupy side which is not what I am accustomed too, and the hot and sour soup was really lukewarm and too sour. The one thing that did taste amazing was the crispy shrimp, but with a price tag of 27 dollars, I could pass. The yelp reviews make it seem like this place is bustling, but when I went in at lunch time, it was not even half full. Either the food at this place has declined or something is up.

I went on Yelp to find a good carpet cleaner. After finding Fresh Start and reading the reviews I decided to us them. I am so happy I did. Adolfo of Fresh Start cleaned my rugs and not only did a good job, but did a great job. I had stains on my carpet and he removed all of them. My carpet is 15ys. old and now they look like new. Adolfo and his team respect your home and are completely professional. I would recommend any who needs their carpets done to use Adolfo. I will be using them from now on. I live in Henderson, Nevada not San Fran. Ca.
I won't say anything new that someone hasn't already said about this place...it's a jewel. Ok, nevermind, I'll say something...one word...Crispy Duck.
I would fly to Las Vegas for the sole purpose of dining at Lotus of Siam.

I would give this local treasure a 4.5.  We hit up this spot every time we go to Vegas 

Wait:  lines are super long esp on weekends but it's worth it.  Pro tip call 7 days in advance and get reservations.  They will text you when your table is ready.  If you call same day they rarely pick up

Food
- best authentic Thai food you will ever experience.  The depth of their menu is impressive.  The food is amaze balls
- Khao Soi with braised beef:  crunchy noodles & soft yellow egg noodles in a curry sauce is a great texture juxtaposition. the braise beef so soft it's to die for.  
- Tom Kha Kai soup:  medley of hot sour and coconut soup served piping hot with soft chicken slices.  Very good broth.  Can't go wrong with this dish IMHO
- Druken noodles fried duck- small portions for $27 Greasy don't know why so much hype over this dish.
Tip:  Thai ice tea average
 
Parking:  big lot it's free.  Most taxis know how to get here.

Cons
-  over the years they've really jacked up the price slowly
- portions smallish considering it's an Asian place
- service slow got our check wrong

Still a great food experience and lots of options to try.  Get reservations and save yourself a headache.

I'll start by saying I love the food here! Their remodel really opened things up and it's been for the better. This is a Las Vegas favorite and a good place to take out-of-towners. 

Unfortunately, because of the area, you have to be careful at night in the parking lot. 

The one downside of this place is that sometimes the wait is long. Once I had to continually ask the hostess if we were still on the list and I was afraid to step outside because I just thought I would lose our place in line. While they were busy, I felt ignored that time; it is always nice to get an update when you have to wait a while. Also, there is no real place to wait inside.

As for the food: Definitely worth the wait. Lots of options and good dishes to share. Traditional and unique dishes for this Thai gem.

I'm a Thai food junkie. Not to sound hyperbolic, but I could literally eat Thai everyday. This restaurant has been highly recommended by many people and I'm so glad I finally had the opportunity to try out. It's a cab ride off the strip in a dismal little strip mall, but don't be deterred, it's worth the trip. The wait was long, even though there were several open tables which was a bit confusing. The staff was very friendly and helpful. I started with the chicken larb appetizer which was the best I'd ever had. Three of us dined "family style" so we were able to try a lot of different meals. I ordered the green curry which was very good...they are not shy with their spices, so buyer beware. (They can always cut the spice down if you get too ambitious.) Also had the Tom Kum Kai Bangkok soup which had me sweating and my sinuses cleared. We also passed around some Koong Tenn, a roasted shrimp plate that was by far the best meal ordered that night. The shrimp were huge and prepared perfectly. Definitely worth trying out, and I will be back next time I'm in town.

I'm giving this place a 5 star solely on the crispy duck panang.  holy crap I don't think I've ever had a better duck curry.  I can't even begin to describe all the ways that the curry sauce flavors danced around my taste buds.  It's a wonderful creamy red curry paste with coconut flavors.  

The rest of the dishes, like the garlic prawns, and the crab fried rice were probably very good but I just kept on trying to eat rice with the red panang sauce.  Where do they have something comparable in LA???? Or do I have to go back to LV this weekend.

I'm not sure what I can say about this place and hasn't already been said. The food in the service were exceptional, without a doubt the best Thai food I've ever eaten in my life. Truly an experience not to be missed if you're a foodie, or  if you just love Thai food and you find yourself in Las Vegas.

I'm only giving Lotus of Siam 5 stars because I can't give it 6 stars. Best Thai food I have ever had! 

Most Thai restaurants have really similar menu's but Lotus of Siam has unique, elevated dishes that put it above all the competition. We got there at 5:10pm (opens at 5:30pm) and there was already a line of people waiting outside. But we had no problem being seated because the restaurant's pretty large inside and we got in with the first wave. 

Dishes that WOW'ed us:
Drunken noodles with soft shell crab 
Crispy duck with panang curry
Garlic prawns
Pad Thai w/ chicken and shrimp

Service is excellent. Bookmark for your next Vegas getaway NOW!

I'm only giving Lotus of Siam 5 stars because I can't give it 6 stars. Best Thai food I have ever had! 

Most Thai restaurants have really similar menu's but Lotus of Siam has unique, elevated dishes that put it above all the competition. 
Dishes that were best:

Drunken noodles with soft shell crab 
Crispy duck with panang curry


Highly recommended!!!!!
I've been a local in Vegas for 8 years now and LOVE taking my friends to Lotus of Siam! Their menu is amazing and the Chef is incredible so definitely try more than just the Pad Thai!

I've been here once and have heard many great things as well as it being the best Thai restaurant in Las Vegas. It was very crowded and the food was decent, but there are other places I prefer here in town.

I've been to Vegas multiple times and I finally got a chance to try this place and wow, the food here is amazing! If you had to order just one thing, it would be the soft shell crab drunken noodles. That's all you need.

We ordered:

1. Soft Shell Crab drunken noodles - AMAZING. This is one of the very few places where I've tried authentic delicious soft shell crab. They used the right amount of batter to give you that perfect crispy texture! The sauce for the noodles was addicting (hehe, drunken noodles), and everything tasted great! A must try! So worth the $23! (5/5)

2. Pad-see-ewe - The noodles tasted great, and the seasonings were spot on with the beef. One of the best ones I've tasted. But my heart still goes with the Soft Shell Crab drunken noodles. (5/5)

Credit cards are accepted. Plenty of parking. Service is friendly. If I'm ever craving Thai food in Vegas, I would definitely come here again! =)

I've had a lot of Thai food in my 20 something years and I must say this place set the bar. Everything else from here on out is going to be mediocre. Granted it was on the freaking pricey side but at least it was tasty. 

Sea bass w drunken noodles: bomb sea bass. It was perfectly fried. It wasn't too breaded. The fish really held on its own. The noodles were spicy but not too spicy. 

Garlic prawns: they hooked it up. I mean I guess they should for the price. It was so crispy and tasty. I ate the heads whole. If you're not eating the head then you're missing out. Waste not, want not. 

Tom yum soup: they use fresh mushrooms. Other places will use canned mushrooms. It was good. My boyfriend was hungover and it got his stamp of approval. 

Nam Prik Ong: it was okay. I thought it was going to be better because it was on the food network. It reminded me of tomato sauce with pork. I was hoping it would be spicy, it wasn't. The chicharron was the best part.

I've heard so much about this place and the hype from all these food tv shows! Finally got a chance to go off strip and eat here for lunch! Don't get me wrong the food is pretty good but overpriced due to the popularity and hype. We ordered drunken noodles with fried fish, and the was tasty but the noodles were a bit too soggy for me. The Northern style curry was more like a soup. But I did enjoy the crispy duck panang curry! The prices on some of the dishes are a bit overpriced and small in portion size.

I've only experienced takeout from this place and I've never been more disappointed. My friends and I decided to grab takeout due to the long wait and we ordered the crispy duck curry and the drunken noodles.

First off, we had originally ordered the regular duck curry, but the lady told us that we should get the crispy duck because it was what the restaurant was known for. Given that the price of the crispy duck was more than double the price of the regular, she assured us that the portion of crispy duck was much larger and enough for 3. Thus, we decided to pay $28. She told us the wait would be 25 min.

We ended up waiting much more than an hour for takeout. Upon finally getting our food and opening the boxes, we found in the large takeout box, only 11 thin pieces of crispy duck, a carton of curry, and a small box of rice. For $28, it was simply a RIP-OFF. Don't get me wrong, the food was decent, but completely not worth the price. And we felt cheated.

The drunken noodles were decent but I've had better at many other places.

If you are reading this review....plan on going there for dinner...tomorrow (at the earliest) as the wait is usually long unless you have a reservation. Same day reservations are kinda hard to get....but worth a try.
My In-Laws accompanied my wife and me for dinner here. We had our reservation at 8:00 and walked in at 7:55 PM and were seated right away. The service was quick and the server gave us a quick run down on the popular dishes. 
We had the crispy duck with noodles which was heavenly. We also had the sausage, red chilli dip and the garlic shrimp. The shrimp seemed a tad expensive but it was so decadent....the red chilli dip was spicy and had a nice flavor. The sausage was slightly sour, spicy and did not seem greasy at all.
If you like spicy/hot food....order a 8/10. If you are weak minded and adventure is not your thing....6 should get you there!
If you love and can stand fried food, go for the garlic prawns and stuffed chicken wings. Crispy duck is so-so, more on the fatty side and not as crispy.

If you're craving some bomb af thai food mosey on over to Lotus of Siam, located just a hop skip away off the strip.  

This is as authentic as Thai gets in Vegas. Their menu is extensive so there will be something for everyone.  

***Prepare to wait if you don't have a reservation*** 

My recommended, popular dishes : 
Spicy Chicken Wings
Stuffed Chicken Wings 
Spicy Catfish
Pad Thai
Crab Fried Rice 
Panang Curry 
Roasted Duck Curry 
Garlic Prawns 
Drunken Noodle with Crispy Duck

If you're in Vegas and sick of the Strip's fare, or not liking what seems like a lack of value in what they are able to offer, try the Thai food at Lotus of Siam. It's some of the best casual food you'll find in the area.
