The location is a short cab ride from the LV Strip in a older little Asian strip mall- don't expect much on that end. On the other hand, the food is great, the prices are good, and the wait isn't too long if you pick a good time to get there.

In a city where food spots must compete with the best of the best, a Thai place with thousands of reviews and 4-5 stars says a lot.  The restaurant is pretty large, with pictures of celebrities who've eaten there, covering the walls from top to bottom.  

The restaurant has speedy service, prices a little on the high end for some dishes, but money well spent.  Lotus of Siam offered some of the best, quality Thai food I've ever had, an experience that will get me to come back in the future.

We ordered the 
- garlic shrimp (skin like potato chips, fried perfectly it buttery batter; $27, but a most order): http://www.yelp.com/user_local_photos?select=EmtQ-VHVShfszx-JszgebQ&userid=p5RcabsU9DXQEDef9RiRlQ
- crying tiger, charbroiled beef with hot sauce and sticky rice (nicely marinated, tender charbroiled beef that goes well with sticky rice; careful with that hot sauce if you're driving home the next day - $17 dish): http://www.yelp.com/user_local_photos?select=PdqT3DYEP3Au93n5zzShsg&userid=p5RcabsU9DXQEDef9RiRlQ
- Tom Yum soup (spicy!): http://www.yelp.com/user_local_photos?select=xej3SJkCQu8Sh5K65E6eXg&userid=p5RcabsU9DXQEDef9RiRlQ
- Coconut ice cream; a must!: http://www.yelp.com/user_local_photos?select=OjIQUqcaDDYGh8b8ZnF0Mw&userid=p5RcabsU9DXQEDef9RiRlQ

The entire meal was about $70 for 2 people.  While we could have eaten for less at one of Vegas many buffets and restaurants, I'm happy we got to experience this spot and I'm sure we'll be back for more in the future.

In planning our trip to Vegas we knew that, since we are not big clubbers, we were looking to do shows and other fun things in the evenings. We booked two shows and went looking on the internet to find something "different". When we came upon the Lip Smacking Foodie Tour we knew that it was for us. My wife and I both like to cook and we have visited most of the upper-tier restaurants in and around Chicago. We signed up for the evening strip tour with drinks. We hesitated when we saw the price but we said, what the heck, it seems overpriced but let's do it anyway.

We met our guides Abra and Donald, and the four other tour participants in front of the Aria at 6PM. For the next four hours we were treated to gracious hosts, reserved seating, luscious food and delicious drinks. An easy cop-out for the tour would to be to go the well known chef driven restaurants, the Guy Fieri's, the Wolfgang Puck's, etc... What we did instead was to go to the lesser know chef driven restaurants where the food is really delivered with commitment and passion. At each stop we were given three, and sometimes four, of the chefs signature dishes. I could not tell you which stop was my favorite as they were all great. We were always very heartily welcomed at the restaurants. The staff, and sometimes the chef him/her self, would come out to explain the dishes and to thank us for coming. Be ready for somewhat adventurous eating. If meatloaf and mashed potatoes is your idea of a great meal out then this is probably not for you. And the drinks, they were always plentiful and delicious. They were also sure to complimented the food being served. Surprisingly, one was very elaborate, involving fire and alcohol vapor sipped from a beaker. Not only did the tour provide us with great food and drink, along the route we were treated to a behind the scenes tour and tasting of how chocolate was made and a very interesting stop at a unique shop that we had walked by several time without really noticing. Very cool! Don and Abra also pointed out several art installations that we had missed before. Nothing like a little culture with your movable feast.

The following day, when we showed the concierge at our hotel the prior evening's itinerary she was very impressed. She said that these were some of here favorite restaurants and that they were definitely "under the radar" for most tourists.  She said that she plans now to take the tour herself.

So, all in all it was a great experience. The food and drink was fantastic. The hosts did a great job and the walking part of the tour was interesting and enlightening. As far as the cost of the tour in concerned, we now feel that it is a drop dead bargain. If the experience sounds good to you, do not let the price deter you. I think that you will find that it is well worth the price of admission.

It was good. In a sketchy area with a warning on the door that they've had a lot of car break ins. Extensive wine list featuring wines from almost any country. I'm not sure that it was amazing enough to travel outside of Summerlin tho
It was just OK for my taste.  We went there for lunch and it was crowded.  And the waiters were just rushing everything, obviously, we felt rushed as well.

It was okay, I ordered the Rad Na and my husband had the pad se eww. Both were okay, nothing compared to the food in Westminster, Ca. I found it to be missing some flavors and was very disappointed. From the reviews, I expected a lot. I wouldn't recommend this place to others, especially if it was their first time trying out Thai food. If you can't even get the main traditional dishes right, I cant even imagine the others.

It's a hole in the wall literally, and in a kind of  shady location, but the Food tastes awesome!! They have a gigantic menu with food from different regions. It's a bit pricey and it was packed when I went on a weekday evening. We waited a little while for our food and was a little underwhelmed with the portion size. The food was delectable though.

It's as good as the hype. It is a weird shopping center and looks tiny from the out side. But inside it is big and nice and delicious. I recommend getting a reservation though because it books up fast.

Just a dinner here. Service is great - bunch of people run by our table. Food was good. Portions are not as big as in the Thai St Cafe. $11 a meal. Would've put 4 stars but it fascinates me how this place grew from a whole in the wall to such a big place. Is it all because of celebrities?
Just ask them to bring you dinner. Fantastic food!
Just go here! It's worth the taxi ride. I go multiple times when I am in Vegas. Don't let the neighborhood fool you! This is some of the best food on the strip!

Just got another typical response from Cox communications.  I've been complaining about the same problem with my email for 6 months now this was the fourth time I've called it in and after explaining the problem twice and then stating that it was ridiculous that I was having to explaining it again and been on the phone for 40 minutes THEY HUNG UP ON ME! As I said, "typical."  We became Cox customers 7 years ago and now I will definitely be looking for an alternative.

LORD HAVE MERCY!!!

We came here to eat dinner for my man's big sister's B-day celebration & I really just want to say OMG!!! I was so full but I WANT EVERYTHING all over AGAIN!!!! O_ O & end my review w/ that.... but I have to EXPRESS what wonderful flavors I got to experience.

Service was on PAR they were quick & not once did u see my glass of water ever get below half way. They really had TEAMWORK on point. We had a reservation at 6pm & the place was PACKED even in the little waiting area & it did NOT slow down at all even as we were leaving....

The plaza that this resteraunt is located literally makes you re-think if you want to be dining there.... but do Not let this fool you or drive you away in any way! Definitely like finding a treasure box in the middle of the desert!
The interior was simple w/ not too much cluttering decor. The waiting area & entrance was quite small. There are a whole but of pictures that are framed of all the famous people that have dined here one being the GREAT Chef Joel Robouchon. They also have a glass cellar of wines galour that is one of the only thing that makes this resteraunt give it a CLASSY look hahahaha =]

SPICY WINGS $8.95 - just full of flavor & the right amount of spice to blend w/ the sweetness

SCALLOP DRUNKEN NOODLE $23.95 - Scallops were HUGE & again another flavor packed dish

FRIED WHOLE FISH - this fish was amazing like the bones we're crispy enough to be like chips.

GARLIC PRAWN $26.95 - OMG OMG I could eat a freaken whole plate to myself. The crispyness of this dish is PERFECTION!

PLAR LAAD PORK $25 - I think this one was the curry sauce that went well w/ the rice that it came with.
 
NAM KAO TOD $8.95 - a nice crispy rice appetizer dish that is refreshing w/ the perfect amount of spice & still refreshing w/ some weggies on the side.

FRIED BANANA ROLL $8.50 - cute little wonton shell rolled banana w/ the perfect crunch to every bite

MANGO & STICKY RICE $8.95 - O_O soon good!! They also do NOT serve this dish if the mango is not to perfection!

YUM NAUH $13.95 - THAI beef salad refreshing w/ a kick

THAI TEA $2.50 - not the BEST that I've had but it was still good.

But all in all EXPECT a wait if you don't make a real!!

Last night is my second times with Lotus of Siam.  All delicious really.  The owner is wonderful lady, she is very polite and nice to everyone.  I intend to visit every times when I will hve times to visit Las Vegas and introduce to all my friend who want to visit Las Vegas.
Long wait. The food is quite good. We ordered curry, salad and crispy shrimp. The crispy shrimps was good but overpriced.

Lotus Siam- hands down, the best Thai restaurant I've ever been to.

Ugh I think the thousands of reviews of this place already says it all. You really just have to go here to witness its greatness. Almost everything we ordered was top notch. The real standout was the sticky rice and mango. 

Don't be scared that it's in the middle of a sketchy strip mall. It'd be worth it- trust me!
Lotus has to be the best Thai food I have ever had! You will not be disappointed with any of the items on the menu. Reasonable prices. You can have anything according to your spice level. Deeleesh.

Lotus is a big restaurant with small restaurant service and quality. The crispy pork belly, yellow curry, pineapple fried rice, and summer rolls were ALL 5 out of 5. The veggies in every dish were crisp and fresh! Lotus will basically ruin all other Thai restaurants for you. Sorry not sorry! Make a reservation and if you have to wait - it's worth it. Have a drink at the bar ;)

Lotus of Siam is one of our favorites near the strip.

It's a little out of the way and the area may steer you away but the food and service is well worth it.

We have been impressed by every item that we've tried and often recommend this restaurant to friends visiting out of town.

Lotus of Siam is tucked away off the Vegas strip in a part of town that looks very sketchy.  However, once you make it past that and the small doorway of the building then you have entered Thai greatness.  The restaurant is actually quite big once you get inside.  They serve what I believe to be the best authentic Thai dishes in the city, and have a huge selection of wines available.  The staff are all very friendly and constantly checking up on the table.  It is a great experience overall, would recommend to anyone looking for quality Thai food.

Lotus of Siam...what has not been said about this place?   Food is incredible, affordable and unique.  

Must haves:  

Garlic prawns.  Over half the tables have prawns whenever I'm there.  Crispy,  flavorful, delicious.  Don't forget to eat the shell and tail.  It might sound a little odd, but you'll thank me.  One of my favorite dishes in the city.

Crispy duck on drunken noodle.  It's always on my table when I'm eating at lotus.  Great flavor in the duck and the noodles.

Nam prik ong.  Ming Tsai called it the best dish he's had in Vegas.  Considering the foodie nature of the city, those are big words.  A non spicy chili dip with ground pork and served  with vegetables.  not sure why it's so good...it just IS.  

ONE THING TO NOTE...they specialize in northern Thai cuisine.   Order off that section of the menu, along with the chef specialties.  Don't come here looking for mind blowing pad Thai, curry, or anything you're used to eating at a "normal" Thai place.  This is the holy grail of Thai restaurants...order what they do best.  If you have questions...the servers will be more than happy to assist you.  

Happy eating!
Love it all. The wine selection is outta this world.

Love the Food, Great Service, Moderate Prices. Do not be turned off by the Dicey looking shopping center, it will be worth it. From Very Authentic to the Beginner in Thai food, this place has something for everyone.
Love the food! The menu is huge and the wine selection is even bigger!

Love the lunch buffet.  It is the surprise to everyone I take there, and believe me, I take every one who visits me.  Notice that a lot of court officers, judges and other public figures partake of lunch at this hidden gem.

Love their food here. The line is always so long for a table, so I've gotten takeout here twice now. We tried a lot off their menu since we had a large group of people, but the highlights for me was their garlic prawns and panang curry. I still want to go back to try some of their other dishes, but this is definitely worth a visit if you're in the area and craving Thai.

Love this place. The atmosphere of the restaurant is great. It was hard to find, but all the best places are hidden gems am I right? Food was so good, I can't wait to come back! And our server was very friendly!

Lunch on a Friday, 11:30am arrival. Table for 4, no wait, but the restaurant was packed 30 minutes later. No reservations for lunch, FYI.

If you're on a time crunch, I'd browse the menu online beforehand so you have a good idea of what you want to order. The menu is like a book! So many options! I wanted to try it all!

We ordered:
1. #56 NUA SAO RENU Sliced charbroiled beef served on beds of sliced cabbages, topped with our homemade tamarind sauce and fried dry chili. $17.95
2. #39 SOM THUM [Thai Papaya Salad]  green papaya, chili, tomato, crushed
peanuts mixed with lime juice, fish sauce and sugar. $8.95
3. GARLIC PRAWNS Deep fried prawns with shellls (almost like potato chips), sautéed with our special garlic sauce, topped with ground black pepper. $26.95
4. CRISPY DUCK DRUNKEN NOODLE Crispy duck topped with fresh homemade chili and Thai basils. Served on the top of pan fried flat rice noodles. $25.95
5. Fried banana dessert $8 plus coconut ice cream $4. These two go together heavenly, but the star really was the coconut ice cream.
6. Thai iced tea x 4.  The Thai tea here is really good. Not over sweet like other Thai restaurants. The tea flavor really comes through.


Pros:
1. Delicious food. Everything we ordered was really good and I would order again.
2. Lot of variety on the menu. Especially Northern Thai dishes
3. Fresh ingredients. You can taste the quality.

Cons:
1. Pricey for Thai food, 4 dishes + 4 thai teas = $110 after tax, before tip. Yikes.
2. Can be a long wait depending on what time you go

Verdict: Totally worth it! The food here is amazing. It's a must visit restaurant on my Vegas list.

Pro-tips:  
1. GO STRAIGHT TO THE BACK OF THE MENU TO TRY THE NORTHERN THAI DISHES 
2. Go with a bigger group if you want to try more dishes!
3. Beware of the spiciness levels! Thai spicy is no joke! We got level 2 and it was pretty spicy for me and I'm usually great about handling spicy foods.

Make a reservation before you come! This place has good food but it's not worth the one hour wait. This place has greatly expanded since I came a few years ago but the wait time is still the same.

The garlic prawns and crispy duck panang curry are just tries!

Me and my friends went back there again because we have a great time there, but this time the food was not good at all.  So, we asked the waiter and he said they have change the chef.  I wanted to ask him if the owner has change as well, but that would be rude.  So, I wouldn't recommend this place because the food was terrible.

Me and my wife moved to Las Vegas a few years ago and we saw the anthony bourdain special on CNN referring to Lotus of Siam.  We made a note to try it out but couldn't find the time with the new baby on the way.   This past few months we were able to go for dinner and bring our 18 month old with us.    Whenever I eat Thai, I always order the same thing "Spicy Basil with Rice" with number 4 heat index.   I probably have sampled this dish at atleast 20 different restaurants around the country.   Lotus of Siam is by far the best.  I don't know what they are doing exactly but it tastes amazing.   We ordered some chicken satays for our little one and cut them up in small peaces.   They were not too spicy and he ate all 3 of them.
Memorable thai that was worth the fast-moving line. If you have no reservations, get there when it opens. Delicious.

Mom and I decided to give this place a try when multiple people we know recommended it as being their favorite Thai place...ever.  My true rating is about 3.5.

So we went for a leisurely lunch at around 11:40am Friday.  Business was just starting to ramp up.  We were seated at a tiny two-top...BOO...which I always hate especially when I see other parties of two sitting at 4-tops.  Not conducive to us ordering so many dishes...

We started with the papaya salad and pork larb (my must-have at any Thai place).  The dressing for the papaya salad was a little too sweet for my taste, and my fork got all sticky.  The larb was an excellent version.  Both portions were very skimpy.

For entrees, we ordered what most people on Yelp recommended - the crispy duck panang and garlic prawns.  We also got the Thai fried rice w/ beef.  The garlic prawns, I have to say, were amazing.  I expected them to be like the Chinese version, deep fried with scallions and peppers on top.  However, these were a step above...with the shell still attached and well-deep fried so you can munch on it separately from the shrimp itself.  Great flavor.

I have to say that while the crispy duck panang was delicious, the dish was kind of a let-down.  When I saw crispy duck, I thought maybe it was the roasted version with crispy skin...mmm.  However, this version turned out to be breaded and deep fried.  The breading was a little thick, especially when some of the pieces were smaller and you were eating mostly breading.  Not sure if this was worth the $28 price tag.  The garlic prawn definitely was.

Thai fried rice was tasty but I can't say if it was better than any other version I've had.

Service was actually pretty good except when the servers, even when faced with the Tetris challenge of finding space on our tiny table for all our food, opted to place the dishes in awkward spots like at our elbows rather than move us to a bigger table (of which many were available).  Waters were refilled and people were generally smiley.

Tasty lunch with a little bit of leftovers which were delicious cold that afternoon in our hotel room!  Good version of Thai, would be a great option if you had a hankering.
Most phenomenal wine list in Vegas complements exceptionally good Thai cuisine.  Worth the cab ride and whatever wait you must endure.

My boyfriend took me to this place 3 years ago for the first time.
It was good, but doesn't make me crave to go back.
The best dish was the duck probably, even though I don't really like duck.

My friend recommended coming to this place, and I'm so glad I did! Probably the best Thai food I have ever had. This place is huge, and I can see why! The place immediately became packed as soon as it opened. We had Thai tea, the catfish Po Tek (?) soup, Shrimp Pad Thai, and the famous Garlic Chili Prawns. The Prawns were like $30? But soooo worth it. They were huge and full of flavor! Too bad I'm from Houston; I miss this place already.

My hands down favorite restaurant in Las Vegas... EVER!!!! I am more of a steakhouse kinda gal but Lotus steals my heart as my all time favorite. From the salmon panang, the cognac curry duck (special menu)  to even the wine list. Only downfall is now that foodies got wind you will have to make reservations for dinner no matter what night of the week. Good for them!

My husband and I arrived at Cafe Siena at 5:55 pm.  2 gentlemen arrived and were seated across from us about 5 minutes later.  Their waiter took their order immediately while we were still waiting for our waitress to come and take our order.  The 2 gentlemen received their meals and we are still waiting.  FINALLY received our meal at 6:40 pm.  It was on a Tuesday and there was not a lot of patrons there.  The staff offered us free desert for our inconvenience; we declined.  The Manager, Romina, came over and offered her apologies.  We are NOT happy with the service.  WE WILL NOT BE RETURNING and WILL TELL EVERYONE WE KNOW NOT TO EAT THERE!

My man brought me here as a surprise. Id never heard of it. He told me he made the reservation three weeks ahead. When we arrived, the wait for non-reservations was two hours. They had our table ready immediately.  The staff were kind, attentive and prompt.  The food was absolutely to die for. This place will be a frequent stop for us.

My second time here. We ordered the basil and chili with sliced beef, spicy number 7, pad Thai with chicken, spicy level number 7, and musaman curry with chicken, spicy level 5. It is worth noting that the basil and chilli with sliced beef is exceptional. Reminds me of this wonderful restaurant called Tara Thai in Manhattan Beach, CA, when it was still owned and by Penn, who also was the cook. 

We arrived for lunch on a Friday at 1:30. Many of the tables were occupied, and because it is the number 1 rated restaurant in Las Vegas according to Yelp and Trip Advisor, I was happy to get a table right away. The server took the order after about 10 minutes which was fine since we were talking anyway. The portions are downright dainty. The pad Thai was burnt, and when we requested another plate that wasn't burnt, it was almost the same. 

Bottom line is that the pad Thai was downright awful, and the musaman curry was nothing exceptional. I felt incredibly full after sharing these 3 small entrees with someone. Shortly after leaving I felt incredibly bloated, achy, and like I took laughing gas. Called the restaurant to ask if they used MSG and they said they put it in every dish! 2 hours later my muscles ache, I feel sick and this top rated restaurant pretty much msg poisoned me. 

Bottom line, you can get better Thai food at Krung Thai on Flamingo and Decatur, which doesn't use msg and is about half the price. Don't believe the hype.

My son suggested we try this Thai restaurant in Las Vegas because he had read it was the best Thai restaurant in the United States.   I've never been a big fan of Thai cooking but I went along for the ride.  Since I've had limited experience, I'm in no place to judge how it ranks in the whole country but it now has my vote, for sure.

Everything we had was wonderful.  Service was superb.  We couldn't believe how fast the food was served after we ordered.  We started with the fried jerky with a spicy sauce which I understood was a Northern Thai dish.  It was an interesting, unusual and tasty appetizer unlike anything we had ever eaten before.

My son had the crispy duck panang in a spicy cream sauce.  The waiter asked for his spicy preference on a scale of 1 to 10.  My son said 6, I said mild which the waiter translated as 2 and we both said our dishes were perfect.  I've never been a fan of duck but I tried a bite and it was very good.   The steamed vegetables he ordered as a side were picture perfect.

I was tempted to try the whole smoked catfish but decided to start with something a little less ambitious.  I ordered the pan fried smoked catfish prepared with vegetables and a curry sauce.   Where I come from we eat a lot of catfish and this was one of the most delicious and unusual catfish dishes I have ever eaten.   This is a restaurant where you should step out of your comfort zone and you may be very pleasantly surprised.

My wife LOVES this place.  We are only downgrading the restaurant because of it's location. It's in a "sketchy" neighborhood and is a little hard to find.  But, if you can make it out to the Lotus, you will enjoy it. We've been to the restaurant 3 times now, and have enjoyed every meal.  Well worth the trip.

My wife and I are big on Thai food and during a recent visit to Vegas we selected this restaurant based on the positive reviews.  We were not disappointed.  Authentic Thai spiced to the requested level.  This restaurant is difficult to find.  It does not front Sahara Avenue and there is no signage on Sahara to let you know where the restaurant is located.  It is in a small strip mall whose back side fronts Sahara.  Hard to find but well worth the effort.

National Home Warranty -Las Vegas: Terrible service, don't keep their promises,contracting dishonest contractors, take time to get person on the phone, web page not easy to use, no response to emails.
 If there was rating (-)5 stars I would easily give it to them.
Can not recomend to anyone.
No joke. Now I know what all the hype is about. Excellent Thai cuisine. Enjoyed every kernel, sip, bite, smell, sight of the few dishes I sampled. Looking forward to return trip.
Not bad but not great. Excellent wine selections and attentive servers. Food is a little overpriced.
Not impressed by the food or the staff.

Now this place is on point!  The menu, the service, the wine list, the food is ALL Amazing! Seriously the only downside is the location! it's in a older , uninviting shopping center if you can get passed that, it is not to disappoint!

OMG. I knew I loved Thai food before dining here. But after... I have a truly newfound LOVE of Thai cuisine when it tastes like this!  I'm talking pure ecstasy in your mouf!  The flavors and textures of each dish were to die for.  

The garlic prawns are a MUST!  I seriously ate these with my eyes closed as fireworks exploded in my line of vision with each bite.  

Order some kind of curry - Khao Soi with duck, panang, red, green, or yellow... They're all packed with flavor and amazingly delicious.

Most importantly, make sure to have a reservation. Even with a reservation you'll still have to wait, but luckily there's a bar to make the waiting time fly by.

I will definitely need to stop by here with every visit to Vegas.  I'm a total fan!

Oh my, this place was amazing. We ordered the prawn with fried rice and the appetizer of fried rice that was crunchy. Our waitress was a total sweet heart and went above and beyond to make sure we were happy. This is def a new lunch spot, quick service and amazing food make this place perfect.

Ohh Lotus how I love thee. Eating here is always number one on our list of restaurants when coming on our yearly Vegas trip. Yes it's in a gritty neighborhood but I applaud the restaurants efforts in keeping it real and being accessible to all types of patrons. 
     Reservations are a must so we stopped by during lunch hours on Wednesday to secure a reservation for our party of 8 for the following night. We were warned about the 5 minute rule, which is essentially if all in your party are not there within 5 minutes of reservation, your table is forfeited. 
     We arrived Thursday, we're seated promptly and after some time put in drink orders. The selection of rieslings by the bottle is extensive and a bit overwhelming. Placed our order to include the following dishes:
* Rad Na with shrimp @ $11.95. - 4.5 stars, yum gravy. 
* Braised short rib with panang @ $22.95. - 4.5 stars, tender with spot on curry.
* Chow mein with chicken. @ $ 8.95. We had 9 year olds to feed, need I say more? 3 stars, but who comes here for chow mein?
* Chicken Rama @ $21.95. - 1 star. Biggest disappointment of the night.  Got this for 2 kiddos to share and it was rather sad especially for the price. The plate consisted of about 5-6 half doll
ar sized pieces of flattened white chicken on a handful of steamed snow peas and about three asparagus. Everyone was shocked when I mentioned the price. 
* Salmon Nam Tok - @ $22.95.  2 stars. Ordered level 10, not spicy and an overly lemongrass flavor. Didn't taste well seasoned but cooked perfectly.
* Prim Nook - @ $11.95. 1.5 stars. Excited to try this, totally disappointed. This was bland, even at spice level 7 and just tasted like  can of mashed hatch chilis. 
* Pepper garlic sauce with shrimp - @ $13.95. 4.5 stars. Best dish of the night for me, I will be dreaming about that sauce until I get back to vegas. 
* Spicy catfish with basil leaves - @ $14.95. 4 stars. Catfish have a wonderful crunch and a great spicy sauce.
* Moo Yang @ 14.95. 3.5 stars. This was a nice dish and definitely a better choice for the kids than the chicken rama. The pork was tender and nicely cooked. The spicy sauce on the side, delicious. 
* Mango with sticky rice @ $8.95. 3.75 stars. Rice was warm, delicious, mango was sweet but a little bit brown around the edges. A bit expensive.
     We love trying new dishes every time we come and some are hits, some misses. Lotus excels in their sauces and curries especially and has a menu of items you can't find most places.  The portions are pretty modest. I don't have that big of an appetite and could easily eat 2 dishes myself. Also, the pricing is a bit wonky to me, some items are well priced others not so.  Relative to most good Las Vegas restaurants, the expensive items are really not that expensive though. Lotus' reputation is earned with good reason.

Ok so after my first walk in experience that did not go well I told my self why not give it another try . So I went in there and the girl was really nice she took me to the table then another guy ask me what I wanted to drink and he was polite as well , then my waiter came after 14 minutes and the place was slow not even that busy I was ok with that though since  I was not in a hurry .. He goes are you ready with a rude kind of tone I'm in a hurry way .. When I told him I wanted the soup he told me that's to big for you but again not in a nice way I felt so rushed while I was ordering ....any who then I try to order vegetarian noodles and I ask what my options are so he goes tofu and vegetables so I told him  I'll take that and with a very rude tone again he replies well which one it will be vegetables or tofu I thought they went together sorry don't punch me lol !! Any ways so the soup came out and there was a great amount of shrimp but the soup tasted like vinegar I was like ew !! He went 3 times around all the tables asking how is everything tastes except me I was so sad .. I felt like is there something wrong with me ?? Any ways the noodles were good but boring .. Over all I was expecting sooooooooo much more of this place and to be honest ones the service is not good it  makes everything worst .. I'm sure people love this place and have a great experience !! Mine happen to suck and I had wayyyy better Thai food in other places I swear !! I'm a food lover and I'll tell you it's nothing special just another Thai food place that word of mouth made it famous that's all !! Ps: great parking but over all I will never go back again unless I was there for a birthday party invitation and I had no choice !!!!!!!

Ok so my brother-in-law is somewhat of a foodie like me... He suggested Lotus of Siam since he went there before and said it was really good. Funny this place is hidden behind a big building and you would never have thought to look for a restaurant behind. We got there at 5:30pm when they open. There were about 40 people already waiting in line outside. Oooh it must be good! When they opened the doors they sat people right away. I was surprised how big the place really was. I said to myself.. man it's going to take a long time to get our food and I was starving. Long story short they took our order and 15 minutes later all our food was there. We had six in our party so we ordered a lot of different plates. I really liked the garlic shrimp but all the dishes were excellent. Wish we would have ordered more but next time I know!

Ok, this place!! In town for my cousins bachelorette Party and she HAD to come here. We got some stares...but that was ok! The couple at the bar with us actually had just gotten married and she as well had her bachelorette party there. What are the odds?! Anyway.... I'm still full from their amazing Kai Koowah! No, I'm not a huge Thai food buff so I didn't know exactly what to expect but it sounded amazing and my cousin said if it sounds amazing, then it is. And she didn't fail me! The table ordered two bottles of the Ponzo pino Gris along with the papaya salad, egg rolls and beef salad to split. That was all quite yummy as well! More than half of the table ordered the Kao Soi from the "Northern Menu" and o had a little FOMO. My cousin said it was her favorite thing ever! The dessert we all shared was incredible too- mango sticky rice with coconut ice cream. Bravo!!!

Okay place, their spicy shrimp soup could be spicer. I asked for an 8 and still had to add extra hot sauce since there was really no spicyness. 
Maybe I went on a bad day? Maybe I'll try this place again but for now I'll stick to my usual Thai food spots

Okay so we pull up to the shady abandoned strip mall that this place is located in- with an adult daycare next door, homeless people outside, and trash galore... BUT WHEN WE WALKED IN.... Stunning! The rooms are beautiful and clean- the staff is friendly but very foreign (don't ask them to explain the menu, they just smile and nod) - I ordered the duck soup- DELICIOUS! Best I've ever had! Completely authentic and delectable! I cannot write enough compliments on the food! It gets busy so plan ahead! Best kept secret in town!

One of the best Thai restaurants in the USA and I've been to Thailand for 3 weeks and to some of the top Thai populated places in America (NYC, SF, LA, etc).

Lotus of Siam's flavors and prices are just greatness. Don't get the usual boring pad thai and chicken satays, go for the unique dishes like spicy red duck curry, coconut shrimp specialties, and any of the house specials. Everything is great.

It's only a few min, very short cab ride from the city, you could technically even walk there if you're near Spring Mountain. Yum!
One of the best meals I've ever had! The chicken wings stuffed with pork and fried duck curry egg noodles were amazing!
One of the best places I've ever eaten in my life. Get off the strip and check this place out. Very affordable and the best dish you can get in Vegas
Only word of caution: they're SERIOUS about their spicy hot "index". A medium had my sweat trickling down from both sides of my face!! Other than that, flawless!!
Order anything!
Ordered Zydeco for a meeting at our DT office. Service was great, and food was amazing! We will definitely be going back soon. Great lunch spot!
Ordered a spicy beef salad and it was pretty good.  Could have been spicier, but I asked them for more spice and they brought me some.  The fried dumplings were good also.

Over the years I've heard how this Vegas institution dishes out the best Thai food in the states, so of course i had to finally try it.

Going to lunch hungover was probably a mistake, but I'm guessing that makes up a large portion of their clientele any how. 

We ordered a pretty standard lineup of dishes: crispy rice and ground pork, papaya salad, and pad Thai. When asked for spice, we goofed by going 3, thinking it was 3 out of 5, not 3 out of 10 like it really was. The dishes were good, but I've had numerous better representations at Thai restaurants in LA. Maybe more spice would change that. Either way, it was good if not a little over hyped.

Perhaps Chef Saipin Chutima who is also a James Beard Award winner was MIA the day we went.

The food is over-rated based mainly on the ridiculous prices.  

The garlic shrimp was OK but slightly overcooked.

The roasted duck curry was skimpy on the duck - considering the price?  Highway robbery!

If I lived nearby would I return?  Never!

3 entrees and tip?  100 bucks!  This is not a "family" place - it's a triple D/best thing I ever ate  over-rated tourist trap IMO.

Pork Larb, Pad See Ew, Garlic Prawns, Soft Shell Crab Drunken Noodles, Kang Ka Noon and Khao Soi. Thank you. You're welcome. 

Because of these dishes only, it is some damn good Thai in Vegas and thus my rating. &&& OK because I haven't had the chance to try anything else on the menu yet. Don't judge me if you want to try something traditional and it comes out Vegas-y. I really don't care that it's Thai food with glitter. This place is good when you don't buy into the hype but do buy at the steep prices, or if you're a placebo affected person then this place will surely be some of the "best" if you've already bought into the hype. Why? Because some Vegas folk will tell that it's the best Thai around. Me Personally? Ah, alright, if you say so. To each their own. Honestly you're asking me if it is THE BEST like so many and the Food Network say? Like in America. That would be a comical NO. Not a harsh No. Just a snickering one. Still worthy of your time nonetheless if you just have to try the talked about restaurants like I have to. 

Do yourself a favor and look towards the Northern Thai food menu. Especially if you're a foodie. Otherwise, Holy Mother Mary of Jesus, the Soft Shell Crab over Drunken Noodles. Yes. Please. Marry me. Let me count the ways I love you. Mind you some of my favorite things in this world are soft shell crab and drunken noodles, so this blows my ego way up. 

If you're into the hype, GO. Yum. If you're smarter and cautious, all you need to know is that the prices are dumb, even for Thai food, and I'd suggest to this crowd that you wait until someone forces you to go. Still so yum. It will be more than worth it if you choose the right dish for you. Do your research. There's TONS of Yelp reviews to shift through. That's it from me, my thumbs are still up. Oh, and Crispy Duck Panang, I'm coming back for you.

Pretty Surprising.  Neat spot that is in an old shopping center, in a not perfect part of town.

Once you get over the lack of ambience outside, you go in and the restaurant is awesome.  Packed with people, clean, busy - and food is pretty ridiculous.

Everything I had ordered was recommended by the server and it made me happy I wasn't on the Strip, paying an arm and a leg for food this good.

Fresh ingredients and vibrant colored and tasting dishes - enough talking - get yourself over there.  :)
Pretty good food, with a nicer atmosphere. A little pricey for the quality, but definitely good.
Pretty good, I took my wife there last weekend and she loved it. I didn't.

Probably the best Thai food of my life. There is a place in NYC near Woodside in Queens that also serves great Thai. What makes this better is the two pages of Northern dishes and the salads. Perfect spicy, sweet, salty, sour dressing on all if them.

Really authentic Thai food! Got the recommendation from the parent of one of my students and when I first arrived at parking lot I was a little skeptical but once you walk through the doors, you're greeted with a nice atmosphere and decor. We were probably lucky to go for a late lunch because we didn't have to wait for a table. The food was delicious! Don't really remember the actual name but the fried whole fish with the sweet and sour sauce was really yummy. Would eat here again the next time I go to Vegas.

Really?   Best Thai in Las Vegas?  That's not saying much.   This place wasn't bad, but it wasn't exceptional in any way.   If you love Thai food and need a fix, this place will do, but don't expect to be wowed.
Recommended by my friend Dave from New York. We are both big foodies. Everything here I ordered was delicious.

Review #2565 of Lotus of Siam. It's that popular!

A little far off from the rest of the places you will visit during a trip to Vegas but worth the short drive.  It is located near Sarhara in a deserted shopping center near Downtown.  I don't see any other reason to drive out here other than to eat here.  Parking is simple with the huge lot and plenty of parking since this is the only place that seems lively...

There might be a wait if you come during a busy time.  We came around noon and had to wait for around 20 minutes...(even though there were open tables...)  But I think I understand why they did that.  Unfortunately, the kitchen is quick but not quick enough to meet the demand and having people wait in line might be better than having them wait for food.

So was Anthony Bourdain and all the other celebrities (pictures all around the restaurant) just joking or is this place the real deal?

Order the garlic prawns! At around $30, it is pricey for 7 pieces of prawns but it was the best dish we had.  Not overly garlic-y and cooked perfectly so to not burn the garlic.  The prawns are huge and butchered perfectly so that you can devour the entire prawn (shell and all).

Order the Nua Nam Tok (Beef Salad with crushed toasted rice).  The beef was moist and fattier than other Thai restaurants I have had this dish at.  The fat was the difference.  Even though I prefer lean meats, the fat made the beef tender and flavorful.  The sauce was salty, sour, and spicy at the same time with a mixture of greens and a slice of cabbage.

Skip the Crispy Duck with Drunken Noodles or just order the drunken noodles by itself.  The crispy duck wasn't that crispy with our duck fat still not fully rendered.  The duck was not worth the premium to make this dish around $30.  Without the fat rendered out, it was similar to BBQ duck from a Chinese BBQ place...  As for the noodles, they were fried well with a layer of sauce on them.  The portion was a bit small.   Might be bigger without the crispy duck.  Finish the noodle quickly or they start to clump together.

This place is worth the visit.  I want to try the other items on the menu since they specialize in Northern Thai cuisine.  Will be coming back for the garlic prawns.  Beware of the wait for a table and then the wait for your food but if you have the time, it's a must try.  Just ask the other 3000 reviewers.

Roma Deli is the best Italian retaurant in all of Las Vegas.

Its owner, Massimo, is an authentic Italian and authentic server of great food and people. He is not only congenial and warm and friendly but he is an expert
in handling people and food...great Italian food.

I refer customers to Roma Deli all the time when I hear them ask about great Italian food in Las Vegas.

And, recently, Bill Gates ate Italian food at Roma Deli after her was also referred to eat there since it is the best Italian Food available in all of Las Vegas.

Do yourself a favor and go to Roma Deli the next time you want genuine and authentic Italian food along with a great casual dining atmosphere that will make you feel like actually are in Italy.

And, tell Massimo that Louis and Holly sent you and he will simply give you that big and beautiful Italian smile of his and treat you like royalty!!!

Louis J. Asmo,
Las Vegas resident and customer of Roma Deli since 2004
SO AUTHENTIC WILL GO AGAIN. Get northern thai food because that's her specialty!

Second time eating here and this time around no wait! We were very happy because we did not have to wait. We ordered the beef jerky for an appetizer, the crispy duck panang, and rad na. The beef jerky was a lil chewy for my liking but it had great flavor especially the sauce it came with. For the main entrees, we ordered the crispy duck panang which was pretty amazing! Def will order that again. The rad na was okay. I wasn't a fan of the gravy. Will def go back to try other dishes!
Service is not good it was crowded loud few dronk patrons not good atmosphere.I decided to leave and I ate at my hotel room....1/2 hr later I got sick to my stomach

Service: 5 stars
Food: 5 stars

Amazing Thai food...probably the best I've had in the USA. Having lived in Asia and frequenting Thailand, the food here is truly amazing and quite authentic. We've tried several items off the menu - duck, sea bass, shrimp, noodles...all were fantastic!

The server was also very attentive. Our waters were always full, and they responded quickly to our requests. Overall, great experience!
Simply Amazing...and worth waiting 90 minutes if you don't have a reservation.

So absolutely amazing!!! So cool and the food was worth waiting for. Do yourself a favor and make a reservation otherwise you'll be waiting for an hour to two and a half hours. It was so cool the head chef/owner came to say hi and told us that our daughter was the most beautiful baby ever. Order off the back of the menu, Northern Cuisine. Best Asian food anyone has ever had ever!!!

So many people recommended this place, I had no choice but to go. Located about 3 miles off the strip in a somewhat shady and alarming strip mall- it does not disappoint. 

Clearly they have chosen to invest in their wine cellar and not their interior. At 70+ pages, with multiple vintages of highly sought after wines (Abreu, Schafer, Spottswoode and more), there is certainly a wine for everyone at every price point. 

Service was warm and accommodating. 

Food was OUT of this world!  I am a new Thai food fan. Green curry was luscious with great veggies and spice. Seabass with ginger was silky and flavorful.  We ordered the highly touted Garlic Prawns which I thought didn't nearly compare with the other two beautiful dishes.  

I'll be back.

So so so good. Went here with some girlfriends from work while we were attending a conference. Very happy we found this gem through yelp.

We had the Tom Kah Kai (literally I could like the bowl), garlic prawns, Chicken satay, and crispy duck.

My friends went here AGAIN the next night because it was just that good! I will definitely return my Next time in Vegas.

To note: they do not take same day reservations. We went on a Tuesday night and there was a small wait- so keep that in mind. It took about 15 mins to get there from the strip. Price point was amazing!

So, there's been a major hype about this place for a LOOOOOOONG time. I stopped by here back in 2008, and got a ton of food as a take-out and wasn't impressed at the time. 

My second visit was back in 2011, and I thought the food was good at that time, but wasn't blown away. 

My recent visit, I went with a group and ordered several different items to try.

Garlic prawns- 5 stars. This is a must order. I would come back and get this without a question. 

Crispy duck panning curry - 2 stars. The panang curry was a bit lacking for me, and the duck was the best part. 

Stuffed chicken wings- 5 stars. This dish is SOOOO Good. It is stuffed with the insides of vietnamese egg roll type ingredients. I LOVED it. 

Drunken noodles- 2 stars.  I did a double take on this dish, as it was supposed to be an entree, but looked like an appetizer. I felt soooo jipped, and the dish wasn't even that great either. The chicken pieces were dry, and the noodles did not have good flavor. 

Crispy rice dish appetizer- 2 stars.  This dish has basically the flavors of larb on crispy rice. I LOVE larb, and prefer to have it incorporated into ground meats, so I thought this was meh. 

I hear this is one of the best thai places. I've given three tries to finally write this review, and I gotta say, maybe there's too much hype?

Some of the best Thai food you can get. It is off the strip in this hidden but very large shopping plaza. I remember it being super gray and not interesting but I think they recently renovated it and it is now a more interesting yellow. Parking was no problem and when we went during lunch, there was no wait! The entrance seems small but the restaurant is quite large and very roomy. 

Garlic Prawns - amazing! these massive prawns are deep fried and lightly seasoned. You get both the meat and shell. The shell is deep fried to the point of crunchy awesomeness. 

Crispy Duck in Panang Curry - one of the best Panang curry in a long time and the best Thai dish I have had in a while. The crispy duck is definitely crispy and the duck pairs really well with the spicy curry. Definitely pour some on top of rice to have a great meal. 

Soft Shell Crab Drunken Noodles - delicious! There is so much basil flavor and have plenty of soft shell crab to go around! The signature ingredient is the baked/dried basil that gives it a very unique flavor compared to other Thai restaurants that I have tried. Definitely worth ordering!

Thai Tea - a must get if you're ordering spicy food. It tastes fresh and not too sweet. 

Overall, this is one of the best Thai places I have ever been to. Their specials are a bit pricey compared to the ones in SD but it is WELL worth it.

Sorry to buck the trend here, and I know how wildly popular this restaurant is with Yelp L.A. , but I felt underwhelmed.  The location is dodgy, not convenient, and complete with a selection of panhandlers. The food was of average quality and selection even for Las Vegas. I totally get it: Yelpers love Lotus of Siam. They should be proud of attracting the Yelp crowd. I won't be returning. My experience was just average especially for a business lunch. Bargain hunters looking for a good meal on the fly before heading back to L.A. would definitely enjoy this place!
Spring rolls were delish! The dishes are simple but pack powerful flavor and portions are just right.

Still a 5 star, although it is so much busier since the last time we were here. The food is superb. They have this restaurant down to a science. I would be surprised if any table stayed more than an hour at the rate that they are churning people out. I am surprised at the people outside waiting as the only way to go is to make a reservation, otherwise the wait will be 2 hours. Super great wine selection, although I wish they had a cocktail menu as well. Anything that you order will be great, don't listen to these Yelp reviews where it seems that they clearly didn't make a reservation and were sore. Crispy duck anything is my pick, I have had them all. The squid or papaya salad is a nice start. Tom Kha soup is avoidable; it doesn't taste any different than anywhere else. I would stick with the Northern Thai specialties or ask your server what they like. You can't go wrong.

Superb never have I complained to a restaraunt of this status and actually got a solution. This has happened here. It's not often the quality of the food remsins  so consistent that i still crave it! Lotus keeps me wanting more!! The girl working the desk remembers me when I go in and for such a busy establishment this makes me feel so appreciated!  This place is awesome! I  lotus!

THE MOST OVERRATED RESTAURANT EVER

Americanized southern fake thai food mostly; overpriced tourist trap. To all who read this: Jitlada in Los Angeles is an actual thai food restaurant. This place is highway robbery with hour+ wait times for the same basic pad Thai bullshit you can get anywhere in the U.S. Wow yelpers, get a friggin clue.
Takeout was sub par. Thin watery curry, raw potatoes, really small portions and all meat in three dishes very dry. Not ok.
Tastefully done but in a terrible location.

Terrible customer service. Came in with a big group and  their attitude is like they don't even want your business. Granted we didn't have reservation but they simply dismissed us and told us that we have too many kids and will take too long. And the phone is always busy. You would think they'd get a second line. Oh well, glad I didn't have to sit through dinner if their attitude is like this.

Terrible service to our large party,  doesn't even attempt to seat our large party.   They don't answer their phone.   Even with 5 people waiting ahead,  said they can't seat us.. Wtf.  You don't want our business because she have 10 kids!
The Best!! Perfect, on point in so many ways!!

The Four Kegs Bar this Las Vegas Bar used to be the place to go for good cold beer and watch sporting events and get good food back when I moved here in 1985.  We went there yesterday, the neighborhood has aged and a lot of shops have left the area but 4 Kegs remains and the food and beer are as good as it was 30 years ago.

The stromboli's are to die for, my favorite the cajun fries oh yeah lets not forget the pizza.

A must for those who want real Vegas without all the glitter and high prices.

The Thai food was different than back home in Hawaii, but delicious none the less. Their prik nam pla sauce is also different then back home, but we loved it as well. Very large restaurant that was very busy. Menu is also very large making it good for big groups. We'd eat here again.
The amazing reviews do not disappoint. What a fabulous meal! Went with a large group of people so we could try lot of different dishes and everything was great.
The best Thai ever! Love this place. A true hidden jem. Best Tom Ka Khi I've ever had.

The best Thai food I ever had anywhere in the states.  found it on yelp. the outside looks sketchy in an old shopping mall, but the inside was a nice surprise. you cannot judge a book by its cover. we ordered four dishes and shared, drunken beef noodle, pad Thai, chicken panang curry, and beef stir fry with green beans. For dessert, try the fried banana with coconut ice cream, it is divine. I don't think you can go wrong. we tried coming back the next day, but it was a 45 minute wait on a Saturday night, so went across the street to Arawan Bistro.

The best Thai food in America!  If you live in Vegas or are just here as a visitor, you must try Lotus.  The location might not be the best, but the food and service certainly are.  They also have one of the best riesling collections I've ever seen at very reasonable prices.  My favorite starter is the Nam Kao Tod, crispy rice mixed with sour sausage, green onions, chilis, ginger, and peanuts.  It's very hard to find on other Thai menus.  I like all the soups, but Tom Kah Kai is my favorite.  All the curries are superb, as are the noodle dishes (especially the drunken noodles with soft shell crab or prawns).  If you haven't tried jack fruit, have one of the northern dishes.  The short ribs with panang is a great dish.  If you have a huge appetite and the chef makes a recommendation, try the whole lobster (I've done it once and will never forget it).  I've lived in Las Vegas for 11 years and have never tired of Lotus.  I've never had a bad meal!

The best thai food EVER. 

A friend introduced us this place last time we visited Las Vegas. We came back here again because the food was just on point!

This time, I got the famous garlic shrimp, pineapple fried rice, shrimp panang curry and papaya salad. 
Garlic shrimp was crispy, well seasoned and super tasty! I could kill the whole plate myself! 

You do have to make a reservation or go early when they open. They open for dinner at 5:30pm and we got to the restaurant around 5:15pm. There was already a long line ahead of us. 

Definitely a place to visit when you are tired of that crazy strip scene!

The best thai food I have ever had hands down. We ordered the crispy prawns, seafood soup, pad see ewe, beef salad, roast duck with some sort of curry sauce and fried bananas with coconut ice cream for dessert. The stars of the night were the crispy prawns and pad see ewe. I am neither a prawn fan nor a pad see ewe fan but those dishes left me wanting more. Oh. My. God. The crispy prawns were deep fried and partially deshelled for ease of eating with a delicious garlic sauce on the outside. The pad see ewe was just perfect, it had the wide thick noodles with just the seasoning. 

Can't wait to go back to Vegas for this place.

The first few times I went to Vegas years ago, my friend kept saying that we needed to eat here because it had amazing Thai food despite it being middle of a sketchy part of town. So, we'd wake up in the morning, and call ahead to get a reservation, and find out that they didn't take reservations, and it'd be like 2 hours before we get a table. So, we never went there.

Eventually I made it out there, and my friend was right. Crazy good Thai food at reasonable prices, and it is in a highly sketchy part of town.

Fast forward a few years, and now whoever I happen to be eating with, no matter how hardy a Vegas vet they are, is always willing to consider Lotus as a food suggestion. I've tried probably a good third of their menu, and pretty much everything is great.

(As for the "no reservations" thing...they don't take reservations FOR LUNCH. You can totally get reservations for dinner.)

If you're coming here, I'd recommend starting with the Prawns in a Blanket. Expertly unshelled shrimp wrapped in bacon, and that is then wrapped in crispy wonton skin and fried to perfection. Served with a sweet dipping sauce.

The crab fried rice is great, and pretty much every curry that you order will complement this.

All of the curries are terrific, and while everything may seem a little on the small side, the combination of the curry sauce and the rice is generally enough to keep me well satisfied. 

Generally, you'll end up dropping about $20-$25 per person here, and have yourself a pretty good meal. I consider this a definite go-to, though I recommend trying to get out there on a weekday rather than a weekend. You'll find the waits much shorter, or may even get lucky enough to walk in and get seated immediately.

The food here is great. And it's very authentic.

What I don't like so much about the place is that it is pretty noisy and you get a feeling that you are in a rush.

Conclusion: If you only care about the food, this is one of the best places to eat Thai food. If you are looking for a quiet place, there are better options.

The food here is so good! It's not as small and quaint as it used to be back in the day but so many reviews and food tv visits let the word out and they had to expand. Part of the fun used to be waiting to get in and everybody was excited to be there. Would be a five star review but the place has definitely lost its ambiance and just tries to pump as many people through the doors as possible. Should've stayed small and make us wait-it was worth it!

The food is always fantastic. Service tonight was a little spotty, but we arrived just when they opened for dinner to find a line waiting. Tried to make a reservation by calling them, but after several attempts that the phone was not answered we decided to just show up.

Still completely recommend Lotus. Have been going here for ten years and have never been disappointed by the food.
The food options, taste and service was outstanding. We went with a group and the atmosphere was bright and open. The wine selection was impressive. We want to go back.
The food was amazing!  Best Thai I've ever had, great use of spices and never too spicy.  Every dish was on point÷

The food was delicious we ordered 7 dishes which included a typical Burmese influenced dish is served with egg noodles in a curry base with a touch of coconut cream, with your choice of meat; garnished with sliced red onions, lime and pickled vegetables.
So delicious.  
The other dishes were more of he como dishes papaya salad, Panang curry and BBQ pork. The BBQ pork was a bit dry and the fat needed to be rendered a bit more. 
The service was exceptional.  Right on top of it I was happy that they still seated us we got there at 9:45 which is normally when they close the kitchen but they seated us still yey!
The food was great. We ordered a thai Tom yum Khuong but I wish they would use straw mushrooms rather than the button mushroom because that would be more authentic.

The hype didn't meet my expectations. I mean the food was good, but honestly it tasted like any other Thai restaurant. We ordered from their "northern" section of the menu but I wasn't blown away with the food.

The saving grace was the dessert there... If you ever go, you HAVE to try their coconut ice cream with their banana eggroll thing. It's like the best thing I've ever had in life. It says a lot coming from a guy who isn't into desserts.

The infamous Lotus of Siam. One of the only ways you can drag people out of the strip for a meal. Restaurant completely filled within 15 minutes of opening. 

Food: 
I don't quite get the fuss here about the food. I've been here twice and the food is consistent, but definitely not the best Thai Food I've had. 

Service: 
Attentive staff. They have a lot of employees working here. 

Environment: 
Definitely looks better than your typical Thai joint. Makes a good date location. 

Price: 
Average price for the type of food. 

Food: 3
Service: 4
Environment: 4
Price: 3
The portions here are small, but boy are they flavorful!!! Go for the Garlic Prawns! It's a must. I love how I was able to eat the shell.
The worst Thai Restaurant in Las Vegas. Doesn't know how to talk to customer. Everyone is very rude. Food quality is way below the average and quantity is very small...do no to this restaurant.

Their appetizer prawns were the only thing memorable about this place.  It's been know to be the "Best Thai Restaurant" in Las Vegas.  I think that saying made their head too big and thought they were still king of the Thai cuisine.  

The service was very slow.  We were seated right away and someone brought water right away.  After 5min we had to wave someone down to order some drinks, then 10mins we had to waive again to order our food, from the hostess.  They weren't busy, just a few guys standing around, maybe bussers, but who knows.  Their appetizer prawns, that they're known for are great.  We ordered the usual safe stuff to compare, curry from their popular list and some noodle dish and they were both just ok.  

The 5 stars on his site are quite questionable.  I'm thinking, they've never ever had Thai food before.  They definitely need to work on their urgency of serving their customers, because their food, is just ok, not earth shattering. If you're new to the Thai cuisine, it's just fine.

There are a lot of great recommendations here. I highly recommend trying the sea bass section. Its a bit pricey but there is no price limit for good food. I had the sea bass with papaya, it came with sliced grapes, tomatoes, and roasted peanuts. All i can say is wow - that is some great stuff.  It's  got a nice amount of fish sauce that isn't smelly old like many Thai restaurants and the combination of the salty fish with tomatoes and grapes makes a flavorful-lively color on my palette. Suggest for first timers or anyone already familiar with Thai to skip the basics like curry because if you traveling from out of town I would push that you try something else. There are many wonderful dishes you can see at the entrance the wall of pictures that we're mentioned in the local news to get an idea

Its now become my favorite stop every time I'm in town

There are many car washes in Las Vegas. Some are good and many are just terrible. Alamo Hand Car Wash on Rainbow is just about the best in the entire city.
The work is done by hand so the car finish is protected and everyone seems to genuinely care about your car.
Most important, is the warm and friendly welcome you receive when you pull in for service. There is a man named Felipe who greets you like a long lost friend. His warm, caring attitude is the reason I keep coming back. Sometimes twice a week to keep my cars looking new. He may not know your name but he will get to know you and your car. If he suggests a coat of wax, you probably need it. I know, when he's suggested an added service it is because he genuinely takes interest in how my cars look and, the funny thing is, he's always been right.

When you pull in, say "hi" to Felipe. His warm attitude will start your experience at Alamo in such a pleasant manner that the time they take to care for your car will all be worth it.
Without this kind gentleman, Alamo might just be another good car wash. With him there to greet me, I feel like I am coming to a friend to personally take care of my prized possession. 
By the way, their complimentary coffee is quite good, as well.

There is a reason Lotus of Siam is on everybody's list as best places in Las Vegas.  I've been there at least 10 times and it has been excellent every time.  The menu is extensive, so the last few times I've asked the server to make suggestions and ordered based on those suggestions.  They haven't steered me wrong.

There is no way I could write enough to describe this place. I've ate at several tai food restaurants and nothing compares to this little hidden gem. On the out side it does not look as inviting but the inside is AWESOME. It is truly a hidden gem in Vegas. People that know about this place eat here offer. There is usually a 45 min to an hour wait but I can not stress enough that it is well worth it. They now added an inside bar and text your phone when your table is ready.
They got rid of the all you can eat- but still a great place to go for food!
They say that it's the best Thai in town. I agree!  The wait is long, but it is worth it.  The food and service are outstanding.  I wish I lived closer!

This Thai food different than other Thai food! Always busy Eventhough the price of food expensive! The staff is friendly and helpful. I love the interior inside very classic surrounded by many wine bottles! Highly recommend for visitors !

This dish converted me to not only loving Thai food, but to love curry...  

CRISPY DUCK with PANANG
Crispy duck topped with Thai style red cream curry sauce with cognac.

UFB!!!
This has become my favorite restaurant in Vegas. I've eaten here many times since my last review. Everything on the menu is great, even if it is pricy. The quality is sublime.

This has been on my list of to do's for years.  It was almost mythical at this point and to finally be in Vegas and make it over well... Had to happen.  I grabbed my bestie, we hailed a cab and off we went.  

Who knew a run down looking Strip mall would hold one of the best Thai places in the country?  

Huge menu is the only downfall as there was only 2 of us.  We Ordered what the waiter told us to and it was perfect,  the duck parang curry is perfect.  Perfectly crispy, flavors are balanced and you can taste the love put in this.  

This place needs to happen if you are in Vegas.

This is a 5 hands down. The Garlic Prawns, the Pad Thai and Khoa Soi were all incredible.  The service was perfect, and the wine list is overwhelming. 

We showed up at 9:00 on a Sunday and still waited 30 minutes.  Well worth the wait. Better than anything you find on the strip.

This is a James Beard award winner. Not too far from the strip. Large parking lot. Outside doesn't give much too look at but inside is visual appealing. Don't let the lot deceive you.  

Came in about an hour after opened for dinner  Wait time was close to an hour. Not bad. They will call or text you. Staff was friendly. We waited and ordered some drinks at bar. One drink was thai iced tea. Good amount of citrus to tea. 


When we got seated for dinner, beverage and food order was taken  and delivered at a reasonable time. Our Order included but not limited to Tom kha kai soup, pad thai, khao soi with short rib, duck paanang curry, and pork belly. Each dish stood out on it's own. 

The tom kha soup was creamy, coconut, mushroom, protein, and citrus. A nice mix match of sweetness, savory, and spices. Unexpectedly overwhelming delicious soup. 

Pad Thai with chicken was one of the best I have tried. Nice balance of noodles, eggs, sprouts, chicken in sauce. 

Pork belly with peppers and Chinese. greens. Not fatty pork belly mixed with the others in a light style sauce crisp Chinese greens. Good dish. Not my personal like for pork belly but not as fatty as I like. 

Khao Soi -Short Rib was one of two khao dishes. The one we ordered was one of the specialty dishes. The tender seasoned short rib was nestled within crispy noodles, green, and some of the best curry sauce. Not overly hot. The sauce I could just drink. It was that delicious. 

Duck paanang Curry. Oh my. Oh my. It's a flavor explosion. Freaking awesome curry sauce. Spices. Lean tender duck. Lots of duck. This curry was also one of the best.

Good. Anything curry. Any of the dishes. Personal favorite the short rib and paanang but really all the dishes, service, and experience. 
Bad. You can encounter wait times but worth it.

I'll be back someday.

This is a restaurant with strip like qualities, which is to say, plenty of hype and short on substance.  I was suckered into going here after watching a recent Munchies video on top Las Vegas food joints.  As with most things in life, you're expectations of quality are based on how much you pay for something.   When you're the most expensive Thai place in town, well, you expect the best.  

We ordered tempura (bad choice being this is a Thai spot) that tasted like something you would buy out of your supermarket frozen food section.  We followed it with their "specialty" plate, crispy chicken with panang sauce.  For $27 you get duck that tastes like Kentucky fried chicken strips dipped in a watery curry sauce.  The other plate, I believe no. 55, was strips of rubbery beef in a acidic and vile sauce.  Terrible to say the least.  

Im hardly ever motivated to write reviews on food spots and hate being negative about things but maybe I can save a few souls from spending their hard earned money on sub par Thai food.

This is absolutely, without a doubt, the BEST Thai restaurant I have ever been to.  It is an absolute treasure and NEVER disappoints.  Throughout my years traveling to Vegas, I've Never had a less than perfect meal at Lotus.  
MUST TRY!!
This is an upscale Thai place with an extensive wine menu. Make sure you try the northern specialty dishes!

This is my #1 go to Thai joint in town! 

I have been to lotus too many times to count. I feel like a seasoned vet in there and have tried just about every item on the menu. 

I believe it's one of the only places in town you can get Khao Soi and it's the best I've had anywhere in the world. You can find Khao Sou along a cornucopia of other Thai delicacies on the "Northern Menu". 

Two thumbs up Wayne!

This is my fave restaurant in Vegas.   I love the appetizer Nom Kao Tod.  It has crispy rice, pork, cllantro, lemon grass, red onion, lime or lime juice.   I wish they would make it as an entree.  I sometimes order 2 orders and make it my entrée.   The Tom yum Khai soup is great and pad thai also is great.   The waiter asks what # of spicy/hot you want each dish. I do not think I've ever ordered over a 6 because your mouth becomes on fire at that point.  The restaurant atmosphere is nothing fancy but the whole thing just "works".  I have a 40 min drive to this place but gladly do it when my Thai cravings activate.

This is one of the best Thai restaurants I've had, even though it's quite expensive. I really enjoyed the duck curry and the garlic prawns. Make sure you make a reservation-- the lines can get crazy long. We made a reservation for 9 or so on a Saturday night and still had to wait at least 30 minutes after. It's okay, though-- the food made up for the wait!

This is the best Thai food hands down! I loved the different flavors of every dish. It transported me to Thailand. The restaurant is in a dingy run down shopping mall 15 minutes cab ride from the main strip.  Well worth the trip! Once inside much more impressive. Service was impeccable. I will revisit when I am in Vegas.

This is the best Thai restaurant in the valley. I cannot believe that I have yet to review them. I have eaten here on several occasions over the past 4 1/2 years and I have several favorite dishes. The crispy duck with Panang curry is my favorite. The service is always impeccable but be careful and make a reservation if you are in a time budget. They do get very busy. The wine and beer selections are incredible as well as the atmosphere. Celebrity pictures all over the walls posing with the owner of this fine establishment. I recommend Lotus of Siam to everyone I meet in Las Vegas, telling them that it is the best restaurant in the valley. And they never disappoint. Try them out and see for yourself!
This is the best place for Thai, Northern Thai specifically, outside of Thailand. I straight up sang love songs to my food it was so damn good. Go there. Now.

This is the first meal we had off-strip this visit and it was crazy good. Confession, I've somehow never had Thai food. I have no good excuse, I've just been a little intimidated and it hasn't happened. That changed today. Everything we had was over the top delicious and perfectly prepared. Try the Pad Thai and the first item on the Northern menu. Order them both, and more, and go family style. You cannot go wrong here, just call ahead, the word is obviously out.

This place definitely lives up to the hype!

First appearance is not what I expected. It looked like some janky hole-in-the-wall spot from the outside. But inside was a pleasant surprise. It's huge. And had a bar area for you to grab a few drinks before dinner.

We arrived at 5:20 pm,10 minutes before they opened and there was already a line of 40 people waiting on be seated. Luckily they had enough tables for us to be seated.

Food was amazing. For a party of 2, we ordered the garlic prawns and the crispy duck in panang curry. I highly recommend both. 

Service was attentive and friendly.

Overall, a great place to enjoy great thai food. Will definitely be coming back.

This place is BOMB!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!

I've been here twice and basically ordered almost the exact same thing! Now let me tell you, you HAVE to get the:

STUFFED CHICKEN WINGS!! Self explanatory.. and to die for!! MMM I am totally salivating right now haha

GARLIC PRAWNS are also one of most favorites!! They are made so you can even eat the shell!

I love noodles, so we ordered the CHICKEN PAD THAI, which is a dish i always order at thai restaurants and there's was DELCIOUS!!  I have never had a pad thai this good!! There other noodle dishes were soo yummy too! Like their fun! haha 

You could also never go wrong with CHICKEN SA-TAY in the appetizer section, but if you haaad to choose definitely go with the STUFFED CHICKEN WINGS! If you haven't got it already, i'm basically saying this place is DELICIOUS and a must try :) 

This place gets busy. We arrived like a minute before they opened and there was a line outside waiting to get eat some yummy thai restaurant. So get your butt over here, QUICK!!

This place is a must try! Yes, they have all your standard favorite items, but do yourself a favor and try the back of the menu! This place specializes in northern Thai food. Branch out and try some of these items. You will not be disappointed!

This place is amazing!  the service is amazing the food is delightful and flavorful you can taste the love in every bite.  You can't beat the prices as well you get a great value for your money spent.  This place is in a questionable part of town but come on for some bomb food and service come here.

This place is an upscale, clean, and well managed place tucked away in the commercial center.  It's definitely worth checking out.  They pack the tables in and the decor looks like a classic chinese restaurant with big rooms full of tables with multi-purpose room lighting, but still a great spot to go, especially if you're just visiting or want to sample a very popular spot.

This place is apparently always booked, which is a good sign. People of all walks of life in here, enjoying good food. My GF and I walked in on a Tuesday night around 7 with no reservation and waited for our table to be ready while at the bar. They have a decent beer selection and a plethora of wines in their cellar. I didn't see any liquor other than sake (if you count that). We got sat within 30 minutes and our servers were quite attentive and informative. We had the Thai hot wings which were sweet and spicy, good. Tom Fun Kai soup next; limey and a spiciness at the end, interesting and good aswell. We ended with the famous garlic prawns, which did live up to the hype. Crispy and juicy tails with a crunchy kettle cooked chip-like shell. Will be back for those.

This place is great. The food is served in a timely manner. It has a great taste and presentation. Their wine selection is excellent. I suggest pairing your food with a wine of your choice. Great place for a family dinner or date night. The front on the restaurant can be deceiving, but just walk in to see what a gem this place is.

This place is over rated..so is their crispy garlic shrimp for which they charge $27 with about 8 prawns and shells attached together..deep fried. Very greasy and not flavorful! The fried rice we ordered was very small in portion and about $15. Either they need to increase the portions or decrease the price. Also, they add a gratuity 18% regardless of the number in your party. Overall mediocre.

This place is overrated. All hype. Definitely not worth a 2 hour wait. 
What we ordered;
Garlic wings - good
Garlic prawns - very good
Tum yum Kai (hot sour soup) - good
Garlic squid - average
Drunken noodles duck - not so great. The noodles was hard and stuck together as though it wasn't cooked properly and wasn't seasoned well. The duck used was very fatty.

I may be spoiled living in California and having access to great food all the time. Perhaps that's why I wasn't impressed. Overall this spot serves average Thai food. I would not go back again especially for a 2 hour wait.

This place is really good BUT not the best Thai food in Vegas. The chili dip on the Northern menu is amazing, but there is another Thai place in the same plaza who's flavor profiles are a lot better... starts with a K ends with an L

This place is the biz ! Dishes here that you will not see anywhere else. The spicy here is hotter than most Thai restaurants here in town. I prefer to order from the northwest Thai menu. All adventurous options and each are unique .

This place is the gold standard for Thai cuisine in Las Vegas.  They have a very impressive wine and beer list, but I don't drink.  Everything that we have ever eaten here is top notch and delightful, especially the Crispy Garlic Prawns.  The wait is aggravating, and there is not much space for patrons to wait.  But with an advance reservation, the experience here is awesome.  Would be nice if they could update their decor a little.  While all the Thai decorations are beautiful, the carpeting is way past its prime, and it takes away from the experience a little.  We always come here when we have Thai relatives in town knowing that they will be very happy and impressed.

This place was more than I expected. The food, while small portions, was so fresh and delicious. The menu is extensive, especially if you aren't familiar with traditional Thai food (I wasn't). Orders come out one at a time, so don't plan on all starting your meal together. I'm not big on spicy, so I ordered my Drunken Noodles at a "2"; when it came out it was about an "8"!! They apologized and remade it, but my companions were almost done before I ever started. Small portions leave room for their delicious sticky rice with mango dessert. It's pricey but fresh and tasty.

This review is for Pristine Cleaning.  Excellent job done by Rosio and Jocelyn. They really did a Pristine job. I am totally impressed. They arrived right on time and were done in the timeframe they told me they would.  They were very pleasant and hard workers.
