I am definitely going to rebook to have a time every 3 weeks to have them clean my house.  You won't be disappointed with this company.  5 Star service Definately.

This was by far the WORST chicken pad thai I've ever had. The noodles were dry. The three pieces of chicken that were in it were dry. It was not spicy. It was simply not good. I thought that with all the amazing reviews that people posted it would at least be edible, but alas, the reviewers have disappointed me again. This is not what pad thai is supposed to taste like. If I never return to this subpar Thai restaurant again, it will be too soon. I wish I could get a refund for this, because I couldn't even eat half of it. I'm sorely disappointed. And thanks to Yelp reviewers, I won't be trusting their opinions again. Thanks for nothing!

This was our first time eating at Lotus. From the outside, it appeared to be a tiny hole in the wall. The huge number of cars should have been a clue, because we walked in to a large restaurant. We tried calling ahead, and were shocked when they told us they had no remaining reservations...for a Monday evening...at a place off the strip. We decided to go the wait route and had a beer at their large bar while we waited. We started with bacon wrapped shrimp. For our entrees we decided on the classic Pad Thai and the Drunken Noodles Crispy Duck. Everything was  good- we were between 3 and 4 stars. Our deciding factor is always, "would we return on our next trip?" We both said no.
This was some of the best Thai food I've ever had! The garlic prawns and crispy Penang duck is out of this world! Def a must if you're in Vegas :)

This was the most phenomenal experience ever! Their Thai food was perfectly on point, and the service was fast and super friendly. I don't think I've ever had better Tom Yum Kai or Pad Thai. My girlfriend got Masuman curry, and it was absolutely delicious. I am completely blown away by the experience.

Took a party of 6 for lunch. Had heard such rave reviews about this place. We were seated immediately. However, the service was horrible. The waitress had a real attitude and did't seem to want to be bothered with us. We are not overly familliar with Thai food and had many questions. The waitress didn't really seem to want to be botered. The foods we ordered were marginal at best. Just not a real pleasant experience. Will go elsewhere next time. No return trip to this restaurant.

Tried it because of all the good reviews, and I wasn't disappointed. I got there 15 minutes before they opened and there was already a line of about 8 people (3 groups). The outside is beat up, but the interior is nice. It's a high class restaurant in the middle of a strip mall. I don't remember anything after the garlic prawns. I blacked out they were so good. A bit more expensive than I expected but it was very good quality..
Truly one of the best Thai restaurants I have ever been too.  This place is top notch.  When I'm out in Las Vegas for business I away dine at this place.

Uhmazing food! So many options from regions all over Thailand. Everything was bursting with flavor. It was a great contrast to the strip, both in style and quality as well as being much more affordable.

Unbelievably, Incredibly Good

I'll spare you a lengthy read.  I came up with the crazy idea to take my wife to one of her favorite restaurants for her birthday.  We flew from San Francisco to Las Vegas to have lunch here.  AND IT WAS TOTALLY WORTH IT!!  We will do it again.

It was our second meal there - every bit as good as the first.  The location is not great, but the food is utterly amazing.  EAT HERE.
Union Pluming  scheduled for service between 12 and 4. It's now 430. No update,no show. I called twice,and was put on hold for over 15 minutes. Fly by Night.

Usually my girl and I hit the Lotus up for lunch, always cranking plus I love the buffet, oh I do put a whoopin on it. On this evening we went for dinner. As there were 4 of us some damage was done. My woman does her usual thing with the larb and chicken coconut soup but then there was chicken fried dumplings, mee crob if I am spelling that right and it was just the beginning. Poached salmon, Fried shrimp, chicken curry, and a whole catfish on the table,  a whole one. We love coming here, and it be showing. For the wine lovers you will be quite impressed.
Very Good food, lots of flavor and service was fairly quick.  This place is busy for a reason.

Very cool old school vegas place! Food and service were both good. Restaurant is very bright is my only criticism. Would probly give it 4.5 stars if possible. Waiter gave recommendations and we took some. All the food was tasty from the satay to the pad Thai to the Panang. Great Thai food and we will definitely be back!

Very good food, like excellent.

Few ground rules:
1. Make reservations, earlier is better
2. parking lot is scary, see #1
3. I'd think that the wait without reservations would be hours.

There are so many excellent sounding things on the menu that I simply have to return.

Very good thai food at very reasonable price.  We ordered the crispy garlc prawns.  The shrimp was deshell but still attached at the butt and deep friend and seasoned very well.  The beef salad was also very good with chunky piece of meat. The pad thai was good a int of sweet and lime. The crispy duck in panang curry was cook very well not too dry and the curry did not over power the duck.

Very rude service. Gave my name for the waiting list and ladies at front were making fun of my name. Before you make fun of someone's name, make sure that person does not know Thai. It shows your ignorance. Food was not that great and very expensive. There are other Thai restaurants with better food and less expensive.  Not coming back again.

Very tough to find because it's in a dumpy strip mall. But it was very busy and amazing food. We Had ton tom yum kai soup appetizer which was fantastic. The pad Thai noodle dish was great.  The drunken noodles  were fantastic with large whole shrimp in then.  The seafood fried rice was fantastic with vegetables and large shrimp. This is a amazing spot. Larp was fantastic.

Visited in August during the week.  The place is in a strip mall so we took a cab from the strip.  It's clean and inviting.  The food though was just a-ok.  It was good but coming from Chicago where there is great Thai restaurants, this was comparable to a mediocre restaurant at home.  Price were reasonable and the wine list is pretty impressive.
Want some good Thai Food??? You need to go to Lotus of Siam!!  Great selection of North and South Thai food.  All good, good service.

Wanted to try this place when I saw it on the food network's best thing I ever ate. Went on a Wednesday afternoon when it opened. We were on luck no line. Promptly seated and poured over the extensive menu. Being from LA there are a lot of good Thai restaurants  to compare this place to. So we ordered the papaya salad, which was spot on with the balance of sweet, salty, sour, and spicy. My only complaint was the portion was a little small especially for the price. The red chili dip we ordered was ok. Nothing memorable. It was definitely missing a little heat. The vegetable fried rice was ok, and the drunken noodle I could have passed on. Nothing really wowed me. I could get better in Thai town in hollywood. We ate all the food, but the reason for that was the portions were so small we left feeling starved.
Way over advertised, had a much better Thai food. Would not go back.
We always go here every time we're in Las Vegas. It's a tradition and never disappoints

We came here a couple of times. Our first meal was beyond amazing. It was so good we went back the next day for lunch. We obviously wanted to try something different and it was a complete miss. The noodles were cold and stuck together. I eat Thai food all the time and those noodles were probably the worst of had compared to over 20 restaurant s that I've tried. It's definitely worth a trip but just only order what the waiter recommends.

We came here again on 12/15/15. This time the service was friendly and appropriate. We ordered the Golden Tofu which was ok but not outstanding in the flavor department - crispy on the outside and creamy on the inside but needed a different and stronger sauce. Next came the Tom Kah Kai soup which was enjoyable but again, lukewarm like on our last visit. The we also had the Koong Char Num Plar - raw prawns with lime juice, marinate and a chili and tamarind paste (delicious) - nice combination of flavors. 

We have visited many Thai restaurants across many States but we really fail to understand why Lotus of Siam is so highly celebrated - they are good but we are not blown away.

We came here on the last day of our Vegas stay and are looking forward to return some time in the near future.  I do not know how long the wait time is usually, as we went right when they opened shop.  By the time we were done however, there was a line at the door.  We ordered many dishes and they all were flavorful and delicious.  One of my buddies was asking why we hadn't came here earlier.  Anyways, if you are looking for good Thai food in the Vegas area, Lotus of Siam is a no-brainer.

We got there around 6 and we only had a 30 minute wait which was very lucky for us because the wait time usually is about an hour. The place is huge when you go in! Loved it here! Everything we ordered had a spice at a 7 or 8 and it was perfect. I love how it's spicy enough to burn your mouth but not too spicy where you can't taste the whole dish itself. It was the perfect balance and we all enjoyed several dishes to share. The fried duck in red curry was amazing and I usually don't like the coconut taste in curry but this was perfectly made with just a hint of coconut. We had seafood drunken noodles which wasn't too bad. The noodles kinda got stuck together in a big blob on the bottom of the dish. The spicy fried rice is amazing and the beef was great! Definitely going to come back.

We had a pretty good size spread:
1. Garlic prawns - Not sure what all the hype is, but not going to order again, they were just okay. Eat the shells and they'll get stuck in your teeth.
2. Combination fried rice - Good, worth buying again. This was probably the only thing that wasn't deep fried.
3. Crispy duck panang - Worth 5 stars. It stole the show. Now this baby was definitely worth buying again and again. I should have placed an order of this to go. I didn't see it on the menu, but luckily I was able to pull up another review photo. It was delicious! 
4. Drunken noodles - If I can't remember the meat in it, does that tell you anything? This is why I went in the 1st place. Noodles were stuck together, may order one more time to see if it was just the cook.
5. Chicken pad Thai - Flavor was good, but noodles were smaller than most Thai places I have visited.
6. Stuffed chicken wings - OMG!! I could have eaten 4 of these as a meal. My jaw dropped when I saw bill and realize we paid $11.95 for 2. But I think I will actually order this baby again!
7. Fried Bananas and ice cream - Actually it didn't come together, they charged us separately for it.... Come on now!! 

All in all, we spent $160 total, with 2 beers and 1 wine. Glad we went sampling, but now I know what I will and will not order next time.

Suggest making reservations, we had about 10 people ahead of us, standing in line before it opened, they have some funky hours. Lady said it would be an hour wait, but it was less than 30. mins. Glad we waited.

We had lunch at Lotus of Siam from a trusted recommendation, and it was 100% spot on! We were warned that we should get a reservation, but luckily lunch was not as busy and we were seated right away (we also learned dinner reservations were COMPLETELY booked).

Don''t let the parking lot and outside fool you. This place is a real gem!

Garlic prawns - AMAZING. Large and juicy, and somehow the skin is removed except at the tail, which forms kind of like a potato chip. This was our favorite dish.

Crispy duck with chili leafs - also excellent. Duck was very meaty and flavorful. 

The two dishes above were a bit pricey at $24-27ish each, but it was definitely well worth it!

We had very high expectations of this restaurant based on the various reviews we read. We love Thai food and eat it every chance we get. However, this wasn't a great experience. First, the restaurant is located in one of the nastiest parts of Las Vegas. One typically doesn't expect to enter the ghetto to go to a 5-star restaurant. We were very uncomfortable driving through this area and even walking from the parking lot to the restaurant. Second, we had a mixed food experience. I tried a traditional Thai dish that was quite good...4 1/2 stars for that dish. My wife decided to try one of the Northern Thai specialties, which turned out to be very poor and gets a 1 star. Finally, the service was okay but not great. Overall, we might try it again based on the tasty dish I had, but we certainly aren't rushing back.

We heard lots about this Thai restaurant so decided to give it a shot since we were visiting Vegas for the weekend back in Aug 2015.  Based upon what we had it is a solid 3.5 for now. Until we return to try more items then I'll review again & hopefully I'll bump it up to 4 stars!

:: TO-GO ORDER EXPERIENCE ::

We were pressed for time and had decided to do To-Go pick up on a Sunday. Restaurant doesn't open until 5:30 PM but we called ahead anyways at 5:15 PM to give it a shot. Even though we were able to place our order they do tell you kitchen does not open until 5:30 PM. 
When we got to the restaurant (located in a pretty run down/sketchy looking strip mall) there were already a line out the door!  

Entrance to the restaurant was so TINY -- to get in you pretty much have to go in a single file line (where there is alot of people). You also have to wait in the same line even for To-Go orders! Due to the mad line we didn't pick up our To-Go order until 5:50 PM. But the gal at the front counter was very nice.  Regardless, IMO they should have a separate To-Go line or something :P

:: RESTAURANT INTERIOR ::

The interior was pretty big! I couldn't even tell from the outside. Upon entrance into the establishment there is a wine cellar display and to the very right of the venue is a bar where patrons can wait for their table to be called. The atmosphere was nice and décor was decent. A say a bit to much celebrity photos covering the walls left & right. It's a very casual dining establishment & away from the glitz & glam of the Vegas strip. 

:: FOOD ::

Prices here are seriously a bit steep for Thai food.  But due to the hype we tried it out anyways. For AMAZING damn good food I'll pay for it -- of course when my wallet allows it :P

CRISPY DUCK W/ PANANG  $24    (4.5/5)
-- Portion kind of small for the price. Hence the minus 0.5 star. Duck was definitely crispy & there were no bones! The panang curry was delicious! But i wished they gave more tho :P 

SUA RONG HAI   $18   (3.5/5)
-- Aka the "Crying Tiger." Generous charbroiled beef portion but something about the charbroiled taste of the beef was a little off/different or maybe this is the true taste of a Crying Tiger? The home-made spicy sauce was not so bad but not much tang to it. 

CRAB FRIED RICE   $14   (2.5/5)
-- There really were HARDLY any crab pieces in this fried rice. Tasted like regular fried rice. Definitely not worth the price. You're probs better off with the regular Thai fried rice for cheaper.

THAI ICED COFFEE   $2.50   (3/5)
-- My taste bud didn't quite love it but found it not bad... something was lacking. Maybe it's just me?!

We make a point to dine here when we are in Vegas.  Great food and service.  garlic prawns, yellow curry, spicy chicken wings, som thum, and nua nam took are excellent.  They open at 5:30 for dinner so if you do not have a reservation, get here by 5:00 so you can get seated when they open.  Otherwise, the wait can be up to a hour starting at 6:00 pm

We ordered a take out. 2 garlic prawns and 1 soft shell crab papaya salad, and the total was over $80. Ouch!!!
Too pricey. The food was good, but I think the price is ridiculous.

We try to eat at lotus every time we are in Vegas. We are originally from Los Angeles, and will plan to leave from la at 6am to make sure we get there in time for lunch because it's just that good. Real good. That good, good. The garlic prawns. The crispy duck curry. Gooooooood. So good, that we will forego Vegas strip restaurants and go back on Saturday night, and wait an hour for a table so we can experience those prawns and crispy duck curry all over again. You can't go wrong with anything on the Northern Specialties section of the menu. We are making our way down the menu one trip to Vegas at a time. Absolutely one of the best thai places, hands down.

We were a bit disappointed by the taste of the food. The crispy duck panang is very good with a nice panang coconut curry. But the Thai papaya salad and the en tuan soup was a downer. The salad is crowded with blend stiff papaya without much other ingredients nor too much flavor. The soup on the other extreme has too much spice such that it tastes excessive of star anise. 

The coconut ice cream with sweet rice was good, although at time there was clumps in the rice and chunks of ice in the coconut ice cream that broke the texture of this dessert.

We were getting a bit desperate finding a place in their area that was open for lunch - at least beyond the soulless fast food options in the area. Finally lucked out here. Great food and the service was spot on, even though they were just about to close their lunch service. I'll definitely come here again.
We were super excited to try this restaurant but it was OK....rather disappointed!

We were told the wait for our table for 2 would be a 45-65 minute wait on a Saturday, about 8pm. We were seated in under 30. 
We started with the Spicy Wings, the Tom Yum Koon soup and the Thai Salad.
The wings were fabulous- we could have eaten plate after plate all night. 
The shrimp were wonderfully delicate in the Tom Yum Soup. 
We agreed we could have just drunk the peanut dressing for the Thai salad on its own.
And the Crispy Duck Panang style. Perfection. The duck was melt in your mouth tender, with that crispy skin as a beautiful balance. We ordered it as a 3 for spice, and it was a perfect build for me, though my hub said he would have it as a 4 or 5 next time for the kick. 
My hub's Thai Coffee had a nice, rich flavor that was not drowned in cream. My Thai Iced Tea was the same.
This will be one of our go to places for Vegas. 
Excellent all around.

We're back for some crispy duck panang!!! They raised the price since the last time. One small portion of the dish now cost 27.95. We called in our order for pick up knowing how long the wait is and how crowded it gets. The staff on the phone was nice enough to inform me about the price and portion. (Thank you!) I was told to come in 40mins. 

We also ordered their pineapple fried rice ($11.95). Rice was soft and fluffy with delicate sweetness and it was really tasty. One of the best I've had. We wanted to order another dish so I went full on review reading mode on Yelp and settled for their chicken khoa soi ($10.95). It's thin yellow noodle and you doused them in this spicy, sweet, and out of this world semi-thick sauce/gravy. They serve it with lime, raw onion, and crispy strips of fried tortilla?!!! I dunno but it's sooooo good! They will also ask you for the level of spice. I ordered spicy and it's SPICAAAAAAAAY!!! 

Took a mediocre photo with bad lighting in our hotel room BUT the food was anything but.

Went for lunch and the Buffet is GONE! Miss it! Lunch item prices should be lower, smaller portions, but it's one menu for all. Not wise. Food is always excellent. Service okay. Don't know when I'll go back. Just for dinner.

Went there 11/10/15 with big group. Hidden secrete!! Best food ever! 2 enthusiastic  would recommend to everyone to try! Off strip but well worth it plus don't be scared by dumpy outside look, inside its classy and welcoming! Service is fantastic & helpful. Will alway dine there when in the area. Thank you Jeff Howell for the suggestion. You always get it right!

Went there based on Yelp reviews
Ambiance is ok h
Location is a strip mall
Prices are high
We had
Veg egg rolls - solid 3.5/5
Garlic pepper sauce with shrimp -2.5.  
Drunken noodles with Sea Bass - 3/5
Noodles were very sticky almost glued together
Papaya salad - 4/5
For the price not worth it
Noodle wave in Dallas and Sala Thai in Fremont CA are way better and cheaper
Not worth a visit in my view
Went there for lunch with my mother - her first time at an Indian restaurant - service and food was really good.  Will definitely be back.

Went there w/high expectations coz Anthony Bourdain recommended it. So disappointed! The Khao Soi & garlic prawns were strictly ok. My awe & respect for Tony went down a notch :( if you want to have the best Khao Soi, go to PaaDee in PDX. Even PokPok does better Khao Soi!

What a joke! All hype no substance! Ordered drunken noodles, garlic and pepper chicken wings, nom prik ohm, and a style of hot and sour soup. We ordered to go and live about 4 miles away we went straight home and started serving. Everything was either mostly cold or luke warm. Absolutely no flavor in anything especially the dish that put this place on the map! How is it possible that chili paste has no flavor? I've eaten Thai food all over town and this is by far the worst of the bunch. I'll usually order a combination of American Thai as well as " authentic." I just happened to be in area to eat at Cornish pasty co, they were closed and thought next best option would be to try the famous a Lotus of Siam. Big mistake! I've had more flavorful food from 24 hr Thai delivery. The portions are small, and overpriced. TRUST ME! Do not waste your time or money, you can probably pick any other Thai restaurant in town and have better food. By the way as I'm writing this my heart is pounding and I'm getting more and more thirsty. Can only mean copious amounts of MSG!

What a little gem in the strip mall rough! After being price gouged at our hotel for a day, it was so refreshing to be charged as much for a bottle of wine as a glass would have cost back at the ranch. And the food was thai-rrific! As an aside, I never tire of bad thai puns. No frills ambience, and that's just fine with me.

What a nice place , amazing food ! Im giving you guys 5 star for everything
I dont know what was salad name , but it was so great
What a surprise when I came here! I was apprehensive to this place just from sight. But once in and seated I was floored! The service is great and the food it amazing!!

What can I say, this place is hyped up.  Yes, it's busy, make reservations. Yes, service was good and fast. Yes, the food was good but pricey with small portions.  Le Thai on Freemont Street, with it's small menu, is by far better that Lotus of Siam.

What happens in Vegas stays in Vegas....unless you're talking about the absolute best Thai food you'll find this side of the Pacific Ocean. Then go ahead and tell everyone!

What to order:
- Khao Soi - A curry noodle dish from the Northern menu. You don't find Northern Thai food too often in restaurants, but based on this dish, we should see it more. You've had Pad Thai a million times, get this superior noodle dish instead.
- Garlic Prawns - Not overly greasy, not quite tempura, not quite salt baked, utterly perfect. The prawns are huge, well seasoned, and the shells (also fried) are equally delicious!
- Crispy Duck in Penang - I've basically only had duck cooked the Chinese way (roasted, Peking-style, or braised) or the western way (confit or medium rare breast). This is a whole new world of preparation, and it's incredible. The texture is great without sacrificing flavor. And baby, I could bathe in that panang. 

Tips:
- If you're going for dinner, you'll want to make a reservation. Lunch doesn't take reservations, so just get there as early as possible.
- Dishes are pricier than other Thai restaurants, and they are also typically smaller (trust me, it's well worth it!). Order accordingly. 
- The spice scale (from 1-10) is calibrated toward an American palate. So if you're like me and have a real need for heat, order EVERYTHING at level 10. You can request for it even higher if you really want to punish your GI tract.
- Driving is preferable as the cabs can be unreliable. I'd keep your valuables out of sight though.

If you're only having one meal it Vegas, eat here.
If you're staying for several days, eat here at least twice.

What more can I add to all the reviews on Lotus? Well, it's not in the best neighborhood and there is a good chance someone will hit you up for change or to watch your car in the parking lot.  Somehow that all adds to the odd charm that is Lotus. 

For first timers you might think what am I doing here and what is all the fuss about?  Well, the food is unique and there are so many tasty options.  

All I can say if your staying on the strip take an Uber or Lyft over and back, it's worth the trip.

When visiting Vegas, I always stop and eat here at Lotus of Siam. It's the best Thai food.  Don't let the strip mall worry you, the restaurant is nice once you get inside. The garlic prawns are so good and I always order them.  The coconut lemongrass soup is real tasty.  The duck is super tasty too. You just can't go wrong here. Make sure to get reservations or get there when they open and they'll accommodate your party.  My Vegas trips are enhanced after visiting Lotus of Siam.

When we visit Vegas, we make a point to eat here.  I must say our recent dining experience was very disappointing.   We started with papaya salad which was a little too sweet.  The garlic prawns was very greasy, Pad Thai and yellow curry were meh.  Also, the portions are very small compared to our previous visits.  We will be taking a break from coming here.
Who doesn't love this place? Making reservations well in advance is key here. Don't be like those people standing outside for hours because they thought it wouldn't be that busy.

Who would've thought such a delicious, clean place would be located in what looks like a vacant strip mall.  Good food is really best enjoyed when coupled with excellent service...& the Lotus of Siam has an abundance of both.  The food was savory and a great value.  Good for a couples dinner or large party.  We had a party of 16 which they did a great job accommodating.  We will definitely be returning on our next trip out.  Kudos to Tony our server...thanks for a great experience!

With over 2,000 reviews, I am not sure that there is much that I can add.  But I do want to make one suggestion to Yelpers:  Please, please, PLEASE look at the Northern Thai section of the menu.  While the rest of the menu is very, very good (especially loved the Garlic Prawns and Sea Bass on Drunken noodles), the Northern Thai section offers dishes that you won't find at most Thai restaurants.  We had two standouts, both based on recommendations of our very attentive waiter.

The first was Kang Ka Noon, which is jackfruit in a spicy curry sauce.  An article on NPR says that these are the largest tree fruit in the world, reaching up to 100 lbs each, and high in protein, potassium, and vitamin B2 (and yes, they are quite an interesting looking fruit).  However, when it is cut up and put into a dish, the jackfruit has the consistency of an artichoke heart.  Smooth, creamy and delicious.  And the curry sauce adds the perfect spice to balance the simple sweetness of the fruit.

The second dish was Khao Soi, a curried, egg noodle dish (with Burmese flavor influences) that we had with chicken.  Much like Pho has its salad accompaniment, so does Khao Soi:  onions, mustard greens, and lime.  Oh my goodness was this dish fantastic.  It was clearly the hit of the night.

So if you are an adventurous foodie (and you likely are if you are reading reviews in Yelp), step away from the traditional and go right for the Northern part of the menu.  You will not be sorry.
Woohoo! As good as it gets!

Worth the trip to this strange strip mall. 

We headed there for lunch on a Friday and were quickly seated.

The place is so much bigger than I expected! And they have a pretty amazing wine selection, though we didn't have any on this visit.

The duck curry was the best. We also ordered fried tofu and a pork dry curry which was far spicier than I had wanted but also too good to resist.

Yelp said they were open weekends so we sprung for the $25 cab ride. They were closed at noon. The driver took us to china town where we had a 5 star lunch at Krung Thai and a massage at Wei Wei. Go to china town!!!

Yes, this place is in the ghetto. While on the parking lot I had a homeless man on a bicycle knock on my car window to ask me for money, but...who cares! This is simply the best food you will have. Once inside, the restaurant is nice enough, good wine selection to pair with the most delicious dishes. Every time I have been there, there's famous people eating dinner.

Pros: The best thai food second to none , cheap prices.

Cons: make a reservation in advance, hopefully days in advance because the place is small and it is always packed. You may get mugged on the parking lot, what a shame that such a spectacular place has such poor location.

Yum!  Love it!  We've been there many times. Don't be frightened by the location, once you are inside, it's all good.  The food is amazing and the wine selection is spectacular.  They even take special care in polishing the wine glasses... Classy!  It's always busy, better to make a reservation.

a good thai restaurant. but definitely not more than an hour wait long kind of good. plenty of empty tables but would seat us or anyone for over an hour. what is the real hype?
been Eating here For years Very good Pizza. If Your looking for Cheap Not fresh ingredients. go to Pappa Johns or one of those places .... NYC pizza
damn this place is awesome, food is perfect and full of taste, i had to comeback and never regret
delicious!  happy enviornment, quality dishes, knowledgable servers.  great experience!
don't believe the hype. not all that.
great Thai food.  need a reservation cause it's always packed.  komol a few doors down is a great alternative if you don't want to wait
great food, location is not great

heard lots of hype about this place so i checked it out. the food is ok. but i expected more from a $300+ bill for 4 people.  lobster, shrimp, sticky rice, soups. average thai food. for the same money, there are better restaurant choices in the area.

i love this place, i love everything about it...
the food is amazing

the wine cooler is cool ;)
but, the prices!!!!! why do they keep going up? this is not cool.
i need to go back, it's that good
lots better Thai restaurants than this place. cant believe its a national rated place. took me a while to figure out why the deep fried veggies were light pink, Palm oil
never expected this place to be so good, all the good reviews about this place are not lying !

nom nomz. heard about this place through a friend who wanted to go try it. checked it out on Yelp and it is probably the highest rated Thai restaurant in all of Vegas. my group figured we HAD to go before we left Vegas. plus, i love Thai food anyways. 

Be prepared for an early dinner or plan when you're going and make reservations (you need to make them at least 7 days in advance). the restaurant opens at 5:30PM and the line is no joke. my friends and I had a large party so we got there at about 5PM and started waiting in line. I thought it was ridiculous that we went so early since we were the only ones waiting in line. lo and behold, 10 minutes later, the line was down the block. doors opened at 5:30PM and the reservations line gets seated first. then my party was first in line to get a table since we got there so early. i looked around as we ordered and the restaurant filled up quickly. 

the restaurant is known for it's northern Thai food so leave the traditional Pad Thai at home. my party decided to order a bunch of food and just share it family style. we had 2 orders of their garlic prawns, the chicken khao soi (chicken served on a bed of egg noodles in a curry base sauce, garnished with sliced red onions, lime and pickled vegetables), nam kao tod (Crispy rice mixed with sour cubed pork sausages, cilantro, green onions, grounded dry chilis, ginger, peanuts and lime juice), drunken noodle soft shell crab, panang curry with crispy duck, and a beef dish... I believe it was the Pad Prik Sod (Choice of meat sautéed with bell peppers, fresh chili pepper, & onions). we all also ordered the Thai Iced Tea which is delicious and highly recommended. I love that you can really taste the tea flavor yet it was still sweet and creamy. 

when the food came, we were all ready to chow down. they also gave us a basket of rice and said that if we needed more, we could just ask. the dishes seemed small but for some reason, we had a party of 8 and were still not able to finish all the food. everything was amazing and tasted super fresh. I would definitely recommend the garlic prawns and any dish with the crispy duck. 

of course we all wanted to get a dessert before we left so we ordered one mango sticky rice to share amongst us. the mango was so ripe and sweet. the coconut sticky rice was perfectly cooked and had just the right amount of sweet coconutty aroma to balance out the mango. i normally dont like sticky rice desserts but I can definitely come back for this one! 

overall, amazing food, great service, nice atmosphere. the restaurant looks deserted in the middle of an empty plaza if you arrive early, but don't judge a book by it's cover! I can see why it's the most highly rated Thai restaurant in Vegas. you have to give it a try if you're in this area! Truly unique restaurant that you would never imagine to find in all the glitz and glamour of Vegas.
orange appliance llc is awesome
place is good. and the customer service is good aswell

the best thai food in las vegas!   you would never guess that the best thai food in vegas is in some nondescript crappy strip mall a few miles off the strip but it is.  be prepared to wait...I dont know that they do reservations but its worth it.  the food is excellent and is quite reasonable especially when you compare it to comparable quality restaurants in the major casinos!

this place is hit or miss.  when it hits, it's the best Thai food in the country.  when it misses, you just waited 2 hours for something you could have gotten in any town in the country.  still good, but not the transcendent Zagat darling.  i got the larb a few months ago and it was one of the best things i ever ate.  i got it again a couple months later, totally different dish and only good.  the Reislings by the glass are a perfect pairing for the spicy, sality goodness it offers.  if you've never been here, then do so, be brave MAKE A RESERVATION, but have a realistic expectation.  it might completely blow your mind, but it might also be so so.  never bad, but worth the gamble because it's reasonably priced.

The Thai iced tea was excellent--it was the perfect amount of tea and creamer. The pad see ew with chicken and beef salad were also great. The yellow curry and garlic prawns were both mediocre. A lot of the prawns were simply shell and batter, no meat :( if you're lucky, you'll get some meaty, garlicky pieces. This is one of the better Thai restaurants I've dined at here in Vegas. I highly recommend this place if you have a couple hours to spare. Service was excellent and the hostesses were sweet.

3.5

I kept seeing write ups on this place as such a good place to check out, but I didn't think it was anything special.

The food was good to above average.  The service was friendly.  But that's about it.

Oishi Thai in Miami is such a better experience.

4.5 stars ! 

This place gets busy!!! So come right when they open. Their reservation list also gets filled quick so make reservations in advance. Me and my friends came here and waited like 30-45 mins. I find their service to be somewhat slow, not because our waiter was slow, but because their waitstaff was slow when setting up and cleaning the tables. The food came out at a decent time considering they were extremely packed on a Saturday night. 

The only big problem I have with this place is that their portions are pretty small. If you plan on sharing with a big group of people, I suggest ordering two of the same dish. Their noodle & curry dishes were especially small. Also when we ordered the mango sticky rice, there wasn't that much rice, it was a horrible mango to rice ratio.

Must get: according to my friends their crispy garlic prawns! This is a must, my friends were drooling over this dish for the longest time. They also said the duck curry is delicious as well. Oh and order the Thai tea as your drink. 

I tried their fried tofu, pad see ew and pad Thai. All these dishes taste the same everywhere else, it just cost more here and the portions are a lot smaller. 

Mango sticky rice was bomb! Loved how the rice wasn't too sweet, it was perfect, just wish there was more rice. The fried bananas were also yummy as well if you like bananas. 

Overall a yummy dinner, this place is just expensive for the amount of food they give you.

= Overall Food Quality: 3.0/5.0 =-

I stopped by here on the way back to Los Angeles with my SO. We ordered the Garlic Prawns and a Beef Panang.

Garlic Prawns: This dish was very expensive and though tasty it was not worth it by any means, essentially it's just prawns unshelled seasoned with some salt and garlic and deep fried.

Beef Panang: I thought the panang curry was alright, but the beef was extremely tough and difficult to chew.

-= Atmosphere: 3.0/5.0 =-

Not that special, it's a pretty simple restaurant within a strip mall. Lotus of Siam does seem to have a very extensive wine and alcohol collection though if you like alcohol with your thai food.

Service was very good, I never needed to ask to refill my water and the server was very nice about me asking him questions about the food.

-= Price: 4.0/5.0 =-

The overall price of the food was decent but some dishes such as the Garlic Prawns we ordered was overpriced.

-= Overall: 3.5/5.0 =-

Overall, nothing really that special, definitely not deserving of four stars and 2000+ reviews on yelp. 

If you are ever in Los Angeles, CA, go to Pasadena and try President Thai, they have very similar food to Lotus of Siam, but the food is way better and cheaper too.

Heck I can probably name Thai 5 restaurants in Los Angeles that is better than this.

A friend suggested this place when I was out here in Vegas. OF course when I first heard of it I was excited but skeptical due to the wait time and hoping it is not just a hype place. I arrived around 545pm on a Sunday night and people were already seated enjoying their food. The hostess told me the wait time was 2 hours. oh boy, theres always tat decision to whether find something else or to wait. We decided to put our name down and the hostess told us there is a waiting room in the back. They also have the app where we enter our phone numbers and they would let us know when the table is ready. We also were able to see the wait time on the website thats linked to their app. GENUIS ! The waiting room definitely made waiting more bearable. About 3 hours later we finally got our table. We already decided on which dishes we were going to order. 

Garlic Pawns: of course were a must ! This came in about 6/8 pieces and the whole shrimp including the shrimp was edible, just make sure you chew slowly. 

Crispy Duck ( Khao Soi): I have never had this before at a thai restaurant but it was so good! Definitely need to eat this with rice. The dish was full of flavors and it all complimented well with one another. 

Tom Kah Kai:(hot pot for the bigger portion) I love Thai soup! this had coconut base to it and it was so delicious. the cream of the coconut balanced the sourness of the soup. highly recommend ordering this soup dish. 

Thai fried rice: this one was okay,  I wish I chose a more exciting fried rice. 

Thai Spagettii: We had a party of 6 so we each had to get a little bit to try. The noodles were cooked to al dente and the flavors of the sauce was gentle and not overly powered by it. 

Fried stuff chicken: this was an interesting dish. It was stuffed with mushrooms/ chicken/ and veggies. The sauce it came with was what topped off the dish. 

Nam Kao Tod: This is the duck curry.. let me tell ya ...I wish they had a bucket of the curry ! The dish came with some noodles but of course wishing they added more. The curry sauce was so good over rice. This dish was not overpowered by the curry and the duck was good perfectly so where it was soft. The curry flavor was infused in to the duck pieces. 

Had a little room for dessert so we opted for the Fried Banana with coconut ice cream. The banana was fried in what seem like the skin of an egg roll and topped with some cold creamy coconut ice cream! The temperature of the banana was perfect to add the ice cream on top. perfect crunch/ sweetness / and goodness. 

Highly recommend if you can make reservations to this place! 
BE patient during wait time because I can tell you it is WORTH IT if you love thai food.

After reading all the reviews, we couldn't wait to try this place, but we were so disappointed.
It took forever to be seated and once we were seated, it took forever to get a waiter. Once we ordered, our appetizers came out on time, however, with our entrees we waited an hour! And they were cold. When we spoke with our server, he was rude and didn't offer to take back our entrees. 
Will never visit this place again.
Always great food.  Wait was long, especially on a Thursday night, but the food was great.

Amaaaazing Thai food...Northern Thai Cuisine is different than what most restaurants serve.  Flavors are more subtle but perfect for the palette.  Each dish is carefully crafted to mix just the right flavor with texture and yes...aroma.  Best Thai food EVER - hands down.

Amazing food, period.
We ordered nine dishes for four of us. Got amazing services with relatively cheap price.

Amazing. We are locals and have come here several times. Never disappointed. Saying "authentic" is such an overused term, but I have to say it here. Lotus is the most authentic Thai food you will get outside of Bangkok. I'm Thai and I'm a harsh judge of Thai food. Make reservations if you can, otherwise it's worth the wait if you don't. Staff is so gracious and kind. I can't say enough wonder things about LoS.

An absolutely great restaurant. I have eaten here for years and it has always been a Vegas classic! The service and food are always excellent, and I would highly recommend it to anyone in search of fine Asian dining!
An amazing selection of great food.   Come hungry with a decent size group (4 minimum) so you can partake of a large variety of shared dishes.
Authentic Thai food, it's as good as it gets here in Vegas.

Average food; poor service. 

Our experience fell very short of our expectations. We kept hearing people talk about this place, they must not know what a great Thai food is! 

We met our friends at the bar upon arriving. The restaurant was packed in the waiting area which was very very small. Our friends were waiting at the bar so we joined them. The bartender lady handed the menu and the entire time we were there (a good 20minutes) never turned around and asked for our drink orders. Poor first impression!

We ordered a bunch of food to share on the table. I am a big seafood person and prior to going in, I checked Yelp for the "must order" items. I ordered the garlic prawns that everyone is raving about. It was average, nothing amazing. Honestly, I still prefer and love Pho Kim Long's salt and pepper shrimp! More flavorful and half the price!  

We paid our bill and was finishing our drinks. The server kept coming back and asking if we needed anything else and we said no. Not long after, the lady bartender who ignored us at the bar came to our table and asked us if it's ok if we leave cause people are waiting for our table. Really??? We work in the service industry here in Vegas for a long time. Never ever have I experienced being asked to leave! This place is over rated, will never come back again! There are a lot of other Thai restaurant that are  way better in taste and service!
Awesome food - small portions.  I had to buy 2 of everything in order to feed my family of 4.
Awesome food and quick service but the wait can get long. The price is also a lot pricier.
Awesome place, loads of great food must try.

Awesome service, awesome food, great ambiance - absolutely excellent experience.  I've taken my sister and niece, some friends who were visiting, and been there with local friends and each time, it has lived up to its reputation.
Awesome! Make sure to try the appetizer with with bacon wrapped shrimp!! They have an extensive wine list from my wino's!

BEST THAI FOOD IN LAS VEGAS! This place is seriously amazing. It's off the beaten path in a pretty suspicious plaza. This place is always busy, we got there ten minutes before they opened on a Sunday for dinner and there was at least twenty people in line. It's totally worth any wait though.
They have an impressive wine selection (a lot of rieslings) and everything on their menu is great. I always go with the Pineapple fried rice, spice level 8. It's so flavorful and the pineapple adds the appropriate amount of sweetness to offset the spiciness. A great appetizer is the crispy rice or the garlic wings. Seriously, you need to get the wings. The fried garlic is mouthwatering and the wings are so crispy.
It's totally worth the trek over, if you're in Las Vegas and don't eat here you're making a mistake.

I still of a copy of my receipt from the restaurant.  So now I have to deal with calling the credit card companies to deal with this and waste my time. This place is so busy so please watch your statement because they will take your money away.  I emailed the restaurant I still have not gotten a response, it's been over a week.

Basis for my starred ratings (which skews heavily to the food or drink):
1 star:  Never again.
2 stars:  Poor food, poor experience, extraordinary measures in order for me to come back.
3 stars:  Average, nothing really special, nothing particularly bad.
4 stars:  Very good, would definitely return.
5 stars:  A favorite, one of the best.

The finest Thai my wife and I have ever had.  Worth the trip off-strip.  We come here every trip now.

Excellent wine selection for a Thai restaurant.  Spicy here actually means something, and even medium-spicy comes out with some good heat.  We've focused on the northern and Issan dishes here, but even the old classics here are done very, very well.

The papaya salad is one of the best, if not best, we've ever had.  The pad thai here is also very good - not the sweet mess that comes out at most Thai joints.

We have also had:
Khao soi - my single favorite dish.  Excellent
Northern larb - very good, packs a kick
Nam prik hed - probably our least favorite, but it is not bad at all.  Just the weakest of a strong group.
Kang hung lay - excellent pork dish
Nam prik noom - quite good, lots of veggies with it
Koi soi - a fine dish, not spectacular

We will always come back here and focus on the northern dishes.  Service here has been excellent, the food has been flawless, and I can't say enough good things about this place.

Been coming here for more than a decade and have always been pleased.  This isn't like all the corner cafe pad thai joints you see everywhere.  They have a much wider range of Thai dishes than you see in most places so you get to try something a little out of the ordinary.  Good variety of wines, the service has always been on point when I've come and the food never disappoints.  The quality is much better than most Asian places on the Strip and is a much better value than anything comparable would be inside a hotel.  

People are serious about needing to get there early because it fills up quickly.  Not uncommon to have a few dozen people waiting outside before the doors open.
Best Thai I've had outside of Thailand.  Highlights of the evening include Garlic Prawns & Crispy Duck in Red Curry (spicy alert).
Best Thai I've had. And upscale.
Best Thai food I have ever had. The northern dishes are great. The pad Thai noodles were great. The appetizers were great.

Best Thai food I've eaten and real quality food. Waiter was really informative and corrected my Indonesian pronunciation of "Panang" which I guess I was supposed to be right since it's based on the Malay language but they said it "Paenaeng". Since there are so many reviews, this review is just for my own record. Ordered off menu lamb shank with green peppercorn sauce. Lamb was too rare for my taste but I loved the tenderness and the sauce. Ordered crispy duck in panang sauce and friends loved it but I was ok with the duck honestly -- not as crispy as I thought it would be, but perhaps that's cos it took me a few minutes before getting to it. Also ordered special of the day seafood hot and sour soup. It was awesome except that the crab was all skin and hard to get the meat. The sauce was perfection tho and I became obsessed to research northern Thai food now! WOOOOOOO can't wait to try cooking these curry sauces! @.@

Always make a reservation. Reservation is hard to get and Sunday is more crowded than Saturday. I was able to push my reservation on a Saturday from 7  pm to 7.15 pm to 8 pm which I really appreciated of them to cooperate since I was only in town for 3 days even tho the lady seemed annoyed which I don't blame her for (I had lost my car key earlier then got stuck in traffic). We got a spot 8 minutes before 8! My friend who came the next day (Sunday) had to wait 30 mins+ even after her reservation.
Best Thai food I've ever had. Everything was great! I wish they'd open up one in Los Angeles! High quality.
Best Thai food I've had in Vegas, went with my work family, part of which are Thai (made it a lot easier to order!) I loved everything. Not to mentions the WINE ROOM is beautiful!
Best Thai food I've had in a long time. Get the crispy duck!!!

Best Thai food in the Western Hemisphere. It is smaller than you might imagine and in a shady looking strip mall but the food makes up for it.

Here's my tip-
The chef is from Northern Thailand and special items from that area are indicated on the menu. Select some of those dishes. I prefer the Northern Larb for example over the standard larb.

Be adventurous and stay away from chicken satay, pad thai and penang beef. You can get that anywhere.

Oh, reservations are recommended but if it's a weeknight and early, head over and get on the list. They have a wine bar in the back that where you can wait. Wine selection is quite nice too! Lots of German varieties.

Best Thai food in the country and I have been to quite a few in different states.  We used to go for their lunch buffet, when ever we came to Vegas from Los Angeles,  which is no loner available, boo hoo..because you can get little bites of a lot of their dishes that way..we still go for lunch or dinner and order from the menu but it makes it harder because we have to limit our dishes.  If you love Thai..you have to go here..yopu wont be disappointed..great service as well.

Best Thai food since I visited Thailand! Hard to get a table, but when you do, it's worth it! This place is not about how fancy the decor, the silverware  nor the  glassware, it's all about the food! No they don't dress it up with garnishes or try to make it look pretty, just good old fashion good food.

Best Thai in the world !!! #14 Nam Kao Tod don't ask just order it quite possibly the best most flavorful unique dish in LV. The Garlic Prawns are beyond amazing and the simple cashew nut chicken was spot on . The Papaya salad is off the chain but Holy Heatwave Batman the spice is white hot (which I like but buyer beware) If you normally get a #7 or 8 spice get the 3 or 4 and you will be golden . I am a wine gal and I must say without a doubt the best wine list in all of Las Vegas including the strip. And the pricing is way way low . I would say more but I have a nail appointment !! TTFN ... Love ya Lotus .
Best Thai is LV! Authentic dishes, highly recommend anything on the menu.

Best Thai place I've ever been, and I've been to quite a few. Gets crowded on weekends and evenings, but they do take reservations. Not cheap and not huge portions, but taste and quality are outstanding. Great wine menu as well.
Papaya Salad, Garlic Prawns (shells fried crispy like chips) and Short Rib Penang are our favorites.

Best Thai restaurant in Las Vegas! 

MUST ORDER:

GARLIC PRAWNS
Deep fried prawns with shells (almost like potato chips), sautéed with our special garlic sauce, topped with ground black pepper.

NAM KAO TOD
Crispy rice mixed with sour cubed pork sausages, cilantro, green onions, grounded dry chilis, ginger, peanuts and lime juice.

TOM YUM KOONG
Hot and sour soup with shrimp.

ANOTHER LIST OF GREAT DISHES:

KHAO SOI
Crispy duck served on a bed of egg noodles in a curry base sauce, garnished with sliced red onions, lime and pickled vegetables.

GOLDEN TOFU
Deep fried bean curd, served with homemade sweet and sour sauce with chopped peanuts & cilantro.

CRAB FRIED RICE
Fried rice with crab meat, tomatoes, onions, and egg.

DO NOT ORDER:

KANG KA NOON 
Spicy Young Jack Fruit Curry - The curry was watery, which I did not expect nor like. It seemed more like a soup rather than a curry to me.
Best meal! Crispy Duck !!! I dream about it!!! A must if your visiting!! Have tried to replicate our meal all over Maryland ... Can't compare!

Best thai food ever. Amazing flavors, huge menu selection, affordable prices. It is hard to get a table at this place. You need to make reservations at least one week ahead and sometimes that is not enough. But the food is so worth it. You will not regret it.
Best thai food i've ever had. I just left the place and i already want to go back. The service is good and fast. Can't wait to be hungry again so i can eat more.

Best...Thai...Food...ever! 

just make sure you order their northern thai dishes, as that's what they specialize in. if you come here to order the pad thai, you're missing the whole point of visiting Lotus of Siam

Prices are very reasonable, the fried banana desert is the bomb! I always make sure to stop by this place whenever in Vegas.

Bomb Thai food! No mango sticky rice (my cousin wanted). 
Luckily they made a reservation! Line out the door! 
Food was delicious!

Came in with with high, albeit reserved, expectations from all the hype and my expectations were still exceeded. I like spicy food but avoid punishment, so a 6 or 7/10 spice level works for me. 

Koi Soi [Steak Tartar - Issan Style] and drunken noodles were good. 

Issan sausage, tom yum, tom ka, chix fried rice, musaman were as expected.
Can't say enough good thing about this place.  All my friends from out of town love this place because this is the first place we hit when they are in town.

Come before they open they said. If you don't, you'll have to wait for two hours they said. My curiosity was peaked. What can make this place so good that people are willing to wait?

The restaurant has a small entry way where you check in and I was dreading being cramped in such a tight space for TWO hours. Luckily, they do have a large banquet style waiting room behind the bar area. Phew. We were quoted two hours but we waited closer to 3 hours. I was doing my best to control the hangry monster within. 

TWO MUST HAVES: Crispy Duck Khao Soi ($26.95) and Garlic Prawns ($27.95). Oh my lordy. The recommendations were on point. I favored the garlic prawns slightly more. Fried to perfection. You could eat the entire prawn -- even the tail! I came close to tossing them, but so glad my friend caught me before I did. Close call. Trust me, you'll want to savor every bite. And the duck... It's packed with flavor. My boyfriend's favorite dish. You must get them both. 

RECOMMENDATIONS...

Nam Kao Tod ($8.95): This was a crispy rice dish appetizer. It sounds plain, but don't be fooled. Every bite you'll get the taste of lime, chili, cilantro, seasoning, and the texture of rice that's crispy yet chewy. How they do it I do not know. Fry masters are working in the kitchen.

Thai Spaghetti ($11.95): It's the sauce and noodles that will win you over. It had that slightly sweet flavor, similar to pad thai. The noodles were served al dente, which was perfect. It had that chew texture that I absolutely love for noodles. 

Banana Roll ($8.50): Highly recommended with coconut ice cream (additional $4). I'm not the biggest coconut fan, but loved their ice cream. I need to know where they get it! The banana roll portion was generous even for a party of 6 like ours. Banana lovers will not be disappointed. 

We got a few other dishes, including their Thai Fried Rice with Chicken ($10.95), Tom Kah Kai Hot Pot Soup ($14.95), and Stuffed Chicken Wings ($11.95). They were all good, but the dishes I mentioned above were noteworthy! 

Stopping at Lotus of Siam will truly be a treat for your tastebuds. Food is AMAZING. It has officially made it to my #1 spot for Thai food. Service was fast and efficient from the moment you're sat. Prices are steep, but they really know how to cook up amazing food. Best way to go about it is family style so you can sample a little of everything. 

Reservations are taken but should be made AT LEAST a week in advance. A couple in front of us had reservations and got seated immediately. Note taken. The wait was worth it, but I can't see myself doing it again. BE SMART AND MAKE A RESERVATION!!

Could be the best Thai restaurant in the country, there is a reason you need to make reservations way in advance.
  Everything I have had is the best i have eaten anywhere.
The drunken noddles are insane..
 The apps are great.
  This is the best you can get without gong to Thailand.

Crispy duck Khao Soi and the garlic prawns. AMAZING! Don't forget dessert!! Coconut ice cream served over warm sticky rice. You won't want to share. Do yourself a favor and come here. 

You will need to make reservations a couple days in advance if you can't stand to wait 30 mins to 2 hours depending on the night. My boyfriend and I waited. It was worth it.

I'm giving 4 stars based on my boyfriends dish. He got the beef panang. It was good but not 5 stars good. I like to save my 5 star reviews for places that leave me dreaming about the next time I will get to eat there.

Crispy duck panang is my favorite dish. The braised short rib is a close second. Anthony Bourdain got it right when he mentioned this place in not just 1 but 2 episodes. Just have to make sure to avoid the rush... this place is well known and very popular.

Delicious food.  A friend said it is the best Thai he has ever eaten in the USA, and it is definitely up there.  The only thing I disagree with is the $$ rating.  It may be that we ordered expensive dishes, but it was $150 for four of us for lunch.  But if you are a foodie, you'll love it.
Delicious food. There's usually a wait 20 to 45 minutes, but it's wort it! Every time I visit Las Vegas I always make a point to come here!

Delicious wine, delicious food in a large, packed restaurant full of happy people.  Wow!  My husband and I loved our meal here.   We were advised to order from the North Thai menu, and stick to their specialties.  We didn't order any of the stuff we would normally order (green curry, pad thai, larb, etc).  Instead we went all adventure - the shrimp with the shell (yum and I don't eat shrimp!), the jackfruit and pork, the massumam curry (a muslim curry - so creamy and seasoned perfectly).  The nam tok... crispy and perfect.

I can't wait to get my butt back to Vegas for more Lotus of Siam.

Delicious!!! Wait wasn't too long. Looks like they try to turn tables over pretty quickly without rushing people. Had the som tom and haven't had any that good since I was in Thailand!! It was great and actually spicy:) definitely will come back next time I'm in Vegas.
Do not allow the location to fool you, Amazing food, we tried an assortment of plates and it was BY FAR some of the best Thai food I've had. Their curry chicken is simply AMAZING!
Doesnt have an authentic Thai flavor to it. Seems like they dont take a lot of time making a "Great" Thai dish. More of a bottom of the barrel 2 star just serve them quickly type of thai restaurant.

Don't be fooled by the exterior! We were a little skeptical based on the location being in a run down strip mall and it doesn't look like much from the outside. When you get inside, you realize it's huge and full of people! The food was awesome, the menu is extensive, and there are options you don't see in every Thai restaurant. If I lived in Vegas I'd be a regular! It's worth the drive if you love Thai food.

During a business trip in Vegas one of our friends highly recommended this place. It was a 15 minutes cab ride from the strip. Looks nothing from the outside and humble inside. We waited for almost an hour on a Thur evening. 7 of us ordered at least 10 items. Each dish was pure perfection. Outstanding food.
Easily the best Thai food I've had since I went to Thailand. It will be I my "must@ list every time I come to Vegas from now on.

Eh, service was great. our waiter was fast and attentive. I wasn't too impressed with the food after all.. 

If you are tourist here in Vegas wanted to tried the most popular Thai food. here is the place for you. Want real home cook style Thai food? I will go to Komol, and yes I speaking from my personal experiences!
Ehh bf took me here don't like it, he doesn't know what to order rather eat somewhere else
Excellent Food and the best wine list I've ever seen at a Thai restaurant. Service was spot on. Look forward to coming here again.
Excellent Thai food. One of the best I have ever had anywhere.

Excellent local jewel close to the heart of Las Vegas. The size of the line outside the doors before opening time is an indicator to the quality of the food inside. By far the best massaman  curry I've had in the states and I highly recommend it. The Panang curry is wonderful as well but watch the spice level as the heat intensity is high on that dish. Again, an excellent choice for authentic Thai cuisine.

Expect LONG lines. Come when the first open to be seated right away. This place gets packed, but luckily it's huge inside.

Ordered the garlic prawns $28, for about 8 large prawns, delicious!! Kinda pricey but delicious.

Also got the pad see ew, drunken noodles with seafood, and papaya salad. You can choose a spiciness level 1-10. We chose 5 and it was super spicy!! 

Each entree is around  $10. Pretty good service too for a busy restaurant. 

I thought the entrees were okay, the garlic prawns was the best!
Fantastic food.  Neighborhood iffy then you walk into the restaurant and its beautiful and big and busy.
Fantastic place to eat in Vegas. Authentic Thai food. A little off the main strip but worth the drive.

Finally tried out this place after getting a lot of really good reviews from friends and family. It's by  the commercial center and it looks really small from the outside but when you come in, it's really big and nice plus they have a huge wine selection. 

The food is delectable but It's a little pricey for a Thai restaurant. If you come here you should order their Pad Thai of course. Also their short rib and garlic prawns are very good. The staff here are well trained and know their food very well so just ask if you needed help with the menu.

P.S. If you cannot tolerate spicy, just get 1-3 of 10 level range of spiciness. It is HOT!

First I have to say, I hate giving bad reviews. If a restaurant is bad but I feel like they tried to accommodate the customer then I would just not review and let it be. However I have to stick to the 1 star for this restaurant and that is only because the food is good. 

I walked in at 7:50PM looking for a table for 2. It was well over an hour wait, which we were okay with, but after the hour had passed we had to physically go inside and fight for a table. Finally after being embarrassed and realizing that they had forgot about our party they gave us a table. Since it was late already and we knew what we wanted we ordered everything at once. Appetizer, entrée and drinks. We got our appetizers right off the bat and it was some delicious Tom Kah Gia. It however took us over an hour once again to get our food. by that time the soup had turned cold. When we complained to the manager he stated that they offset meals by 10 to 20 mins, but I fought back and told him that we ordered everything at one time, so there should be no reason why things are late. He apologized and said he would take care of us and would do everything he can to make us happy. I thought that maybe this meant a discount on the bill.

When the bill came it was full priced and no discount applied to anything. When I asked to see the manager one more time took about 20 mins for him to walk over to us and I had to remind the waiter multiple times to talk with manager, perhaps the worst customer service experience of my life. When he walked over I showed him the bill and asked what have you done to accommodate our hardships. He said "oh yeah..." and walked away. He then returned with some ice cream desert, but both me and my party were full and did not want dessert so he basically brought out something that was a complete waste, he should have just discounted the bill with the price of the ice cream. 

So in the end I walked in at 7:50PM left the restaurant at 10:30PM very upset at how the manager had handled the situation. I will not be returning to this restaurant and will warn people of the service here. I don't care how famous the place is or how good the food is, the management is destroying the hard work the cooks and everyone else puts forth. 

My previous experience was just the same, but they actually forgot to bring me an entrée I ordered, that was 2 years ago. I am sad to see that things have not changed much :(

Food is good but service and ambience were subpar. I  guess they are operating on star power. I came because I saw them on TV as one of the best Thai restaurants in Vegas. I  wasn't disappointed in the food though.

Food was absolutely delicious! My friends and I ordered different dishes from curry to pad Thai to the absolutely amazing garlic prawns which were most definitely my favorite! We also ordered some appetizers, the stuffed chicken wings were awesome, they were perfectly cooked and the chicken was so juicy and full of flavor! We also had Nam Kao Tod which was mouth watering and SO amazing my second favorite dish aside from the garlic prawns! We definitely cleaned our plates that night! Sorry I couldn't add the stuffed chicken wings or the Nam Kao Tod they were so good I forgot I take a picture! But If you're in Vegas you have to stop in and try Lotus of Siam out! You will not regret it! I can't wait to plan my next visit to Vegas and this will always be one of my stops when I'm in town!
From the outside this place looks like a hole in the wall, but this is the best Thai food in Vegas hands down. Try the wonton soup.

From the outside, this place looks like it would be tiny because the plaza is a bit of a ghost town. When I walked inside the waiting area, I felt like my suspicion was confirmed. The hostess offered for us to wait at their bar (all I remember thinking was how how a place so small could possibly fit a bar), and that was when I found that they do have ample space in the restaurant. 

The food we ordered for the most part were all good, but two notable dishes that pushed me to give 5 stars instead of 4 were the catfish salad and the garlic prawns.

GREAT customer service.  Their spicy IS spicier than the usual so one of the head waiters Mr. TARN "saw"my pain while trying to enjoy our soup and he took it back to "even it out"...what a delight. Their food is delicious...definitely coming back. Thanks to my dentist for recommending

Garlic prawns! A must try 

All the other typical Thai dishes were mediocre. Was pretty expensive for the amount of food they give you. Service was fast, but seems like they were trying to rush you out so they can seat the next party. The restaurant was full within 10 minutes of opening at 530. There was already a couple people there around 515. I would actually give this place less than a 4 stars, but the garlic prawns were amazing! We also got the fried duck with drunken noodles and that was pretty good too.

Get lucky and wait 40+ min. or befriend a Local with the right connections if you want to be fed. 

For a non-local, I've had the luxury of being a semi-frequent patron of Lotus of Siam. I mean, there's a reason why the wait is notoriously long - I've heard that it's nearly impossible to score a reservation in advance. All of the food I've sampled has been pretty much on point. 

The Nam Kao Tod is my absolute favorite appetizer. Now either I've been under a rock for most of my life or that my Thai food palate is extremely minuscule, the latter may be a bit of a stretch considering I am Thai by blood (not a surprise though), but this is the first time I've encountered that dish. To me, it's the perfect marriage of unique flavors that Thai cuisine is notorious for. I MUST know how they fry the rice to get it to be so crunchy. It's amazing! Don't even get me started on the pork which has a similar taste to the Vietnamese appetizer called Nem Nuong. The perfect amount of lime is added to this dish which helps make it unforgettable. This is a must-try...unless you don't eat pork then I suggest asking for the pork to be served on the side. Get it - you're welcome.

I'd say that the only dish that I have ever been disappointed with was their pineapple fried rice. Go figure right? I mean, how can you mess up fried rice? Well, I shouldn't say mess up... I guess you can say that I was taken aback by the strong, Indian curry flavor which masked the entire dish. Like I said earlier, I've had my fair share of pineapple fried rice due to my previous experience with working at a Thai restaurant and being Thai so I have a pretty good sense of what to expect. It may be dependent upon individual tastes, but I personally think that the strong curry flavor really throws off the flavoring of the dish. I mean, it was so strong that I couldn't even finish my dish and I didn't even bother eating my leftovers (and I'm the leftovers Queen). Would I order this dish again? No, there are many other dishes to choose from, and if you are going to order this, be prepared for its' strong taste of curry.

Get the whole fried snapper w sauce on the side. The snapper is peeeeeerfect. The sauce you can add as you please. Get the garlic fried shrimp....and eat the shells! They r so crispy, it.s like chips. Get the crispy fried rice. The rice is puffed instead of steamed. The coconut crispy duck panang was xcellent. The sauce is great. Eat it as soon as it gets to the table because the skin might get saucy. Everything was delicious.
Good food and great atmosphere. Small from the outside but spacious inside. Did not wait in line even though we didn't have reservations.

Good food, strange location.

This place is way out of the way in a commercial industrial shopping center. However, it's worth the effort to get here. They have a great selection of items, but I would highly recommend anything from the Northern menu.
I'm told the chef here is from Northern Thailand and those dishes are his specialty. Be adventurous, it would be a shame to go there and order phad thai. Live a little.

Good service but mediocre food. After reading all the rave yelp reviews about this place, I was really looking forward to trying out some of their classic dishes -- garlic prawns and crispy duck -- but the food turned out nothing special: it was merely comparable to other neighborhood Thai restaurants yet came with a higher price tag (hence two stars instead of three). I guess they are relying on one-time customers for their business.

That said, I somewhat appreciated their Bangkok-style soup which has an interesting, complex flavor thanks to the combination of coconut milk, mushrooms, and lemongrass.

Overall, if you are looking for a reservation-worthy experience, I would recommend to look elsewhere...

Edit: two days after I wrote my review, I received a comment full of insults. I sincerely hope this was a display of an inspired following of this restaurant (in that case, I am happy they found a place where they like to eat) rather than a regular business practice.

Great chef, horrible wait staff and management. The waiter was a socializing so long that our food was cold by the time it came out (10 minutes after the table next to us got theirs, who came in 10 minutes after us). Too bad, the food tastes great, but was legitimately cold. We were starving so we ate half before we sent it back. It's a shame because chef is great but wait staff ruined our meal. Will stick with Chada Thai and Wera Thai, with great chefs and great for wait staff from now on.
Great curries, short rib was tender, duck was great, fantastic coconut ice cream afterwards
Great food and staff.  And great prices.  A definite stop if you ever get to Vegas.

Great food!  Best Thai in town.  Don't expect a very attentive staff.  Make sure you ask for everything you need in anticipation of not seeing your server for a bit.  The wine and beer list is extensive and reasonable. Don't be fooled be the outside of the building.  This is a must try.
Great food- service ok- overall enjoyed!
Great garlic prawns and fried duck in curry sauce. A bit pricey with a automatic 18 percent service charge.
Great menu! There is so much variety here! Came in before 12 noon on a Thursday and had no problem sitting down with a party of 6. Wonderful dining experience.

Great place for Thai food!

4 stars - Panang curry with fried tofu. This dish also had slices of red bell pepper and onion. Panang curry flavor with some coconut milk for the richness. I wish there was more curry in it though, it would have given the dish more depth. 

4 stars - Drunken noodles with seafood. The noodles and the sauce were very tasty. They seafood included shrimp, squid, mussels, and imitation crab. 

5 stars - Thai tea really hit the spot! It was authentic tasting, had a nice sweetness, and was classically given to me in a glass where the tea was separated from the milk at the top of the glass. Mix it with a straw and have a sip! I wish there was crushed ice instead of cubed, that's just how I was raised on Thai tea, but small detail, so still a five in my book. 

Great Thai food at this restaurant, that tastes home cooked. Who could turn that down?

Great place! We ordered the Tom Yum soup with shrimp, pad thai with shrimp, basil chicken and it was all very good! Dessert was fried banana, coconut ice cream. Everything was great including the service.

Great place, great food. It is world famous people came here, television networks came here, I gave it a 4 only because, with a group they split the check in 2 per check, no individual, the lunch portions are too small. I'm 130 pounds and can eat 2 plates. People are telling me come back for dinner. Everything else is great
Hands Down the best food in Las Vegas. Go when they first open,very busy every nite.The drunken shrimp is a must.

Hands down the best Thai Food I ever eat !!!! The Garlic Shrimp is fried to perfection . You can eat the whole shrimp . Yummm ! Probably my favorite dish . The curry duck was so delicious ! Nam Kao Tod was interesting at first because I never tried anything like it. After couple bites , it was addicting . Chinese Broccoli was good and flavorful.  Thai Tea was good . Overall , the food and service was excellent. Can't wait to try more of their dishes !!!!

Hands down, the BEST Thai restaurant I've ever been to. 

Please make sure you get yourself over here if you make it to Vegas and you love Thai food.

We had the beef salad, yellow curry, pot stickers, and tom kha gai. We also had a few ciders and some sake. IT WAS ALL DELICIOUS. Just so good. And a HUGE sake list. 

The restaurant itself was in a run down looking strip mall and once you are inside you can feel how long this place has been in business. They have photos on the wall of customers over the years. The place feels old and well loved.

The dining room was pretty large-two rooms I believe. We waited for our table at the bar and basically got our drinks when our table was ready. The service was friendly and fast and I really can't emphasize how good the food was.

It wasn't a fancy place, but you could certainly take a date here. 

My only complaint would be it was a little loud, but I find that to be true of so many restaurants these days :)

Holy hotness!  This place is absolutely delicious.  I am use to telling Thai places to give me the max hot level they have, but level 8 kicked my ass here. Loved it!  I'll be back next time I'm in town, their menu is long and there's lots to try!  Service was great too.

Holy moly. Everything here is amazing. We had a dry German Riesling that was to do for. The Larb was fantastic. I need the recipe to get my own ground beef to taste that flavorful and amazing. The pork fried rice, drunken sea bass, green curry with chicken, garlic prawns... AMAZING. Definitely recommend coming here.

How can I put this frankly --- it's only the best Thai food I ever tasted in U.S..  Believe me, I had plenty of Thai food in NorCal, SoCal and NY.  

Upon checking out all the Yelp reviews, we decided that we need to get the best three dishes.  Between the two of us, we could only stuff ourselves so much.  LOL.   The three winners were (and they truly were!) the garlic shrimp, crispy duck kang soi and soft shell crab drunken noodles.

Did we make the best choice!  The magnificently jumbo prawns were delicious.  I couldn't decide if I like the shrimp itself more or the fried shrimp shell!   Yes, you can and should and need to eat the shell entirely which is fried separately from the shrimp meat.  That was my fave of the three incredible dishes.

The drunken noodles with the soft shell crab were delightfully cooked.  The crab is fresh and lightly battered.  The noodles are moist but not oily.  We can eat pretty darn spicy but decided to go with only 6/10 and it was perfect.  It was a bit spicy in the mouth without taking out the true flavor of the dish.

The last but certainly not the least dish was the duck kang soi.  The noodles below the crispy duck were soaked with the fat of the duck and the creamy yet light broth.  There were fried noodles on the side.  The combo of the three (duck, broth and noodles) gave it a nice complexity.

The prices are a bit steep and the total came out to be about $86.  But when you think about it, it is a very fair price to pay for the best Thai food I had in U.S.!

I always come back here every time I go to Vegas.  Had I was writing this review 3 years ago, it would have been a 5 stars.  

However, I am disappointed this time around.  The charbroiled shrimp with chili is still good, but the fried rice, the hot and sour soup with sea bass was not very good. The fish was not tender like before.   The sticky rice and mango was too soggy this time.
